LI1beszqHYEAblBTh8oM1w.text: One of the best, freshest, healthiest foods in NYC hands down. Wish there were more gems like this one.

hqZd4w8_xpoEbS2BQfl26A.text: Good: Generally (see below) good and seemingly legitimately healthy food. On-the-bone chicken and grilled salmon specials are well-prepared and usually satisfying. Steak sandwich is good and so are the burgers, generally.  Bad: SERVICE - specifically, the attitude of a sizable handful of the employees, who for whatever reason choose not to practice common courtesy. Big contrast from a place like Grey Dog. If you order takeout, they have a habit of forgetting your drink, so double-check.   Also, food quality is sadly inconsistent, and the chicken strips are plain bad. Only the on-the-bone chicken is good.   Joe

LQ6o3c0iaSb9iQnakJfmkQ.text: Love this place and want to go back!! Great place to bring vegans and non-vegans alike. All the food we had was delicious and good portions. Love the decor and upbeat music. Cute servers too...want to try more of their menu!!

wNnzPNd8F1cO7VdmN1tnzw.text: Solid brunch spot. Pretty crowded but no wait for a party of 5, which is great. We shared the Black Bean Sweet Potato Cakes which were SO good. A bunch of us got the b-fast burrito which was very good too!

7b0dVTm7mkAu9kJoaOjHuw.text: The Salmon burger was amazing, opted for greens instead of the bun and added feta cheese.

oxtyB_ASHTJQW-XIsgMJ8Q.text: I just got the Wild Salmon Burger and it was DELICIOUS!! The reviews about it are super accurate. It's a must try!

xCYTNRHTkaFeg_m3mVfydQ.text: Great service, great people, great food. Very inspiring. Got the beef burger which was delicious but will try the salmon burger next time.

vUx57_ncBAI-cZ3UhPLRnQ.text: The waitstaff was GREAT, so this in no way reflects them or any dissatisfaction with service.  That said, my date and I were super excited to try this place seeing rave reviews, and myself having just become vegan, and she vegetarian. However, apart from the appetizer which was good--the spinach quinoa cakes, the meal was a big let down. The vegan lasagna was simply bad. The sauce was spiced very weirdly, and that flavor permeated the dish. I took 2/3 of it home and reluctantly ate it the next day when I was hungry because I hate waste. It was no better the next day.  My date had the artichoke pasta, which was good, but SUPER garlicky, and both she and I LOVE garlic, so for us to say it was too much means something. Further, that same imbalance of spices that I experienced in the lasagna was--to a lesser extent--also present here. Lastly, the pasta was drowning in oil, so that my date couldn't eat the remaining third of her dish because it was mostly oil. That was ok with her since she was full, and I ate it having not wanted to eat my entree.  She enjoyed her beer, which was a featured or special beer, but my white wine was bleh. We didn't entertain dessert being completely disappointed, despite that we almost always order at least one.  We had a Living Social deal--only $5 off--and would not want to pay full price here. Based on all the rave reviews, maybe a bad chef was in the kitchen this day--but that's not excusable anyway. The only reason I would come back is if I had another deal, was SERIOUSLY craving garlic and wanted that dish again, or to try the veggie burger, which is not listed as vegan, so maybe not. Such a shame, because we love the idea of vegan-friendly, healthy, but delicious places.  For really good vegan food, try any of the Blossoms in the city. I have yelp reviews of them too if you want to check out what I loved :)

G5gzta99orwI3UfolUiOGg.text: Excellent salmon, black rice and salad meal.  Eclectic little restaurant with a casual atmosphere with great tasting food! Waitress was nice but there was a very rude guy that was working the "juice" machine that spoke rude to his colleagues and customers (waitress heard him to and was going to share with manager so maybe he'll be retrained soon)

ZnqmpDqZS6ExsHThcgTxlw.text: This is the first place I feel like rating since I've been to New York but I feel compelled because the food is seriously so so good :)

2XDJef7PWWGBD53G3Xx25w.text: Ok so maybe the food is good for you but that may be it. It lacks good flavor because of it. The gluten free beer does not help as it was hard to drink. Probably a five star place for all the "cool" vegans and gluten free'ers but screw that i like my meat. I tried it out as there were long waits at all other places in the area. Will not go back anytime soon...

FVFQ0GFFx3A1G9xEgYkYFA.text: Had a great dinner here! We were waiting for a member of our party and our server let us hang out at the table with an appetizer and drinks for almost a half hour before he showed up and we ordered - the server was so nice, he told us to just relax and enjoy our drinks.   Highly recommend the parsley hummus and the eggplant tofu lasagna.  The lentil soup was good, not great, but the bowl was HUGE.  Drink menu is organic, slightly limited, but everything my table got was really good.  Overall great service, a quirky vibe, and plenty of delicious veggie options made it a great night.

h3xtttIJY9abqD1qcevWZA.text: Wooha! Just when you thought it couldn't get better!  I've been going to siggys in Brooklyn for a while and was excited to finally check out the manhattan branch. I went for dinner with my sister's family - 2 adults and 2 kids. We were able to make a reservation for the same day and the lovely hostess called to confirm a few hrs before.  As sometimes happens with kids, my sister was delayed getting ready and they were kind enough to push back our reservation by half an hour and still keep the high chair for us.  The food between the two branches is consistent - and consistently good! We had: - spinach quinoa cakes - personal favorite! Quinoa in a texture so different that even my sister who's def not a quinoa fan loved it. - sweet potato black bean cakes - num num! Love me some beansy goodness. Great texture and the sauce on top is excellent. - grilled artichokes - hard to choose between this and the quinoa cakes. It's like picking your favorite child.. The artichokes are of really high quality.  My entree was the daily special of wild king salmon with black rice and fennel salad. So good! The salmon was perfectly cooked to my medium order - and you could actually taste the difference of a quality sourced salmon, and not some frozen piece. The flavors on the plate were beautifully balanced - the richness of the olive tomato salmon crust was toned down by the simple yet properly cooked black rice. The raw fennel salad was quite summery, fresh, and brightened up the dish.  For dessert we got the vegan choc chip cookie and brownie and coconut milk ice cream - I'm not a fan of vegan dessert but these were surprising - the cloves in the cookies is a great twist and the brownie.. Well.. Who doesn't love chocolate!  I have a feeling ill be coming here a lot.  The location and atmosphere really allowed for a comfortable dinner conversation. The decor is pleasant and warm, and the dining room is spacious enough, rare in ny, such that you almost feel isolated at your table, enjoying the meal with your loved ones.

GafkjiDfWQRLmFy4H364gA.text: I went during Presidents' Weekend with 3 good friends and we had a great time . I was concern about the wait time since we went on a Saturday afternoon for brunch. Well, I had nothing to worry about because we were immediately seated. The waiters was awesome and accommodating. My two friends had the Turkey Burgers and they loved it! The roasted potatoes was cooked to perfection and the fresh apple juice washed it down smoothly. I had the Salmon burger with Swiss cheese and it was heavenly, very seasoned and moist! I definitely recommended it. Overall it was great! Check it out!

Z8wR4OdSdLzigh5FPEzABQ.text: Great service great food!  Lots of cool options like organic, gluten free, vegan, etc while also having some of the best beef stew around.  Only reason for not having a perfect score is their menu pricing is a bit all over the place.  Some overpriced dishes, some great value dishes, but all delicious.  And I think nutritious..I think?

XhhAKTJURbCBtzxRwm1YEg.text: Visiting from LA. This place is AMAZING. We had the Eggplant & Tofu Lasagna and the Veggie Burger... and the Roasted Sweet Potatoes. Everything was cooked to perfection. The service was great. I highly recommend this place!

-ReQrYnHUFZMRZA4-P8fIw.text: Siggy's is awesome. It's a pretty much go to place if you are looking for quality food. I love the spinach quinoa cakes, as well as the lentil soup :)

5XReL4yRee4WyMJeM09U7Q.text: One of my local favourites. I've been here for dinner a number of times and every time I vow to come back more often.  Today I came for brunch for the first time. I had the breakfast burrito, which was fantastic and large enough to satiate the appetites of this hungry man. My girlfriend had the lasagne, which was also great - more a hearty, dinner time dish though.  I really love the juices and smoothies here too - the raw almond protein one (with almond butter, almond mile, dates and bananas) was great, but you can't really go wrong with any of them.

zY4n54fXrlhCbzKU32r-_g.text: Pretty affordable vegan/vegetarian dishes. They also have meat dishes as well. I had the turkey burger over vegetables, which tasted like a normal turkey burger on top of greens. Nothing amazing or over the top. They have a bunch of baked goods too, but since many of them are gluten-free / vegan...they have soy, which I'm pretty allergic to :(((. Service was fast for pick up though. Okay portions.

R0HJT2NT_7maX_Z_mF8zyQ.text: I wish I lived closer to this place. The food is delicious and you can feel good after eating because it's local and organic. A friend and I were wandering around the area and stumbled upon this place. We split the veggie sandwich, which had a delicious herb hummus on it, and a SUPER tasty salmon burger. I highly recommend eating here. Our waitress was also very pleasant.

EdC9J4VXPI_F0bh6VQTx_w.text: Really yummy, healthy food choices in good portion sizes! My only compliant is that it a bit expensive, or I'd probably eat here every other day. Got the green alien quencher, which was pretty tasty. Greek style quinoa avocado salad was great, and the perfect protein boost I needed after a work out.  My BFF got the chicken soup and the bowl was huge (like it was twice as large as I thought it'd be). That was really great value, except she couldn't finish it and asked for a container to take it to go...and they gave her this tiny carton that prob held 2/3 of what she left. Lame.

kFDGfpxkXVAJTzUY4l4UIg.text: My boyfriend and I order Siggys at least twice a week. It's my favorite go to spot. The salmon dinner is my favorite with quinoa. It's a bit on the pricey side but the quality of food it always great

HuAgpHGgcXgBNqBH4dWK-w.text: The Wild Salmon Burger + Temperature:: Rare + Choice of Bread: Brioch[e] Bun was tasty, but hardly a $13.07 lunch.

S3PcbmmLiMGtUqCWREDwWg.text: Really good vegan organic food options including Italian inspired dishes (many gf), "magic" burger variations, salads, sides, soups etc. With many options to customize the food by adding extra protein, veggies etc. Excellent drink menu with fresh smoothies, juices and organic drinks. I had the no-noodle eggplant-veggie-tofu ricotta lasagna and home made ginger- mint lemonade.  Amazing taste. Staff is very quick and friendly :) I'll come again for sure!!!

ZPpJBotm2b2IXu40czk6zA.text: We thought the food was super bland.  Ordered both Vegan dishes (eggplant lasagna) and a Salmon dish, each item seemed to lack flavor and character.  The service was also pretty slow and the price was too much for the unexciting food we got.  Still confused about the "Mediterranean" labeling....nothing tasted Mediterranean.   I also think they have a very limited Vegan menu.

WLQ9rst3kT9iPn-ea_EIVg.text: Went here for the first time and loved it! The staff is very nice and the food is great. The portion sizes vary compared the cost. The atmosphere is pleasant and has something for everyone to eat.

H0dA5n6fE_Fc3ozXFXacRw.text: Sooo good!! I had the salmon burger and my partner had the garlic pasta - gluten free. Highly recommend. We took 4 ginger lemon shots to go! Yumm!!

7RoVSZL2UIjipIGOH2N8Dw.text: Alien themed decor is cute.  Food is ok - ordered one of the special items of the day: Penne with Lamb Ragu. The lamb was very tender and moist - clarified with the chef what parts of the lamb were used (leg + shank? if I recall correctly), but the pasta was just okay.  Had the coconut milk-based hazelnut chocolate ice cream and was definitely not impressed. It tasted exactly like a rocky road, and did not have a single hint of the coconut flavor - such a disappointment.  Have to note this: there is only one bathroom for single person only -- also situated RIGHT outside the kitchen door, so there is absolutely no place to stand in wait.

Em69hYCMpm8X1gxIuXQZsA.text: Outpost from BK Heights. Healthy food options in a cute setting (and good vino/ smoothies too). I'm obsessed with their vegetarian parm.

GDZ8zqub-Fv_JmwH9NYoaA.text: I took a friend to dinner to this restaurant. It's kind of like a cafe but a bit fancier. I got the salmon burger which was extraordinary. It was far and away the best I have ever had. My friend had a salad with chicken and loved it. The restaurant itself is quite nice though it is a bit loud from all of the conversation and echo. Still that should not stop you from enjoying an extraordinarily good meal. This place is a winner. I would go back in a heartbeat.

6mz4qf8-e74Rqk-J7wk62Q.text: So far I've been here 3 times with in the past two weeks. My boyfriend and I love it here. It's rare to fine a hot spot that feeds the health conscience deliciously amazing food!!  My boyfriend won't pass up the steak sandwich and I LOOVVEEEE the sweet potato with herbs. Everything we've tasted has been soooooo good. And the service is on point.   We love siggies and we have a new go to place!!

SvaZYFLhOugC9imYEYhW3g.text: I love this place! I love that they had hormone free meets. The roasted chicken strips were tender and had amazing flavor. And they have plenty of fresh vegetable sides that I really enjoyed. The one thing that I would want improved is maybe more desserts without cane sugar in them. But besides that this place is excellent and I highly recommend!

DmyCgjMwX8kEy_AYw5b7Xg.text: **came here with my fam/best girl in the world for a dinner date she's big on being a vegan & she's been hearing good things about this place((but i eats meat like no one's business lol...a line from #babymama lmao))   we came in was not packed was quickly seated  i had the macaroni & cheese & sweet potatoe fries (both good)  my girls had the broccoli & kale (she liked both she enjoyed the kale better, broccoli needed a lil more salt)  we both had waters   waiter was nice,cute and attentive   first time here and enjoyed ourselves   definitely will be back   signed  we love to eat and we do it consistently   mr.von teese & fam xoxox

-QognIbmrhssUVk-hJ_UFw.text: Cool place.... good food, nice servers. I get the hype....you should check it out.

SBlT5EoqOHOgzqNTSVd-Cw.text: Stop in to this little gem on Elizabeth street. The staff is warm and attentive and the food is fresh and delish!  I had the warm vegetable bowl; two of us had the Eggplant veggie and tofu lasagna. The service was prompt, the food was hot and the atmosphere is down to earth and comforting. Highly recommend!

ATvNxhMGIkOZRPvVYeuP-w.text: Wonderful spot with mostly organic menu, terrific friendly staff, and small but good wine/beer list. Grilled baby artichokes were delish. Roasted Zucchini was a bit overdone but still good. Close to Sheen Center where we'll see Sam Baker perform.

UyRMjTkrgloo3qmrUrDfvA.text: Can I give it 10 stars?? Without question the most delicious organic food in the city.  This is my favorite little spot in New York.  I enjoy every meal.  Not sure how they do it but every dish is just right!  And... the service is the BEST.  What a delightful and SWEET staff - zero pretense.  So fun.  Great if you just want to sit and read.  Great for a date.  Great for a big group.  You can't go wrong.

Xiw9GEW6F_x8Hh_rMed_5Q.text: This is place is so damn good. When I used to live in NoHo, I stumbled upon it around 10pm during a sweltering summer day when I was craving a smoothie, and the alien sign outdoor caught my attention. Ever since then (which was summer 2014), I've gone back here about 20 times and I can't say better things about it.  As a San Francisco native, this place makes me feel more at home than anywhere else I've been to in New York. The decor is wooden, rustic, and has string lights and most of the food is organic-- also, all the beer and wine is organic and gluten free as well.   Everything here is fabulous. I've had the smoothies, turkey burger, black bean burger, green quinoa salad (add chicken to it-- it's amazing), the tofu lasagna dish, the arthichoke pasta, and the seafood specials. No complaints anywhere. Every dish is thoughtfully prepared and has a lot of flavor. Not to mention, prices are very reasonable.  Lastly, the staff is unbelievable. Everyone is so nice and will tell you happily about each item on the menu.  Vegetarians and vegans love this place, and so do carnivores. I love you Siggy's!! Please come back to Brooklyn. (They used to have a BK location but it closed down :( Sad.)

dKUoXO55nIrafuZnf2LWFw.text: Just tried this place. Menu looked very interesting. We are vegan and gluten free and they had options. We ordered the black bean burger on rice bread for $12.50 each ! Not worth it. Under cooked, no flavor, says it has pesto sauce, etc. , we didn't see or taste that. Overpriced and not up to pat for what they ate charging.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

OSWQdTQxpM_VWawaDBnWvg.text: I love healthy, veg-friendly joints that don't hurt your wallet and leave you feeling satisfied. New York boasts some pretty impressive vegan/vegetarian-friendly restaurants (though we could certainly use a Native Foods or two!).   Siggy's is no exception.  The Live Earth salad is my standby - a heaping of delicious vegetables on a bed of greens. They're really generous with the avocado too!  The turkey and salmon burgers are top-notch, though I wish they came with sides. They're not super filling on their own, so I'd recommend getting a side of roasted potatoes for an additional $3.50.   They have an extensive selection of smoothies and juices, which all sound really good and aren't too expensive. The almond protein is yummy. I make my own smoothies so I'm quite picky, but Siggy's uses some high-quality ingredients.  Siggy's is chill, cozy and welcoming, though service can be a *little* slow sometimes.   All in all, a great pick for vegetarians and omnivores alike :)

7u3YQC0NYpM0AliFHn1VeQ.text: Love this place!   I went here twice on a recent NYC vacation. The salmon burger was so good, I ordered it again the second time.  I also had the black bean patty appetizer, which was also good.  Their menu marks the gluten-free items - love love love that.  The space is home-y and inviting. The staff is super nice. The food is fantastic. The prices aren't crazy. Quick service. I'd definitely come back!

nqADUmUkyIZyDmORwDW6sA.text: This place is so good. Great service, great food - and I love the fact that the food is mostly organic.

JD1jSaSguGXxr19iiKZ5hA.text: I love this place! High quality food, great prices. I love the roasted sweet potatoes and veggie sides, as well as the artichoke plate. Oh and the vegan desserts are great too!

llgsHQR1WYOLymEb9cfJhg.text: I'm addicted to Siggy's, I order their delivery like 4 times a week!!!  As another yelper said, it's a refreshing option to organic food.  Everything they make is amazing, I'm a big fan of their salmon with vegetables, the mediterrean quinoa salad, the soups, the dates-chocolate-raisins squares, the beef stew, the grilled chicken, hummmm delicious!!!!

V05CVSVXUVldQSMZyiYooQ.text: Egglant Veggie & Tofu Lasagna (vegan) was out of this world, which is an appropriate description because an alien is the unofficial mascot ("Aliens Eat Free!") of this friendly, laid back neighborhood joint. All the food is organic, seasonal, and homemade with unique flavor fusions. Meat and gluten free options are also available. A large variety of smoothies and juices. Service was very on point. Satisfied. Can't wait to come back!

2xqRF0BmqDGRgkEavSgp3A.text: When you walk into Siggy's you will be greeted with the most amazing smell of fresh baked cookies and the knowledge that they're probably vegan and therefore healthy and therefore eat a whole bunch why not!? While I didn't try any of the bakery items (YET) my friend and I sat down for a late lunch and started with the spinach cakes. Which were these two circular spinach cakes with a sort of pico de gallo, but not really pico de gallo, on top. Very yummy, I highly recommend. Then we had to get the vegetarian lasagna because thats what most of the pictures and reviews on here were about- and I am so happy. Its definitely the best decision I've made all day. It's absolutely guilt free, because its all vegetables and theres no pasta in it at all. Its layers of eggplant and broccoli, perhaps cauliflower and then vegan ricotta (whatever that is). We also decided to split the live earth salad which came with a bunch of sprouts on top- which i love. The salad was a little skimpy on the avocado, otherwise everything here is perfect and I can't wait to come back!

Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. I always go back for the lasagna

2YFM0F063aRgNSZM5md9qw.text: Food is good, fresh ingredients, good quality. We had the soup of the day, the Tofu sandwich and a green smoothie. I thought the menu could be a bit more creative/diverse. Our experience  though, was bitter and uncomfortable; the owner was yelling horribly at the kitchen  staff ...very mean and disrespectful...not a good way to run a business lady...I won't be part of it, so won't return.

O8HuBmLqwP4_mDjE9WvRqQ.text: I wasn't impressed by this place at all. It gets a lot of hype because it's a healthy restaurant that caters to the everything intolerant community, which I am a member of. I got a black bean burger wrap and I just didn't enjoy it. The patty was mushy. I got a smoothie and because I adjusted it so much it was extremely expensive. My boyfriend at the time got gluten free marinara pasta, against my suggestion because he is not gluten free. He said exactly what I expected it's okay but I wouldn't eat it again. I think it's very difficult to make gluten free pasta taste good when you've had the real deal. I just am not impressed because it is possible to make vegan and gluten free food tasty. That is why places like by Chloe are so successful.

TKDopL6mmpwov4BzCiy9tQ.text: Overpriced (items that would be cheaper to buy on your own such as cold cuts in sandwiches, etc.) + small and boring portions.

FK9UmY-RwUE8uhHsHU9cFQ.text: Fresh food, good juices and accommodating service (gluten-free bread wasn't listed under sandwiches, but I asked anyway and they had it) in a small but nicely appointed place. We had the soup + sandwich lunch combo for $9.50, and we were all happy with our choices. Note: the soups and sandwiches needed some extra salt, and they only offered what appeared to be table salt (not sea salt).  I know it's not a vegan place, but would have been nice to see some more options.

w8J_6aViO9eokKIbxANZdw.text: I came here with my aunt, uncle, and their two young children. It was a bit of a squeeze as we were at the front table and one of the chairs extended a bit into the walk area.  Between us, we got three of the smoothies (Green Alien Quencher, Almond Protein *Raw, and Coco Peanut Brain) all of which were delicious. For food, we got Black Bean Sweet Potato Cakes, Wild Salmon Burger, Macaroni & Cheese, Eggplant Veggie & Tofu Lasagna, the Farmers Omelet, and the Pancakes.  Both the cakes and lasagna were a weird kind of mushyish texture, although they did taste pretty decent. The Wild Salmon Burger was really good, as was the Farmers Omelet. To me, the pancakes were a weird flavor, but I'm pretty sure that's just because they were buckwheat (I think). The Mac & Cheese was different, but good.  The one thing I really have an issue with is that my uncle asked our waiter if the pancakes were vegan (he eats vegan and wanted to check) the waiter told us they were, but after he'd already had a few bites the waiter came back and said the pancakes actually had egg in them. That's seriously not cool - waiter's should know their menu and if they don't know, they should check instead of just making something up.

UjnFku34VhlWLPuNtl0CtQ.text: the salmon burger. is. everything.   i've literally never tried anything else on the menu, though there are some tempting options! great for an easy lunch, or casual dinner with friends.   the menu is marked with gluten free options, and they offer gf buns for the burgers.

SQUoSHej2GBZ25E8OSuYkw.text: I quite liked the salmon burger on a gluten free bun. The menu claimed it would be well seasoned, and it was. The fresh greens on the side were indeed fresh. Most of all, I liked the atmosphere and can see myself coming back here to try other menu offerings. Great place to meet up for lunch with a close friend to have a relaxed and wholesome meal.

yMDNywl6vXqYuCCChQk0zQ.text: A friendly yet not overly-attentive staff and a fine menu! Lots of space to dine, and the delicious menu options are totally affordable, especially considering the location. Having been to Siggy's twice in two days, I've had the pleasure of trying the absolutely outrageous roasted artichoke salad, which was sprinkled with a tangy, fresh parmesan cheese; the freshest beet carrot apple juice I've had in a while, to which I added some ginger (and when I didn't really like the taste of the first round of the juice, the barista remade it without complaint or extra charge until it was perfect); and a delectable bone-dry cappuccino.  I work in the area, and am stoked to go back for lunch on Monday!

6843ztjkHatHJcgHZCUleQ.text: We have gone here twice and both times the food was amazing. My wife forgets exactly what she got the first time, but I got lentil soup and rice I think and it was so delicious and huge that we took some home and enjoyed it later. We went again last night and had the spinach burger wrap and the spinach cake appetizer thing (I think the latter is just a salsa topped version of the former) and also amazing. Their juices and smoothies are also quite good. We will be going again for sure.

nk2ul-POOQrhnQ2BKOWQVg.text: Excellent tasteful food w a large vegetarian/vegan options.   Only drawback was too much noise for the nonhip; ie me.

qIAEnvrw9wptAwcIa5BDAA.text: They should call this place Siggy's Just OK Food. I've come here twice, and the food just hasn't impressed me. It's vegetarian-friendly in a boring way, and everything is kind of bland. Come here if you want a lot of vegetarian choices but few flavor choices. Everything is healthy enough.  Service was fine, not notably good nor bad. An underwhelming experience all around.

94l19YOvGiN2HX64bRrwmw.text: So great. Diverse menu full of healthy meat, vegetarian and vegan options. Fantastic organic wine selection. Highly recommended.

QTl6-ulmrYUHvnytAUA4jQ.text: I've only been here once, but I loved it. I'm not even a vegetarian.   My friend and I came here on a Friday or Saturday night. As with most vegetarian/vegan places on weekends, it was busy, but not too crowded. We both ordered the no noodle lasagna (I think it was vegetarian?), and we both loved it! The sauce was so flavorful, and I didn't miss the noodles. We were both so full after we finished it, so we didn't get a chance to order anything else. For $15, I think that was a pretty great meal. Spending less than $20 after tax and tip on a satisfying dinner is very rare in Manhattan, so I was very happy about that. On top of the more than reasonable prices, it seems like Siggy's really cares about where their ingredients come from and providing delicious, healthy foods. I love supporting places like this.   The ambience is nice, and would also be great for casual dates. The menu seems to have a little something for everyone, although it is mainly vegetarian. Our server was very nice. I did think it was weird that she asked if we wanted bread (We said yes, but I was worried that we'd be charged a ridiculous amount for it. We weren't), but I guess that makes sense since there are probably a good number of diners that are gluten-free. I'll definitely be returning.

_uT5PxuPWLeCW1T5PBxZHg.text: Siggy's is great. Reliable quality and conscience. Don't listen to the whiners. Try the excellently priced salmon burger on the gluten free bun, which has the best texture of any gluten free bun on earth.  Love Siggy's.

GgAlYB8oXGAidW_lvcoFqw.text: ordered grass fed beef burger, about 13 bucks. ordered veg Quinoa, add tofu, about 20 bucks.  want to order the shot - wheat grass, not available, little disappointed.  1 star given to the medium cooked patty, it's more close to well done, but it's ok.  2 star given to the seasoning of the patty, it has outstanding cumin flavor, n  i like the green touch ( my guess is shredded cilantro). it's not boring, not the fatty or dry patty u normally get.  1 star given to the bun, just right.  1 star given to the wide selection menu.  one imperfection to me (my only personal flavor) is i don't like uncooked onion, chef, hope u have an idea to perfect it.  ** my friend n i both love our food. not just tasty, our stomach love the food too. :p  we will be back, next time i will try vege lasagna.

xFX2InydNYvTwaAdhqCyLA.text: Awsome place. Got the Kabab sandwich and it was fantastic, fresh and clean. Reasonably priced for the area. Very friendly staff. Would definitely recommend if your hungry for lunch.

ZJsZvCQU_CdPcfTr1iapXQ.text: For the most part, I'm all for efforts that encourage the consumption of "good for you" food - food that's raised sustainably, organically, and locally wherever possible. When a friend of mine suggested Siggy's for dinner one evening, I was slightly hesitant given the amount of emphasis the business placed on these key words, but a quick skim of the reviews and menu beforehand, and I was pretty much won over.  Arriving just shy of 7PM, I was greeted by a fairly casual, spacious dining area, complete with a (juice) bar at the front with the majority of seating towards the back of the room. Despite the fact that the majority of tables weren't taken, I had to wait until my friend arrived before we both could be seated. We were quickly given menus, the daily specials, and glasses of water, and spent the next few minutes trying to figure out what to order.  Siggy's should be applauded on their commendable menu. Not only does it utilize "good for you" food, it incorporates them across a whole spectrum of dishes, including salads, soups, sandwiches, burgers, pastas, and more. There's something for every taste available, and specific dietary allergies or restrictions are accommodated as well.  I opted for the Beef Burger ($11) with a side of Roasted Herb Potatoes (+$4). The burger is lightly seasoned, topped with lettuce and tomato, and sandwiched between two soft buns. The patty was a little overcooked beyond my requested medium, but was juicy and had a good flavor to each bite. The roasted potatoes were a good decision, in hindsight, as they were tender and warm on the inside, but with a satisfying crisp exterior, and generously seasoned and salted. My friend's Vegan (& Gluten Free) Lasagna was equally impressive, comprised of roasted eggplant slices as substitutes for the pasta, and filled with layers of vegetables, tofu ricotta, and soy cheese in between. An aromatic garlic tomato sauce rounded out the plate, and made for a filling and healthy entree.  I'd come back to Siggy's, without a doubt. Serving tasty, yet healthy, food is a balance that some places have yet to find, but this restaurant has certainly found its stride. Although I have yet to see an alien [1] dining here, they must have good taste if that's the case.  -- [1] A sign outside the restaurant reads "Aliens Eat Free".

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Burger + Roasted Potatoes
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Burger + Roasted Potatoes
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegan Lasagna

540R7uZYRkLwqA1F1b65UQ.text: I've been wanting to try Siggy's for some time and even more so after I had seen her compete on Chopped on Food Network a while ago.  Finally went on a Friday night around 7pm.  Surprisingly, we didn't have to wait to be seated.  Yay!   I got the gluten free, vegan lasagna.  It was freakin delicious as many other reviewers have mentioned on Yelp.  It was also HUGE and I couldn't finish my last bite of it.  Some yelpers noted that the lasagna has soy cheese.  I didn't want to have fake, processed soy cheese but it turned out that they no longer put soy cheese in the lasagna.  It's just layers of veggies, tofu ricotta and marinara sauce - perfect!! The marinara sauce was a bit too sour/strong for my taste but i still freakin loved it!!!  Hubby got the salmon burger.  He said the salmon patty melted in his mouth but the portion was too small for him.  Oh well - how many NYC restaurants serve portions big enough for a grown man? We were more than happy to move onto another place for his second bite.   Besides the great tasting dishes, we also loved the decor of the restaurant!! Loved the alien theme!!! It was just such a cute place!!! All the servers were super cool and nice too.  The door and windows were open in the front and the back windows were open as well.  Both the front and the back seating areas were nice and cozy.  Would definitely and certainly return to Siggy's soon.

I only got the chicken wrap, but it was very solid. I liked that they used organic chicken. It definitely seemed like a good compromise between taste and health. A lot of other healthy options on the menu that I will probably try in the future.

My sandwich was packed with hummus, sprouts, carrots and tomato. I could barely fit it in my hands. Half soup and sandwich is $12. They also had amazing smoothies- pricey at $7.

fjnmZbwPKDFi2xCp2-gjiQ.text: I stopped by Siggy's last week to insulate my stomach before a cocktail only event. The place is a bit hidden, located where Elizabeth St ends but spottable with this super cute alien sign out front. The inside is super casual and homey with a fair amount of seating in the back and more alien artwork!     I ordered the salmon burger and it was whipped up in about 10 minutes and OMG it is legitimately one of the best burgers I've ever had. The salmon patty was ridiculously juicy, well seasoned(as advertised) and just tasted so fresh -- held together by one of the softest, lightest, fluffiest burger buns ever. The avocado and vegan mayo was super creamy and the perfect accompaniment along with the fresh, crisp greens. I can't remember the last time I ate so quickly -- I finished it in about 8 seconds and OMG I just can't say enough good things about this fantastic burger. I honestly do not know how I will be able to bypass this burger and try anything else on the menu..although the treats by the counter looked mighty good too.   I will most definitely be back time and time again. Salmon Burger. Get it! It is INCREDIBLE. If healthy always tasted this good...  (Going tomorrow.)

sIwiu36YLqJNLgIlOj3nOQ.text: Grass fed beef kabob and beet salad were amazing.  Smoothies are fantastic.  Been twice and love it!

7Tp-DantB884ByUPk1fMkg.text: Can we stop giving places extremely high reviews simply because their branding and ambiance is good? I have eaten here several times and vastly preferred the food when this space housed the now-defunct "Rice". "Organic" is great and everything, and the space is warm and welcoming, decked out in inviting wood and serviced by very kind and professional wait staff. Because of this, I might even come here again in a pinch.  But every time I look at this high rating, I think "maybe last time was just my misfortune".  No more.  Every time I order chicken breast here, it is overcooked and barely chewable. Everything else on the menu is extremely bland, and the seasoning on most dishes is best defined by "mildly salted." The prices, in my opinion, exceed the "$$" for the quantity that you get, and given the extremely mediocre quality of the preparation, (regardless of how fresh or "organic" the ingredients are), I can't be complicit in this mass Yelp-aided deception any longer.  Come here for a warm, quirky vibe, kind staff, and to pretend that you are doing something extraordinarily kind to your GE tract. Do not come here for well-priced, flavorful food and tender, correctly-cooked meat; you will not get any of the latter.

KF8h7GEPXNk87sP85i2bXg.text: The service here is amazing! Which is something I wish I could say about the food.  Came here with a friend for a healthy meal, and while we were pleased with plenty of options, the dishes we had were only so-so. The chickpeas were flavorless and the salad was meh, with limp leaves and sad tomatoes.  But everyone here is very sweet! So I hope the food gets better.

iL5I-qY3eKVgNL3y8F8FWA.text: Although this place is listed as vegan, they do serve non vegan dishes. They have sandwiches, salads, burgers, etc.  I tried the hummus as an appetizer and it was delicious and seasoned well. For my entree I had the salmon burger. The portion was good. I was too full to finish it so I had to remove the bun and eat the filling. Next time I will opt for no bun and just greens for an extra $1. I added the roasted potatoes to my entree for $4. They were so yummy and cut into thin slices like potato chips.  For drinks, they serve a variety of smoothies and juices. I tried the green alien quencher which has cucumbers, kale leaves, mint, pineapple and orange juice. It was very refreshing. I would definitely come back to try the other drinks and also a vegan dish.

QF17-5LzoiyhylYGdL04YQ.text: Absolutely awesome experience. Skirt steak was of the hook. Organic and gluten- free over mixed greens with lemon vinagrette dressing. I will be back for sure. Also gluten free beer and great customer service, Cannot ask for more.

mFKP5q3EXJNOlSoDNOtCiw.text: This place is all about good, clean flavorful food! I ended up here on a weeknight after some shopping in SoHo. This is what you come to expect when you see a restaurant that appeals to vegans and meat eaters alike, flavor! Every dish we had used fresh veggies to improve the meal.   We started off with some hummus. There was an extra $2 up charge to get it with cut up veggies rather than bread. No big deal. The hummus was the right balance of garlic, spices, and they add parsley. The parsley really gives the hummus a fresher, clean taste.   I would definitely recommend getting the chicken soup. We added rice to it and that gave it some extra heartiness. The broth was excellent and really brought together the soup.   We split the flank steak sandwich and the chicken hero. We got both on the multigrain bread. You need a hearty bread with either sandwich to stand up against the weight of all the meat and toppings. Both were a good size sandwich. I loved the mushrooms and carmelized onions on the flank steak. The marinade on the chicken hero should be sold by itself.    Great experience. Fun staff. Check out their restaurant grade on their door. You will have a good laugh.

8kGmUoiUCaW24Po4mhkX6g.text: Came here with a non-vegan, non-gluten-free but health-conscious friend who was perhaps more wowed by the food than I was (and I was pretty damned impressed), because she decided to order a vegan gluten-free dish and she LOVED it.  We didn't plan it at all but we ended up getting the same thing: Eggplant Veggie & Tofu Lasagna, even though there were plenty of vegan gluten-free items clearly marked as such on the menu. Our very helpful server highly recommended it, especially because it had their house-made garlic tomato sauce that he said we would love.  And man, he was NOT kidding. The balance of garlic and slight sweetness from the tomatoes was like crack. I think I would have happily drank that sauce as a soup or something all by itself.  I've had many vegan gluten-free attempts at "lasagna" with various degrees of success, but this Eggplant Veggie & Tofu Lasagna was perhaps the most satisfying one of them all. Lots of tender vegetables and both tofu ricotta and soy cheese. YUM.  I definitely will want to come back and try the other dishes on their menu!

Bcw0jnVi2Ye5j9jLs9-inA.text: Ooooohmygod yum.  As everyone says, excellent salmon burger. I had mine over greens but I hear the bread is great and I think it's more fitting/filling to bite into it as a burger.   My rec for brunch is the shakshuka. perfect poached eggs. Thick delicious tomato broth with all the yummy pepper/onion. Loooove the hot sauce they had on hand.   Super delicious black bean and sweet potato cakes were awesome and a pretty decent amount of food for only 8.   Fantastic array of raw juice/green drinks and smoothies.   I had the berries wine cooler for brunch and man I am a happy tipsy lady.   Service is a bit slow because they're so busy and everything is made so fresh to order. They won't seat you until your whole party is there on account of the limited space though. Very nice smiley super organic vegan-y zeny staff (And one snooty girl).

O19zAu6L7erhDBWbPq-zqw.text: I'm not a vegan or vegetarian. I don't lead a gluten-free, lactose-free, or paleo diet. I enjoy tofu, but I don't need it dressed up as a turkey or pretend beef. I don't swear by organic, gmo-free foods either. I grew up in an Chinese household so I eat tofu regularly and I love the taste of most and any soy product. I will admit though that I do not like tempeh. Tempeh is dry, tasteless, bland, and really does make me think of cardboard. But every now and then I'm in the mood for good food, cooked clean, and eating without feeling like I need a nap afterwards. We're in the trend of comfort food, greased up, fried up, anything caloric bombing app, entree, and dessert. Well, Siggy's presents a much needed break.  Siggy's is one of those places where you want good food, a relaxing environment, a bit of a lively ambiance without it being overwhelming. You leave feeling guilt-free and in the mood for a walk because you can and not because you need it.  Here's what we ordered: - Eggplant Tofu Ricotta Lasagna: RECOMMENDED. This is a big, big portion. I don't know why everyone has this broccoli-esque appalling reaction to tofu. I love tofu. I can eat it by itself and think it's enjoyable. I don't think it tastes like a bland sponge. But then again I also love broccoli. When you get the plate in front of you, you can't even tell it's made of tofu. There is roasted, thinly sliced eggplant, grated carrots liberally distributed throughout and an absolutely wonderful tomato garlic sauce. I loved it. For all those who are not vegan, ask for the freshly grated Parmesan. They gave you a good amount of it to sprinkle on top. That added richness, depth, and saltiness from the cheese adds a whole new level.  - Salmon burger on sliced multigrain: RECOMMENDED. This was delicious! You can tell there are no fillers when you bite into it and all you see is the fish flaking apart. I hate it when you bite into a salmon patty and it looks like a ground up meatball with a lot of breadcrumbs and egg as a binder. The avocado added a perfect amount of creaminess. I'm indifferent about the vegan mayo. I honestly didn't think it was necessary. They probably should switch it out for something different like roasted red pepper/sundried tomato spread, olive tapenade, or maybe even a sriracha aioli. Otherwise, this was a deliciously satisfying salmon burger.  Service is friendly, attentive, and overall welcoming. The restaurant is comfortable and relaxing.

GWpuQrdZETqRxlVk7_i45w.text: I always thought vegan restaurants were a bit weird, but I really enjoyed myself at Siggy's. I ordered a whole grain pasta with pesto, olive oil, and artichokes. Simple and delicious. The dish itself had a bit too much olive oil but it was enough for me to dock a star for them. Nothing a bit of olive oil scooting couldn't fix. Next time I'm in town I definitely want to come back and try some of their other dishes. :D ENJOY!  Staff is so friendly. You can't not have a good time!

UjQw-0R7_p4Yl7wQz74EgQ.text: This is my absolute favorite restaurant ever! I keep telling everyone about it! The food, the staff, the atmosphere! I eat a very strict diet, so the healthy options on the menu are amazing! Definitely try the salmon burger with avocado and the greens! I can't wait to be back in NYC and hit up Siggy's!  Oh, and the hummus is to die for!

UIkyRY1b3QCyDoGXoF46Yw.text: Siggy's was very good. Excellent selection of organic meals, in season. Loved the juice, and the quinoa/spinach patty. The mac and cheese was also very good. If you're vegan, this would be an excellent choice. Limited brunch options (I had been hoping for eggs). Solid vegetarian food, no doubt.

bCp0zsMMSg2iNzfUnAtYQQ.text: I am so sad that Siggy closed their restaurant in Brooklyn heights! Love the food and service, it is as pricy as other organic restaurants would cost. Guess Manhattaners would appreciate it a bit more. But every time I go there, it is always full. Why did you leave? Come back to Brooklyn!

8hfPug0B-s-kM8_G_uFsjg.text: I had been spoiled by organic food while living in California and missed it dearly.   Love this place. Had the salmon burger and peanut smoothie. Amazing!!! Service was great too  Other notes: - juice bar - no fried food - organic centric - reasonably priced ($11 for a salmon burger)

rg5t05BHSQec1FmRfZpnIA.text: This is my favorite go-to healthy-yet-delicious spot.  Everything I've had has been good, and the prices are very reasonable.    Also, I get delivery the majority of the time and they are consistently quick to get the food delivered.   Definitely recommend if you want to eat out or don't feel like cooking, but still eat healthy and well.

twnmSTvLFtLAKFbG2b_Sdw.text: Simply amazing food. I've had the salmon dinner, salmon burger, chicken soup, eggplant and tofu lasagne, grass fed burger (delicious), many different salads, and the breakfast burrito is out of this world!!!  Green juices are great!  Everything is delicious and wholesome tasting.  Highly recommend this restaurant.  However, I always ordered take out.  As a dinner spot, it is extremely LOUD.  :-)

8H7n0ZzaDz3fcmc9OmY-1w.text: I'm between a 4 and a 5 on this one. Really tasty food that's also fresh, organic, health-conscious. I've been about 4 times and have tasted the vegan lasagna, beef stew, salmon burger, turkey burger, parsley hummus (all 4 times by the way), sweet potato fries, and Iron Immune juice. Nothing has disappointed. I happen to live nearby, but would travel to get comfort food that I don't feel least bit guilty about.

sFhgz_x72LPQGP3uFg8FLw.text: So glad to finally have come here! Amazing juices, salads, etc. Great post-gym or healthy lunch spot and very cozy inside.   I had a green juice and the turkey burger over salad with caramelized onions. The turkey burger was very well seasoned and delicious over greens.   The service is very friendly, patient and warm. I can't wait to come back and try additional menu items.

l-18ytK86Emuf4jd9Pcukw.text: I had the flank steak sandwich.  DELICIOUS!  It hit the spot-- it's organic, tasty and healthy.  Everything in moderation.  The atmosphere is inviting, the people friendly and you just feel good being there.  Love the decor and the food health announcements.  LOVE IT!  Thank you for a great lunch :)  Oh, and I had the FRESHLY SQUEEZED OJ.   Hit the spot.

nDTOt13kJDAtXo0snoEKTg.text: Wow. Deserves 5 stars. U know those places that r so good u want to go back for the next meal? Yea.  I got the flank sandwich with a side salad. SOOO good. Hit the spot. Great portions for the price. Great thoughtful service, great ambiance-u want to sit there all afternoon, great music.   I would come here all the time if I lived in ny. We ate around a LOT in nyc, and this has got to be one of my fave meals because of all the real flavors made with real foods. Not a heavy grease bomb, yet also so hearty and satisfying.

OL2puK-ckVp-UW8LGrspjQ.text: Siggy's Good Food is a cute, vegetarian-friendly spot in SoHo. I ordered the Veggie Burger, which was melt-in-your-mouth amazing. The texture, the height, the amount of food - It was all perfect. My only wish is that it came with some side because adding potatoes was another $5. It's a tad pricey. Definitely recommend it to all those who love a fresh, healthy eating experience. I've also been to the location by the Brooklyn Bridge, which is a smaller and quieter spot.

81zTtfQcs578OroDL6mgrA.text: I've heard good things about this place for a while. I purchased a living social deal, so I had a push to finally go. I ordered the pasta with artichokes - yum yum yum.   This location was easy to find. I was greeted and seated right away. There was plenty of seating: tables (for 2) and semi booths alone the wall in the back. I love the open window in the rear and the artwork.   My server was very knowledgeable about the ingredients and made great recommendations. Just a note, they serve animal products and plant-based meals. It's good place if you have some non-vegan friends/family.   I definitely plan to come back.

1vFxxe-IMBfKewDdEQlL-w.text: Excellent food and service. Everything was really rather tasty and they were EXCELLENT with my plethora of food allergies. Could not say enough good things about this place--my girlfriend is a foody who likes to try everything and we still ate here three times during our week in NYC. The only negative I have to say is that their gf rice bread is a little lackluster in flavor as ALL rice bread is; however, their homemade mayo and excellent portion size more than made up for it. I'm used to getting hosed on gf options and paying full price for a tiny sandwich, but they just gave me 2! Awesome. Though, per the bread, another restaurant I ate at in NYC used Everybody Eats gf bread and it was phenomenal--I called the waitress over because I thought I'd gotten regular bread by accident! You all might check them out. A way to go from excellent to phenomenal!

nhP92v7mgbOJz_PNPXRP5w.text: Charming decor, friendly and efficient service, and yummy food. We came for a midday snack and each had the soup/sandwich combo. The veggie sandwich was delicious and fresh, the slaw was good, and the side of beets devine.

GemWmpIcAcuV71dhQKTfWw.text: The restaurant offers standard fare for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike.   There is nothing wrong with the food, per ss; it's just not particularly creative.   Also, service was brusque and robotic.

vHT0LE5fin83PrqXcWSyCg.text: what a great find this place is ! very cozy with amazing food for the vegan in mind,also has enough selection for carnivores as well. We had the soups to warm us up, coconut chicken and wild salmon for dinner. All the food was delicious, theres also a great fire place. The smoothies and juices all looked great and the cookie and brownie desserts although expensive were real yummy. Highly recommend this spot. And on a side note, this place is loaded with women so you know its great for a date.

LX7GLn-vc1_aK7TAKO2PLw.text: A great food experience from start to finish. Great and extremely friendly service, charming and cozy interior with little flicker lights strewn from the ceiling, and of course the most important part, the food!! Everything on the menu is delicious and beautifully presented, yet it's so healthy and good for you. I got the wild caught salmon burger and my bf had the organic beef burger. We also had the sweet potato cakes as an appetizer and organic stouts, mmm the best way to start a meal. Overall I still can't figure how the prices are so reasonable for such a high quality of food. Can't wait to return to try the rest of the menu.   Tip: sit by the window in the back, there's a beautiful little courtyard/garden that you can overlook :)

qLjUvQez8uTcrNOzNvF7Pw.text: When I first tried this place, I initially did not care for it. When I went back the second time, boy was I wrong!! The turkey burger with sweet potatoes is so incredibly delicious! Usually eating burgers leaves me feeling sick and heavy. Not this one. Having a gluten & dairy intolerance is hard going out to eat. I was able to have a wonderful burger on a gluten free bun without having to go to a vegan restaurant with no meat! Highly recommend this place for people with sensitivities or just anyone who wants a good healthy meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey burger on a gluten free bun with salad and potatoes. To die for!

77UZOdueGekjqFuhzBHiaQ.text: The eggplant tofu lasagna was just ok. The lentil soup with brown rice is good. In my experience with this place, everything could use a little salt and maybe some pepper.

bW-GRzie00zmAbA2mSUsvA.text: I'm still thinking about the meal I had here. So fresh and yummy. I highly recommend this restaurant whether your a carnivore, herbivore or you're just a plain whore. You will not be disappointed!

APYVC2odhnHcXiJ0xNYm5Q.text: Something about this place feels a bit West Coast crunchy--all those young cute friendly hipsterish male waiters maybe? Baby boomer customers? or was it my preternaturally cheery and chatty pony-tailed waiter? But the chicken strips had an appealing herbaceous, olive oil, flavor and were fairly moist. The brown rice was nutty and perfectly cooked (bit of olive oil there too, apparently) . Both portions were more than ample. Def a good option for a simple meal.

lizbHaK7HqFkS-hrAzt-yQ.text: So disappointed in myself that I just discovered this place. Just so amazing. From the food, to the service, to the beer, just a class A establishment. It's perfectly healthy for anyone with allergies yet the best restaurant ever if you don't. The almond coconut crusted chicken Milanese is so good u had to come back two days in a row (after my first time here) to order it again. My girlfriend considers herself a foodie and can't stop talking about it. A must GO

At5rt3kLMMocJhBNMS711g.text: Not an organic-only eater, but I was really happy with the wild salmon burger! Portion was huge and delicious. Also our server looked like Zayn Malik.

nr2Y5P3persv5E2npJi77g.text: Excellent dinner, no guilt involved! I was disappointed that they no longer serve their veggie burger, but the grilled vegetable sandwich was very good. I really recommend the grilled baby artichokes and the black bean sweet potato cakes. Yum!!

sn05fOXEwPoavTtpfEW3Lw.text: Dear SIggy, I do not know you, but you have proved yourself to be a person of the highest esteem. I must agree that the food at the restaurant that bears your name is indeed good. Very very good.  To be more specific, the food that was very very good was: grilled baby artichoke plate, black bean sweet potato cakes, the moroccan turmeric chicken (which might have been one of the best chicken dishes I've ever had), the eggplant veggies and tofu lasagna (served in a big bowl with tomato sauce, so hearty, so delicious), and the turkey burger.  Thank you Siggy for providing a warm, cozy place to eat delicious food, drink delicious wine, and talk to friends.

hyHr723g-3LB6U9ZsUs9xA.text: I arrived at 11:45 AM on a Tuesday. I got the idea that I beat the lunch rush. It's really accessible from the Bleeker street station  I ordered to go (all vegan): the requisite Eggplant/tofu/veggie lasagna - tofu and boccoli/carrot/onion mash between layers of sauteed eggplant and smothered in a hearty marinara. The Garlic and artichoke pasta with tofu fingers. A cookie and a brownie  It was all delicious. The pasta was buttery (flavor not actual butter) and the lasagna was a good meal. (I'll update on the brownie once I eat it) The cookie wasn't really my style: it was unique with the clove taste and the crumbly/chewyness - but I ate the whole thing.  I thought, from the reviews, there would be more vegan variety on the menu - these options are delicious but there are only 4 items that are vegan. I still struggled to decide between those 4. But don't go in with a party of 6 vegans and think you'll all be getting something different.  The staff is adorable. :)

srAdLTQn5g7eAACaX0o68A.text: Really great options for every good preference, great atmosphere, great staff, upbeat world music, and more. I respectably love their flavorful artichoke and posts dish (vegan if without added parmesan) and also Grilled Baby Artichokes Plate.

p3XJ7__TTJ8URAFJTw1K1w.text: Siggy's is everything that can be good about food.   You're probably wondering if I'm being a bit hyperbolic. To that I ask, have you eaten here? If the answer is no, then you don't have the authority to question me yet. If the answer is yes, you have eaten here before, then why are you reading Yelp reviews for the place? Don't you have something better to do? Like getting back to Siggy's?  The food here is healthy and delicious. Best of all, it's affordable and without all the typical pretension you get from restaurants with all organic, locally sourced ingredients.  It's more hippie than haute. More Austin than Manhattan. I mean they freaking have drawings of aliens all over.   So what are you waiting for? If you're looking for a good, guilt-free meal, get yoself over to Siggy's. Especially if you're an alien because aliens eat free there.

5rIlAKy7KfKfo7sEZMM-gw.text: Great food. Very hipster like place. The staff were incredibly nice. Will definitely come back.

584rBTEOvlfX9y1CoqC12g.text: Finally came here for dinner with my mum on a cold, rainy, Saturday night. I called 15 minutes in advance and asked if there were any seats available - they told me to get there as soon as I could because they cold only hold the seats for 20 minutes. So we made it in time.  Mum got the wild salmon burger - and she loved it. This meant that it had to be good because my mum's a somewhat picky eater. I got the eggplant veggie & tofu lasagna - and it was SO good. Like I'm craving it right now so good - and it's really filling for a vegetarian/vegan dish. The best part was that I didn't need to fall into a food coma afterwards - I felt ready for a yoga class (and I ended up doing a bit at home).  We also got the red beets, orange & kale salad with the optional goat cheese. I hadn't realized that my mum disliked goat cheese, so I ended up eating all of it - which made almost every bite of salad I had seem a bit too sour or too tangy. If I hadn't eaten all that goat cheese, I may have enjoyed the salad more (my mum certainly liked it) - but I did have all of it, and my taste buds were very mad at me whilst eating the salad.  Overall, I'd definitely come back - it was a cute place and that lasagna was the perfect meal for a cold and rainy day. (Or just any day, really.)

XZT0PuPaaXgg2LmZ-Ecueg.text: I can not get over how AMAZING the eggplant & tofu vegan lasagna was!! The tomato sauce was so delicious. The service was great, ambiance is very nice and all the food was so good that I'm wishing I was there right now. Portions are very large as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggplant &amp; tofu lasagna. My friend had the beef ragu dish which she also loved!

wQLZ5VopJ2MgKJuag8Y7Mg.text: Excellent. Great portions and everything tasted fresh. The staff was very kind. Will definitely be revisiting soon.

p2cL0IX3pJ5jD0l0e-hUMA.text: I found this restaurant on Yelp after walking out of a play on Bleeker.  Siggy's is a fun, natural and organic bistro. This place is casual and reminds me of the 1980's when my parents switched all of the food in our house to preservative free "health food." The ketchup and mustard on the table are organic and from smaller companies. The food is GREAT! I had a turkey burger, my husband had a beef burger, and our friend, who is a vegetarian, had a wrap. The service is kind. They appreciate your business.

sBgNZtBRdeJOkxn68CAGbw.text: What a charming surprise! Healthy, tasty, simple food that meets the approval of vegetarians, vegans, gluten-freegans, and meatatarians. Great space. Feels like a restaurant you'd find in a place like Deadwood, Oregon but you're in NoHo.

uhK_emJpzfbZc7v9gwyZxg.text: Tried this place out due to past reviews and I was not disappointed. The website makes it seem like this would be like a diner place, but went to the location in Manhattan and the atmosphere could not have been cuter! I do think they should redue the website because it gives off a different vibe then how it really is.   The food was delicious, I had the salmon burger and our friends had the salmon dinner with black rice and kale. All delicious! Service was great, ended up staying pretty late and found out at the end of the day the wait staff eats after the shift. You know the food is prepared well if the wait staff will sit down and eat it! Lots of Gluten Free options very well marked on the menu is a fabulous added bonus!!

jX3GsvK-QLRJ-CoMp5JlBQ.text: I wish there were more places like Siggys around. Would be nice to he able to go to a place like this and get a healthy meal like this in Queens too ..hint Everything I've eaten here is good. I particularly like the salmon burger and the lentil soup is pretty good also. Nice atmosphere and service.

8Vkczr0q0nUIDIOKkgFQEQ.text: Ah a health conscious restaurant, finally! Love the butterless, creamless, and starchless menu! Just love it. So good comfort food that does not make you feel bad about it. Had the vegan lasagna and the daily special of lamb sandwich. LOVED BOTH. The lamb, so tender and full of spice, and did not carry any of that lamb smell that is sometimes annoying. The lasagna was super filling without all the added calories. You could see a lot of shredded veggies hidden inside all the goodness. Also, the tomato marinade - ah!  Tried the Almond Protein (Raw Almond Butter, Dates, Banana & Almond Milk). Was pretty good! A bit too sweet to my taste, more like a milkshake. But perfect dessert. The people there were so nice and chill. Will def visit again.

Xk8HPM40ffLAZrhy-6W1TA.text: This place was great. Low key, comfortable, and delicious. Locavore friendly. Super cool menu filled entirely with organic and local items/ ingrediants. I ordered the Moroccan Chick Pea and Spinach Bowl and added organic chicken to it. Paired the bowl with an organic Pale Ale. Also remember thinking about ordering the King Salmon. This is the kind of place you can come feel like you are being spoiled, but not overindulging-- and-- the establishment is really clear that they care about the "food miles" of their ingredients.

iELF84Hg6WYRh1NQnpSZrg.text: Good food. Very home made feel to it. I wouldn't say this place is a fit for foodies. Great veggie juices.

jbNPZS8sp118zUbFWzrF8Q.text: Been here twice now and LOVE Siggy's.   Service is always very friendly, efficient, and pleasant. Major plus!  Food is always very well done, fresh, and delicious. Have yet to be disappointed.  Location/design is fantastic. Very convenient and the entire restaurant - as you approach from the street, and inside - is gorgeous. You can tell those who work here enjoy it and take pride in what they do.   Can't wait to visit Siggy's again!

ahBHu-BsM3CQLgi6awWURg.text: Great neighborhood casual restaurant. The vibe is really chill. The food is good and the service is too. Siggy is new to Charlotte Via NYC so go show her and her crew some love. I had the fresh ginger tea and the Mediterranean tofu and veggie sandwich and it was delicious. I'll definitely be back for more

79ZWBF8WDBm5ag3cgVnRlQ.text: Siggy's is one of those places that proves you that eating healthy doesn't mean eating boring and tasteless food...  I first went to Siggy's because it was close to my hotel and since I had to run a half marathon the following morning I wanted to eat healthy. Well, I have to say that after that I repeated several times with no reason more that enjoying its food.   My favorite is still the wild salmon burger. It comes with lettuce, avocado and (vegan) mayo. All that in a nice brioche bread. Delicious!  Enjoy!

8fqOUB9CDs_s4dq_aF1mrA.text: Cool little restaurant w/ great food and beer selection. I had the pulled chicken hero and a few bites of my wife's grilled cheese. Good stuff! Recommend the locals go and support.

a22iVS5zFUkOwKTeyi7Yyg.text: I visited on a Saturday for lunch with my friend who is a vegan. Admittedly, I don't embrace the vegan lifestyle and don't frequent vegan eateries often, so I ordered something pretty simple & really enjoyed it.   The ambiance was lovely & the service was great. We sat at a cute table near the window and we had perfect weather.   I customized an egg white omelette with spinach & mushrooms. It came with a tasty side salad and really nicely seasoned potatoes (I'd ask for them well-done next time). And, you also got an order of multigrain toast.   I wouldn't order the juice again, and instead would get an iced tea or something, but overall it was definitely one of the better egg omelettes I've had in NYC.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Egg white omelette with spinach &amp; mushrooms &amp; the Sweet Something juice (red one).

QjbdGd8N8XdSZoxS7xSdQg.text: It really is good food, every bite of what we ordered was mmm mmm good. We've been here a few times...  Soups are yummy and hearty (They let me combine them as well, not sure if it's the norm but I appreciate it :)  Almond chicken kicks ass and tastes great with rice and kale slaw.  Side bread was hearty and yummy with the accompanying olive oil.  Been here about 5 times I'd say and each time I visit, I thoroughly enjoy myself.  Another note is that the employees seem like a close knit group, or hey even like a family (what's that? lol)  Great energy, great food, great experience.

r2tgy-75deIZQRL2FxYipg.text: After looking at the menu before I got there, I was afraid it was going to be a super organic vegan ultra hip foodie spot. I went in and loved the off the wall decor and alien theme.

4AcezWjGqOvAArwwVufLlQ.text: I would definitely recommend this place. Quaint location and very good food. I got the steak sandwich with coleslaw, and my girlfriend got the Vegan Mediterranean Tofu and Veggies, and she said it was one of the best Vegan dishes she's had in Charlotte. This is definitely going to be a regular place for us!

6zEd_xTbn6lkQzgbRXyAdg.text: Most delicious vegetarian lasagna! The whole menu looks delicious and healthy. Im not vegetarian but so many good soups and entree I would come back to try. My friend had a salmon salad and we shared the vegetarian lasagna. The lasagna was made with veggies and no noodles. Ate this with no quilt and got my fiber for the day!

GYRwtiuZ5yuuZKGKJ3LcWA.text: Gonna keep this one short and sweet...  Because that's what Siggy is - a short and sweet little Soho spot where you can find homestyle, organic dishes - plus smoothies and juices! - with plenty-o-vegetarian-and-vegan options!  If I lived in New York, I would I could eat here every day.  Totally unpretentious, sit-down or take-out, health-conscious, lots of variety.  It's a kinda hippie, grass-rootsy type of vibe - for my Bay Area peeps, think of the lower Haight.    I had a bomb-a** tofu-avocado salad, veg quinoa-spinach burger wrap topped off with a mega greens juice.  On a Sunday, I sat with my girlfriend for a couple hours just chillin, enjoying the comfort.  It's just that kind of place.  Did I say plenty-o-vegetarian?   AND for a $$ PRICE-POINT!  Done and done.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

cVZoDGeS6lCB9rZn0iM89w.text: I've been to Siggy's on a couple of occasions, and it is as good as it gets!  So far I've had the salmon burger and the beef burger, both of which were deliciously seasoned and cooked to perfection. Most recently I ordered a side of potatoes with the beef burger, and they were surprisingly tasty, too. And accompanied by a glass of the Chilean Cabernet/Malbec blend, everything hit the spot.  Furthermore, the ambiance is nice and airy, and the service is friendly. Give it a go!

nR6jJ4AuJ8LXJAKDz3w9mw.text: loved this place and it's pretty decor. the food was to die for!!! fresh ingredients and incredible taste. the wait staff are incredibly welcoming and their hospitality went way beyond anything expected. the owner should be proud of its the employees they are the sweetest i've come across in a while. They also had a lot of organic and healthy options which i love. I can't wait to be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. steak sandwich

HUOXy8LYIg7K2ZsoHDNzsQ.text: Found this place as I was looking for vegan restaurants around the neighborhood. My friend is sensitive with eggs and dairy so this place have good options. We got seated in the back by the window, which you can look into people's apartments and fire escape.  Eggplant Veggie & Tofu Lasagna - as recommended from fellow yelpers, I do agree this is a must try. It's flavorful with no bad carbs by using eggplants as paste noodle.  Wild Salmon Burger, with a side of roasted potatoes - they use vegan mayo for this which is a plus for my friend. I got to try it and it's pretty juicy and well seasoned. However, the side of roasted potatoes was pretty bland.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wild salmon burger with a side of roasted potato
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggplant veggie and tofu lasagna

qtrLkAgHF_kupDX_3H_5ig.text: Delicious and the sweetest staff. Ordered hummus, avocado crostini, side salad, husband had chipotle chicken sandwich. Everything was delicious and so fresh tasting. Siggy was there so extra star for small business! I left my purse there and the girl who took our order chased me down outside. So sweet. Definitely recommend supporting this small business if you're in the mood for some healthy, fresh food with options for everyone.

muo-Lz7LlTa-yJN0Ss2E4g.text: Delicious, super friendly staff, and really high quality food. The steak sandwich was absolutely amazing. Rosemary marinade was on point, the steak was seasoned well, and the mushrooms and onions were perfect. Herb mayo was also delicious. A welcomed addition to the neighborhood!

4xk4v85BfLbJ5L5KX4IGyQ.text: Delicious fresh European style food and an awesome atmosphere!  Siggy you're the best!

Pve9vHeuDTrJENna_qikFA.text: A vegetarian-friendly meal was just what I needed after two days of heavy food in Jersey. It turns out pizza and Chinese carry out leave you feeling like death. Who'da thought?  Lucky for me, my boyfriend's sister is close friends with Siggy. (Insert my vegetarian recovery and savior.) There are not enough words to say how much I enjoyed my experience at this alien/veggie-themed eatery tucked away in the NoHo neighborhood. From my almond butter date shake to the best meatloaf I have ever had (and there wasn't even meat in it!), I'm drooling on the keyboard as we speak. What made the meatloaf exceptional? Ground up veggies like carrots, brocolli and eggplant mixed with tofu ricotta all smothered in a made-from-scratch tomato sauce. It was made with love. You could taste it with every bite.  Two other factors that made my experience 10 stars (errr 5): -cozy setting and decor - I loved our table in the rear with window open to a lush mini courtyard/green space -my salad topped with marinated tofu, avocado, carrot and sprouts also knocked my socks off. I'm certain this one meal packed enough nutrients to make up for my two day hiatus.   Thank you, Siggy. If you want to send me the meatloaf recipe, I wouldn't fight you. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken cutlet gyro
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salad topped with tofu (sprouts, avocado, red pepper, carrot, etc)
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Almond date smoothie- so good!!

QlOSdKCVS3YKIQsUaLAfCg.text: Testy!!! All food is fresh and yummy. My daughter is allergy  to gluten and egg.  She really love it. Ps. Waiter is so handsome
