x_g4wG86DQyd0vPBpipPoA.text: Great eaterie just off Houston and Bleeker Streets.  Went for the vegan fare for my wife and daughter but enjoyed a great organic beef stew myself.  Diverse menu with nightly specials.  Homemade soups were excellent.  Not a huge choice of deserts.  The vegan chocolate brownie was disappointing and cuppa coffee was also.  Great service, quirky decor and hip crowd make you know you're in The Village!

GldhKcRVVOnJIg22zsy13A.text: So happy that at least one location of Siggy's is still here. The Manhattan location is larger than its old Brooklyn counterpart and the staff is just as friendly. The interior is kind of dim.  They don't just serve good food here, they serve awesome food. I sat at the bar waiting 30 min. for my chronically late dining partner. I missed about 5 tables, but by the time he came a table was ready for us. They offer you fresh, healthy multi-grain bread with olive oil if you want.  Salmon Burger on Brioche w/ Herb Roasted Sweet Potatoes -  Salmon burger is so freaking good. I tried a bite of my friend's before in the Brooklyn location and tried to find another place that sells salmon burgers ever since. I couldn't find another place so I returned here to get one. The patty was smaller than I expected, but it seemed like it had no fillers as listed on the menu. The herb roasted sweet potatoes are an extra $4, but get them. I saw them just chilling on a shelf above the grill, so was afraid they would be overcooked and mushy. This was not the case. They were so crispy and well seasoned. The brioche bun kind of swallowed up the patty, but it was super soft and fluffy.  Beef Ragu Pasta Bowl - Generally you expect pasta to be rich and carb heavy. This pasta tasted fresh and healthy without sacrificing delicious flavor. I loved the herbs and the beef was tender. You get to choose between whole wheat or brown rice pasta. Be warned, the whole wheat is a very fibery pasta. The pasta is more expensive at $17, but they give you a huge portion.  While waiting for my dining partner to show up, I was able to get a peak into the kitchen. I saw so many delicious orders being prepared. Now I'm dying to go back to try their Garlic Herbs Olive Oil & Artichokes Pasta, Macaroni & Cheese, and Chicken Milanese.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon Burger with Herb Roasted Sweet Potatoes
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Ragu Pasta Bowl

0zp1EwWI4KO9RRwt45MGjw.text: I found Siggy's by "accident" while looking for a quick bite to eat before my dance rehearsal at The Sheen Center.   I love how they have options for everyone, vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free and omnivores as well and they gracefully agree to adjustments in the menu.   I've had:  - The Black Bean burger which has a spicy mayo on it that elevates the flavor I don't think I've had a more filling vegetarian burger.   - The Almond Protein shake but with Coconut Milk instead of Almond.. it's fresh, it packs a protein punch and keeps you going during a 3 hour rehearsal.   - A Moroccan chicken special that was incredibly flavorful with hints of paprika.   All their products are organic which is a plus since there are so many chemicals in the food nowadays.

mmo4OU1B0vqNwoG5H8XDWQ.text: The food here is delicious. The menu changes depending on availability, but they make great use of their ingredients. Also the smoothies are fantastic. surprisingly easy to make, but delicious all the same.  This location is very popular and is often crowded. Going between regular eating periods is best if you are not prepared to wait. For example, 4:30 pm.  The fact that they get crowded and have a wait is a good thing. In this neighborhood there is nothing comparable in a 5 block radius.  I really love their salads, especially the quinoa avocado.

lRn3_C-tiVq_rs-vBSZq8g.text: Pro's: - Love the ambiance. totally recommend you go in - ordered delivery and the food arrived inside of 30 mins - the rasberry hazlenut cake thing is amazing - one of my favorite items on the menu is the yellow fin tuna wrap. Not fishy at all, the tuna is fresh and the fries that come with are delicious  Con: - the pastas (pasta bowl, mac n cheese) are underwhelming, wouldn't recommend it  Otherwise Siggy's is a great neighborhood spot with solid/organic/pure food selection

eeLE5bwAm3wxjigzwHpAlw.text: Yum! Comfortable seating and good service. The bread with hummus was good (though the bread could have been softer / yummier) and the beef pasta was delish! The green drink was yummy and healthy. Great selection of beers too. Very close to the B'way / Lafayette subway stop, tucked on a little side street. Fun times and good place to meet up with friends!

rts9VU_rQ7XeylumlxK6Jw.text: Absolutely wonderful! A friend and I were trying to find a bite to eat before going to the Bowery Poetry Club and we stopped by here. At first we weren't sure what to think but we were greeted by a lovely Irish man so we decided to stay. I had the Eggplant Veggie & Tofu Lasagna. It was so good. Definitely worth the $16. It is a little on the pricey side but definitely worth it if you're in the mood for some healthy organic food.

qEjJT6ztw21ZdJKJmk4jXw.text: Came here with my GF and a group of friends for dinner on a Sunday night.   I've have previously been to the Brooklyn Heights location and must say I liked that this locations was more spacious and less cramped.  I ordered the organic grass-fed flank steak sandwich, and tore into that ciabatta roll full of beef like a rabid honey badger. mmmm There is a selection of good organic beer to choose from (they also have wine, but I haven't tried it yet).  Now I just need to figure out how to convince them that I am really an alien in disguise living amongst you humans.

U8bvjeuKp5nJXepS6hQnMw.text: Loveeeeeee Siggy's. If I ever want to go out to dinner with a friend but I'm trying to watch what I'm eating, 9/10 times I'll take them to Siggy's. Inventive and fresh dishes, all prepared in healthy ways. I totally love the quinoa avocado Greek salad; and this is coming from someone who isn't typically a salad lover. Prices are reasonable and i've never had disappointing service. This place is a gem.

p1Nix6q0qJ88VdESV6ebUw.text: Definitely give this place a try if you're looking for an affordable lunch or dinner with gah-reat food and service.  It's a pretty trendy place. The staff is incredibly friendly and super knowledgable and passionate about their menu options.   I wish I had gone more times, but the one time I went was fantastic. I had a steak sandwich that was so perfectly prepared. The helping was large and I left full. I love cheap food but I love even more quality cheap food.   This place is perfect for a lunch or dinner meal with friends.

jcB-qOcMTFIf1N-rl_harQ.text: My go to for healthy food in the area.  It's just great. Love the eggplant lasagne and the turkey burgers. Great delivery and going there is a treat. It kind of makes you feel like you are in SF.  Great great spot especially if you want to feel healthy while eating out.

vZ_iaLKIdi0kEWl299QGbg.text: Great food... theres not much to say about siggys soi will keep it short and sweet.  service is spot on. its a nice touch when siggy the owner is also waiting tables. dont go past the salmon! get it rare and it taste like butter!  go siggys

mx5_jFs66waZrsFgXTqKww.text: Healthy, but you can also get beer.  I've tried the Greek quinoa and avocado salad and the garden veggie sandwich and both are very good.  And surprisingly, it has never been a problem for us to get a table for two, even on a Friday or Saturday during normal dinner hours.  Just a five-minute wait at the most.

csb2QLzBnzh5DTsTMebP1g.text: My favorite place to eat in the neighborhood for lunch (near work).  I've only had the zucchini eggplant vegan lasagna.  I love it so much that I haven't tried anything else there.  I like the BK Heights location :: I love the NoHo spot!    The staff is also super friendly and attentive.  And the food is clean!!

Pm55P34uvMgQ7jSWpsZ5ug.text: It is a hidden gem. The menu is healthy - lots of gluten free and vegetarian entrees. The service is courteous and friendly and make you feel welcome. I like that feeling. I strongly recommend coming here, at least one and checking it out. We had a nice friendly waiter who saw us looking at the menu and welcome us in.

1no27deBrsuLgX29FZdVlQ.text: Great atmosphere and friendly staff all around even though we came in at an unusual time (around 4pm on a Saturday).  Ordered a chai latte which was a little underwhelming and also got a latte which was pretty good. They had good juice options so that is probably the way to go rather than coffee/chai.  The food had great flavors; ordered the turkey burger with cheddar which was not greasy and was highly spiced but in a really interesting and tasty way. We also got the hummus plate which was also really good- large serving of hummus. I would have preferred pita bread as opposed to ciabatta but it wasn't a biggie. The server offered more bread since we had so much hummus left but which we opted to let it go unfinished, as it was very filling! Great value for what you get. After reading reviews, I am really eager to come back for brunch.

CiBIPYvYuTE7N8PW4B3HyQ.text: Very hipster but the food was flavorless. I was also grossed out by the fact that many smoothies carry protein powder.

5KlDtZ8bHDVmWtFcfPVfbQ.text: Siggy's is a fantastic find... after combing the worn out Whole Foods food bar for weeks to find decent organic veggies and meat, we happened upon this gem. Great salads, hot food, amazing gluten-free pasta and bread (it actually tastes like real food), and awesome smoothies.  They deliver, are open late, and have great prices for good quality organic food.  Definitely check it out.

lgArnNW-2q-WNYArlSosuA.text: Good food, tastes and feels healthy. Ingredients are high quality. Service is on the slow side. Overall good.

BKA7b73EJ6cCW2nKClFZaQ.text: I'm already looking forward to trying more items off the menu.    Staff & Service - excellent!  Food -       1) Eggplant Veggie & Tofu Lasagna - even the meat lovers would enjoy this dish!!      2) Beef Ragu Pasta Bowl - This is what I ordered and it was so mind blowing, my fiance and cousin kept on taking bites.  The spices in this dish were amazing.  The main spice is cumin and it  was a perfect amount.  The beef was so tender and the pasta was al dente.  There was a lot of meat, so I took my leftovers home and made more pasta and had it for lunch the next day.      3) Roasted Sweet Potatoes - i love cooking, I've cooked sweet potatoes many times, but I NEED to figure out how the roasted sweet potatoes are as good as it is at Siggy's.  It's not extremely soft as how it usually is when I have sweet potatoes.   If I lived near this restaurant, I would surely be a regular!!!

vp2tYtf_5k7OHDRagSoMFA.text: Delicious! A very cozy ambiance. Great food! Well-sized portions! If you love organic/vegan food, this place is great. Also, their menu has a whole bunch of fresh squeezed juices and smoothies, definitely have to try some next time I come! Definitely a place worth trying if you're looking for a place to grab some lunch!

VaEoTrGZYo0vjS3xSMSgDw.text: Best tasting meal I have had in NY. It had real flavour and the quantity was great and the price too.

jBn2oaCvXrwoOerRuFupPw.text: Always a pleasure to eat here.  Employees are always friendly and respectful.  Food is always on point.

einwTo7MSEL0_ROGXQNxHA.text: Mac and Cheese, Burger, the beat burrito thingy, sweet potato fries and herb mayo was DELICIOUS!! Great service Give it a try, just have an open mind. The drinks were good too.  Cheers!

AvUYEgYkvkIiEtnYhZJiQg.text: Pretty good vegetarian eats.  Great variety and the added benefit of things being locally sourced and organic.  They've got great gluten free (GF) and vegan (V) options, so it's a real crowd pleaser with any group.   Had the Garden Veggie Sandwich (V) which was pretty substantial but lacking in flavor.  Also tried the Garlic Herb Olive Oil and Artichoke Pasta (GF, V) which was delicious and the AMAZING Macaroni & Cheese.

6qwSvZ1U8KB8Vx2xR91UJg.text: OH MY GOD! What an amazing place!  I wish I could have EVERYTHING here. I loved their harvest breakfast bar (sugar and wheat free) and the black bean roasted Yam wrap! My friend loved his salmon burger and my other friend devoured the HUGE bowl of soup ($8). What a great healthy place- the waiters were also extremely kind :)

BOINXT98KYebgtay-ZUHpQ.text: That salmon burger was memorably delicious. The fish tasted fresh and though many ground salmon burgers are quite dry, the one was moist and rich, with a pretty solid mix of seasoning. I ate the whole thing in about 3 minutes and afterwards was only sad that I couldn't have another.

U0tus-BAhlXyd462O-1Dgg.text: Came across this place, definitely a great spot for a group or even on a date.  The ambiance is ideal for that.  Got the following Live Earth Salad - Great salad, and it was filling, very good balance, the avocado added a good substance to the salad.  Wasnt overly tangy and just overall good to eat!  Moroccan Chick Peas & Spinach Bowl - With Added chicken - This was nice and warm and also filling with the added chicken.  Though the chicken was a tad on the dry side, probably would try it with Tofu next time.  It was a bit on the thick side, but that is fine, as I enjoyed it that way.  Drink Flu Defense - It was ok, can taste a hint of the ginger, mostly on the bottom so definitely could have stirred it more to get it more mixed around.  Lemon taste kind of overwhelmed the flavor, it was just ok for me.  Will try a different one next time.

rQZ3OEY5zAzjjYLoN6eg7g.text: My heart is broken a second time!  Very sad to find out that this location has also closed.  I'm still mourning the loss of Siggy's in Brooklyn Heights.  Please come back Siggy's.  We need you.  :`-(

8-ySxxT36tT6fzeATOCmig.text: This is my go to spot for a great and pretty healthy lunch!  There isn't anything on the menu that I haven't liked.  When I don't have time to sit and eat I take it to go and the food is always good, never cold or soggy.  Its one of those places you can have a filling lunch and you don't feel like your arteries are closing on ya.  I've tried the: -  Chicken Vegetable Soup - Live Earth Salad - Italian Smoke Turkey Sub - Organic Thyme Sage Chicken Cutlet Hero - Black Bean Veggie Burger Wrap   All are amazing depending on your mood! Once in a while I treat myself to the Chocolate Chunk Cookie, one of the brownies or the Raspberry Hazelnut bar.

nE5O6tcwVTUBzKURKHO8tg.text: Love this place! Delicious food that's healthy and makes you feel good after eating!  The black bean and sweet potato app is amazing with a little kick. I love the Moroccan bowl for my meal and my Bf loves the burger.  Only qualm is they only offer coconut ice cream for dessert! Some people just don't like coconut so there should be another option.  I have come in many times with my boyfriend and have gotten seated within 10 minutes.  Highly recommend!

s--_K3NvsO_9DL18_AM-Yw.text: Welcome earthlings, I come in peace.   Siggy's is probably my favorite healthy brunch spot downtown. I always order the breakfast burrito. It's a colorful egg-stuffed potpourri of flavor with avocado-bit toppings and the tortilla is always perfectly crispy.   Everything on the menu is delicious and well executed. Various salads and other organic dishes that are highly customizable to add proteins/burger patties or additional sides.   Dinner is solid too. Makes for a good date spot as it is charming at night without trying too hard. The thyme chicken breast packs flavor as does the ragu pasta. I wish they still had the sweet potato quinoa cakes as an appetizer and the Moroccan chickpea bowl.   They always greet you with a cheery salutation when you walk in the door.   E.T phone home.

gt0m1npgOhpKXYBmM90sRg.text: Guilt-free-good-eating is the one word for this place! I'm not vegan or gluten-free but the food here is delicious and so flavorful, I was definitely taken by surprise.   What happens when you don't feel bad for eating "healthier" alternatives for food? You overeat. And that's what I sure did! I had a salmon burger along with my brother and we split the vegan lasagna because we were just too curious. A lasagna made of just tofu and eggplant, strange but really not because it was genius! Somehow the lasagna didn't oddly topple over, nor was it bland because the tomato sauce was overflowing with the right aroma and flavor. And because of the tofu, it was almost extremely filling so I now know why one small/medium sized piece counts as one whole entree.  By the time we devoured that and struggled through our salmon burgers because the toasted multi-grain bread couldn't handle all that salmon meat, we could barely move. So of course, we wash everything down with some organic drinks - a sweet cider for him, and a chenin blanc wine for me. I was so happy with my meal, I couldn't resist getting a vegan&gluten-free chocolate chip cookie on my way out...and silly me, it was $4! Even with all that food, I wasn't taken by surprise by a painful food coma but rather a full tummy that was stuffed all night till the next morning. Just proves that natural foods make your tummy happier and my tummy would love to venture back to Siggys.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggplant tofu lasagna
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two salmon burgers with multigrain bread and eggplant tofu lasagna! Delicious
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chenin blanc and cider mmm

Cg3vw1GHVXE2xSlCfcbhIQ.text: The ambiance / decor here is not as nice as the brooklyn spot but the food was still delicious.   My bae got the all natural pan seared chicken breast marinated in fresh herbs, served with whole grain brown rice and his choice of veggies was the spinach sauteed with garlic (gluten free dish). He thought it was very soggy, and more reminiscent of wilted spinach. He also said it was too garlicky. I had a bite of his chicken and it was pretty good.  I got the eggplant veggie and tofu lasagna which did not contain noodles (yay!. This dish consisted of roasted Eggplants with lots of Vegetables and tofu ricotta, topped with soy cheese and homemade garlic tomato sauce. It was vegan and gluten free.  I have to say I was alarmed when they brought out a huge dish filled with tomato sauce, given I was wearing a white blouse. My fears were totally warranted as I did manage to splash some on my shirt (ugh). They probably could've cut down on the sauce a bit.   We got a side of roasted sweet potatoes which were delicious and plenty for the two of us to share.  Overall my tummy was happy - The portions are really generous so I was able to take home half of my noodle free eggplant lasagna for the next day's dinner after eating the other half and splitting the sweet potatoes with the boyfriend.  I was tempted to get the starter (listed as snacks on the menu) black bean sweet potato cakes or the quinoa spinach cakes, and I'm kind of glad I didn't. Our neighbors got them and they were really teeny tiny for the $8 you pay for them.  Our waiter was okay. He was a bit hipstery and didn't know what we were talking about when we originally asked about their website dinner specials listed for manhattan that was supposed to be avail after 5pm (we got there at 5:10). He said we were too early for it despite the website that appeared to be updated daily, and that we'd have to wait about 30 or so minutes before they even decided on what specials they'd offer.  That's the only reason this is a 3 and not a 4 star review. Get it together people!

poE4HD8pz5cszp8ZvJmebQ.text: The food was great, but the service was really something else. Expect to see big smiles and hello's from all the staff as you walk in!  Even though my friend and I sat around the corner from the front of the house, the waitress made sure to walk by frequently to glance at our table in case we needed any attention. At one point, she noticed the bottle of water on our table was getting low and came by to replace it with a fresh one without even interrupting our conversation which was really incredibly thoughtful.  Back to the food! The drawback to a 100% vegan burger without egg whites is that the patty fell apart as soon as I picked it up! Let's just say that things got *very* messy trying to eat it like a burger, but you'll be fine if you just start off using a knife and fork.  Don't spring for the soy cheese, it has no taste whatsoever and doesn't even melt, which was a huge disappointment to a former cheese lover like myself.  I also recommend asking for vegan mayonnaise on the side if you order the roasted herb sweet potatoes because the two of them together are a synergy of awesome flavors!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

_OSi33a_9QPXycSroRYAfA.text: Look beyond the flappy plastic on the door meant to keep the cold out. And the strange alien on the sign? (which might become kind of endearing) Because right when you walk into Siggy's, you'll feel like home.    When possible, they ask you where you want to be seated. I love sitting in the back closer to the fireplace. The lighting is comfortable and cozy, and the decor is bright, colorful, and tasteful. Take a visit to the bathroom to read some inspirational quotes from Martha Graham and MLK Jr. (not too long of a visit, since it's a one-staller).   The food is organic and healthy. I've tried several of their soups, and they are delicious! Try the option of adding quinoa!  When I called for delivery, they were so polite and honest about how backed up they were. They apologized and said it would be quite a long wait- and I loved that they were so sincere about it.   They have healthy brunch options, and are very accommodating when it comes to making the plates vegan. The quinoa spinach cakes are delicious!   I can't wait to come back and try their smoothies. Yay Siggy's, with your out-of-this-world food! (yes, allusion to the alien intended).

6ugQl8gRc58c_iKH3BGWgQ.text: A treat for us gluten free folks. The salmon burger is amazing as it is super tasty and has no bread filler. The only thing is that it is quite salty in my opinion, but all of my other friends think it is perfection. Cute place also :)

ahSJzHF6l2DMCvgnUuuAeQ.text: Pretty decent comfort food. Good fast service everything was delicious. It's a bit dim on the inside so you can't really see your food, bring a flash light! Better yet it's the best place to go if your skin is breaking out and your on a date, your date won't see anything. Be careful of the shaking mirror

-GX3AxWU79zYb3EizvnEoA.text: Siggys restaurant is great! The atmosphere, waiters, and food were all pretty good.  I ordered the banana pancakes. They were out of this world, I wish I would have ordered a side of potatoes like my other friends. They looked really good too.   I will definitely be visiting this place again.

AdwF-uF0N0b41TycHMlVmw.text: I was pleasantly impressed by Siggy's, a very comfortable cozy restaurant with a fireplace, a very good selection of food, and a very disciplined all organic/natural consciousness throughout their restaurant. I had glanced at the reviews before coming and the food was even better than what I was expecting it to be.   They are very big on all natural, all organic and environmental-friendly serving and food. Even the ketchup that I got for my organic grass-fed beef burger was an Annie's all organic ketchup. My brother got the garlic pasta and the chicken special, which were both delicious. The chicken was very tender and seasoned beautifully, and my burger was fresh and was also flavored immensely well. Both of our meals were extremely satisfying and we left happy.   The place itself is very down-to-earth, it has a humble appearance with its wooden table and chairs, the fireplace, and modest decor. They have a cute menu that has a small section of their food mantra if you choose to read it, and all of their food is very reasonably priced. This restaurant is also nicely tucked away in a side street off of Houston, so it's a nice little neighborhood gem that is definitely thriving with fans. I'll be keeping this place in my book to come into again.  Edit: I'd also like to mention that my brother gets take-out from Siggy's all the time, the Grass-Fed All Organic Burger, which he loves. So if you're looking for a quick meal to pick-up, or delivery, Siggy's is definitely a great option

pUNr3eCJ8UytIGFBi49TAg.text: 3.5 stars. Oldie but goodie. I visited on Saturday night and did not have to wait for a table and the place was 80% full. It's like any vegan restaurant in NYC except it's not vegan - (1) the cooking does not require much technique, (2) the seasoning is quite heavy, (3) a strong emphasis on health. I wanted a salad and asked my waiter which he recommended out of the live earth and raw slaw. I was so disappointed when I dug into the live earth salad which he suggested because it is basically just a house salad with avocado and a few red pepper and onion strips. The black bean burger patty I chose to top it was good though. The juices are great and interesting but expensive. Staff is really good looking and friendly.

_vDL06KUl-iRA4YJUNvvrw.text: Oh man, this place is GREAT!!   Seriously, eating here for lunch almost made me want to eat healthy and stop eating burritos (except, then I'd miss Chipotle, but still).  So yeah, GREAT food, cute atmosphere. Came here for lunch the other day just before the lunch rush (get there before 12:30pm). Ordered one of the flu juices because I was feeling under the weather... it seemed HEALTHY, I guess. But I did feel better afterwards SO I guess it worked.  For lunch, got the lentil soup and the tuna sandwich. The soup was fantastic and perfectly flavored and the tuna was good, although not the best tuna sandwich in the world (although that was probs because of the lack of some full fat mayo). My coworkers got the raw salad and the chicken sandwich and both were very happy with their meals.  Would definitely be back and can't wait to try more of the menu esp the lasagna. If they cooked for me every day and for every meal, I think I'd basically be the healthiest person in the world.

qf6JkfY_BcM-HIc7vuFB4g.text: Siggy's is a real neighborhood gem. I've been here a couple of times now, and both times the food and service were great. They have an attractive and friendly staff here, both male and female and a casually elegant dining room you wouldn't expect from a place that makes its bones on vegan/organic/gluten-free/healthy food. You can linger for minutes or hours, at least it feels that way.  Also somewhat surprisingly, Siggy's serves meat and fish dishes. On my last visit I had the flank steak sandwich, a perfect portion of juicy beef on a ciabatta roll, with a small side salad. Last time I had the wild salmon burger, totally delicious. Plenty of add-ons are available if you're in the mood for something less healthy, and there are many appetizers and sides I've yet to try.  Fast becoming my go-to "health" eatery.

xMpwIIkAAlkK8YHjGwDyDg.text: Salmon burger awesome. Kale slaw awesome. Split pea soup awesome. Grilled artichokes awesome. Siggy's awesome. I'm obsessed, and--it was all healthy too. Don your organic alpaca shawls and come here.

kyZzpr0CF_SL5364R2kolg.text: Had lunch there yesterday with my wife and daughter. Food, service and ambience were terrific. Our waitress was great as well. Siggy's was my daughters recommendation and it lived up to her hype. Will eat there again.

3H9xgyOeO2e4bvWgEMwXAg.text: Finally, excellent organic food (and beer) at reasonable prices. I has the wild Salmon and it was the best I've ever had. Why can't more resto's get it this right?

NXYrkmm0zygm3fuc8Z11TA.text: Love this place. The food is delicious & the staff is friendly & helpful. It's a True gem.

M58EixJY3dvQKBXDqnXnAg.text: I would put 10 stars if they were available! The GF eggplant lasagna was outstanding. I will be craving it until the next time I am in NYC! It was 16 oz of deliciousness...everyone else loved their food too, including our picky son who is eleven. Thought he'd fuss about the wheat pasta. He was too busy shoveling it in his mouth to notice!

aHA_5zCxxQmxSFWYOk5CKg.text: Frequented this place a few times and love the food but the service can use some work. I've tried the salmon burger a couple of times and its always delicious (no fillers, just yumminess) Good selection of beer too! We tried a Gluten-Free Raspberry square over some tea and it was great too!  Overall, great food and location but service can be more friendly and less abrupt!

wvrvjCYs7SJoo5Vsj7LBTQ.text: I'm a regular here and cannot convey how great siggys is. I crave their Greek quinoa salad like whoa. Burgers are delicious. Salmon is too. I've tried just about everything on the menu and have loved everything. Friendly service. Great juices and smoothies. Seriously...siggys is the best.

OrlkbxPGrlcQVDF8bH_X9g.text: My single most favorite restaurant in NYC.  I just love this place. Great food great service great atmosphere.

D_KOoc1vpvcI-N5RhozmLA.text: Such friendly waitstaff. The place had a really upbeat vibe. I went for lunch with colleagues and got the beef burger with goat cheese. It was cooked well and the bun was delicious. They served it with greens that weren't quite a salad since they didn't have dressing or veggies. Quite pointless. But the burger had a delicious seasoning. Definitely get a smoothie!

MqVtHWCD3LlVipLJNnaveQ.text: Love this place ! Food is amazing, tasty, healthy (organic,wild) and affordable... I go there at list twice week - salmon Burger is my favorite ... Highly recommended

WaRcQGVyaVkJviZlNOViTw.text: Siggy's is close to my office, so I pick up lunch there every once in awhile. It's slightly pricey for a lunch spot, so unfortunately I don't eat it as much as I'd like to. My favorites are the Greek Quinoa Salad (add feta) and the Salmon Burger. The food is always healthy, fresh, and satisfying!

GPChCRHBCl8fyNqsmOhBvg.text: I LOVE SIGGYS! My favorite is the salmon burger! The staff is always nice and welcoming. I have been there a handful of times and never disappointed.

70muTVK4GDkUmQHpLE1DeQ.text: The food at Siggy's is organic, fresh, and absolutely delicious!  I've been there (too) many times and am never disappointed.  The smoothies are also excellent and the staff is incredibly friendly.  I was a little surprised to see this place marked with two $$, because it's definitely an expensive place to eat for breakfast or lunch (never been for dinner).  Expect to pay $22 for a salad and smoothie.  I still think it's worth it!  The food is fantastic and you will feel good all day!  It's healthy and will give you good energy. I've also seen many celebrities there - it's pretty popular and well-known.  Not much of an atmosphere, but good enough for a sit-down lunch.  I highly recommend the beet salad and the quinoa avocado salad.

uQTB7QSSPdpPK_7RjB3ryA.text: ***The place is closing its Brooklyn location early March (6? I think) so check to make sure it is open and go now if it is on your list****  Super cute place with a great menu.  Overall smaller place and super popular, got there around 1pm and still had a slight wait at peak hours I can imagine the wait is more so plan ahead.  Place is not very large.    Food was more than worth the wait.  The salmon burger is amazing!  Also highly recommend the spinach cakes as a starter.  Service was wonderful.  The place is amazing you can really customize what you want.  Most entrees like the burger could come on a bun, gluten free bun, or over greens.  Also excellent selection of fresh juices, creative smoothies, and teas.  The place also features a lot of gluten free baked goods and many people where coming in buying from the coffee shop component of the store purchasing baked goods and smoothies.    Also something to think about for groups, no more than 2 credit cards per table!  However it is a small place so depending on the size of the group might not be the best idea.  Smaller groups definitely!  Go now before it's gone!!

JzxnGwOUO14Iw02yQUZlNA.text: Exactly the right kind of laid back friendly vibe you want from the neighborhood. The burger was great and my buddy had the chicken cutlet sandwich which was fantastic as well.  Ingredients were clearly very good and it's not just for vegetarians!

ObYKwqc5SPCiIkr2pJ9Qyg.text: Siggy Siggy Siggy. Go here. You won't regret it. Try their tofu lasagna, it is to die for. The ambiance, crowd, location, and good food keep me coming back!

vDswiMb2e2AhS_mZlE6Nhg.text: Went with a party of 10, my immediate and extended family. They didn't even bat an eye at a few suitcases of some who had just flown in, even stored them away while we dined. Food was good, great to be able to give my 90-year old celiac diseased grandmother so many tasty options. Definitely awesome for a group (they allowed us to make a reservation because of the size of our party)-- would go back for cheap healthy eats any time!

2SpdmP5TWkeVgrBJgUAQ5Q.text: Not really a Mediterranean place. I'm looking for usual favorites from the Mediterranean but no luck.

YoOmeP9RoPWMDTdckWz3bw.text: Soooooo good. I had the grass fed burger medium rare. Mmmmm suuuuuuuucccccuuuullleeeeent! I'd thought this be some hipster shit but it wasn't! It was nice and cozy inside. Staff are super friendly. Only downfall was that the burger did not come with fries. If you wanted a side it'd be extra mula. But there's no fries option! Gah. My friend had the salmon burger and it was good. Very fresh and not some canned shit. I'm all about organic and this place does my taste buds good. But I wish there were fries.  My burger was about 10 bucks and came with a little bit of greens on the side. Bit pricey but my cow was a happy grass fed cow so it's aiiiighttttt.

SUeWGkGBypCA7IO0gMaNnQ.text: This is hands down one of my favorite restaurants in The world. The food and wine is never disappointing. I LOVE the slaw salad with a salmon burger on top. This location is just as amazing as the brooklyn heights location

6CrcTkSD9QNfy5UrsEx0Sw.text: Great little healthy food spot in NoHo. Warm cozy atmosphere with friendly staff. I was torn between the pasta less lasagna and the veggie bowl and ended up getting the veggie bowl with chicken. Came out hot, super flavorful tomato garlic sauce/broth type thing with a variety of yummy veggies - cauliflower, artichokes, kale, chick peas, would definitely order again and would love to try other items on the memu!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

6sqiw-LcT0ATCNyxKZDdtw.text: This place is wonderful.  Bright, friendly, delicious.  Well worth a try!  Plus they have outdoor seating so it's perfect for a warm, sunny afternoon.

Hx3a77Yf1F7w_ZcFjH09lw.text: Stopped into Siggy's Good Food with 2 of my friends, one of whom has celiac and can't eat gluten, after a yoga class in Noho. It was pretty close and a nice day so we walked in and were immediately seated. The place has a fun and unique feel to it -- the restaurant's macot is a little alien, while the entire inside is wooden and natural feeling. And the food really is good.  A lot of the options here are vegan/vegetarian/gluten-free friendly, but they have a bunch of options if you're not, like me. I copped the iced coffee and Happy Beef Burger, which were both delicious. The coffee is served in this really fun glass, and it was not bitter, but rich. Honestly, the burger looked like it might taste like the ground, but it was some of the best beef I've had in a while. Plus, the greens on it were so flavorful, I was pleasantly surprised by the taste of a burger in a healthy eating restaurant. I also ordered a side of roasted potatoes, which we thin slices, not mini potatoes -- but still no complaints, they were cooked to perfection.  As with all healthy eating places, there's a literal price -- the burger and potatoes were $17, which is pretty steep for a burger. My friends got salads, which were massive and apparently tasty and flavorful as well. Service was also a tad bit slow, but because we weren't in a rush, it wasn't a huge deal -- we were just hungry!   Siggy's Good Food really does the name justice. Check it out if you're in Soho.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Backside of menu
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front side of menu
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Iced coffee and an orange juice (both were stellar)

xPYfF_LW4yPB7mDtfSj3sA.text: You will never just happen upon this place so I'm glad they have a popular restaurant next door.  The word "hidden gem" is used way too much but I'm not sure of another way to describe this place.  I know they're new but I'm just surprised I hadn't heard anything about it.    The food tastes extremely fresh with a TON of flavor.  When I think of a place that has organic options and a lot of gluten free menu items, I assume it's going to be overpriced and lack in flavor.  Definitely not the case here.    The order:  Crostini - avocado, lemon, and cracked salt and pepper. Exactly what I was looking for.  You may think $3 is too expensive for a crostini but this thing was overflowing with avocado that had the absolute perfect texture.  Can't wait to try the other ones.  Beef Kabob Hero - I got mine on ciabatta but you can also get a GF wrap or greens instead.  This was quite possibly the best sandwich I've had in Charlotte.  I was originally going to get the steak sandwich, but someone in an earlier review mentioned the cilantro habanero mayo on the kabob so I went with that and was very please.  Absolutely massive flavor on this sandwich, and it comes with some greens on the side as well.  Outside of the food, which is 5 stars on it's own but the cashier was extremely pleasant and welcoming.  The vibe is very relaxed, almost like a coffee shop (they do have wifi, I believe).  Awesome place, and can't wait to go back.

UDqMCZCr51eqF4G4J5_zCw.text: The sandwiches here are so good! Notably better Common market or rhino market. Best in Charlotte (for western style sandwiches)! Glad pretty they're green too.

CJw--3kPCjll4IDhMvuPeQ.text: A friend & I decided to pop our heads in here for a bite and wow the minute we walked in there was this amazing smell in the air! We did not even look at the menu before being seated. When we was sat down and actually took a look at the menu, we both were like where are we again? We realized after 10 mins that we were at a vegan spot. My friend had the turkey burger with sweet potatoes fries , and I have to say for myself that burger was delicious. There was a hint of ginger that made the burger, it was not over powered & tender. I had a side of Mac & Cheese & sweet potatoes fries . The MC was pretty good, I felt like something was missing but it had a great amount of cheese & my favorite mozzarella. I added a sprinkle of salt and it did justice, the sweet potatoes fries are not the reg fries, they're cut into slices & seasoned to a touch. We both decided we will return and try other stuff on the menu! Love that they sell fresh green juice.  Update: Do have a shot if you feeling under the weather. I had a 2oz Lemon & Ginger shot. Wow it's powerful, the ginger is so potent! I literally felt like my ears were going to bleed lol. I have a terrible cold & decided to have a shot but it won't cure me in one day.

j_vPpE3Hm8FzKMjMWuFlrQ.text: Consistent, tasty, good (great) food! The atmosphere is inviting and the staff is friendly. Siggy herself is a delight!

sV0YKvJ7HsYdDyFKLb-ESA.text: Siggy is a great place to get some healthy meals. The food was very wholesome and clean.   Splendid Sesame Kale & Cabbage Slaw: coated with a very well-balanced vinaigrette. To me I think it is a great dish to order when I want to control myself from eating too much. The volume was huge. At the end, I was really tired from chewing so couldn't finish the salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

EewDkKP978tQGQN0XQMNIw.text: We've tried this place a few times. The food is really good and has a lot of healthy options. Salads and sizes are a nice portion and fresh. Location is hard for parking and in an up and coming neighborhood.

JMtOxmI4YXC7v5MNqnt1RQ.text: Memorial review. Bereaved that this is gone. Affordable, healthy, friendly, lovely staff, great specials, always a comfy seat and a good chat. Damn you New York.

Exv6AlvRR55td7g1zso7LA.text: OK- Vegan Gluten Free friendly place with such a cute little vibe. The staff was incredibly nice. The food was to die for. Holy cow the Mediterranean Tofu wrap was the best wrap I may have ever had. The artichokes made my drool... I wish I was kidding. Going to be dreaming of this place and am now scared for my bank account seeings how it is only a block from my work! Seriously such a great little spot would 10/10 recommend.

VXtJtFrwjEdvIUqjO2Xdyg.text: This place kinda rocked my world.  Delicious, affordable, healthy/clean food.  I had the steak sandwich over greens, the vegan lasagna, and the hazelnut bar for dessert. All of it was tasty and perfect. Everything was so tasty.  Extra credit: I arrived early and sat at the table a while and they were gracious.  And I love the neighborhood.

fVEzqoWzFCcBRFk_3IIWgg.text: The food was AMAZING! It was super cute and I can't believe I haven't been there before. Definitely will be going back

O7tfKC5LYo3IAZ3wHQam1A.text: I used to go to the Siggy's in Brooklyn. May it RIP. This Siggy's is just as good. More spacious. I usually sat outside in Brooklyn but that option is packed away here on Elizabeth street on this cold rainy week in Fall.  I had a special dish of beef stew which was healthier than the usual stock made by my mother but still meaty and potato-y. Washed this down with a young coconut. I think coconuts are my favorite part of this alien friendly restaurant.  My friend had the vegan lasagna. He was upset about the lack of cheese (he forgot it was vegan) but he ate it up nonetheless. It has a powerful sea of tomatoes.  The price is not cheap but its not expensive either. Next step is a brunch which is my usual Siggy's go to meal. I also enjoy their smoothies in the summer.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Doormat
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front

x_WHAOepiQfioutu8yu5Tg.text: I live around the block and I can't believe it took me a year to try Siggy's! I got the noodle-less, cheese-less Vegan Tofu and Eggplant Lasagna and it was hearty and perfect for the fall weather. I'm not the biggest tofu person but it was awesome! Loved all the tomato sauce it was covered in!The sweet potato side was amazing. You need to order it! Our waiter was really helpful and told us his favorites (really cute too )!  I think I'll try something a bit healthier next time since that's what I tend to order. Excited to try their whole menu! Love all the alien artwork inside. Perfect for fall and winter coming up since it is comfort food and has a fireplace!  Pro tip: We were seated immediately on a Friday night!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Noodle-less and Cheese-less Vegan Tofu and Eggplant Lasagna! You don&#39;t come close to missing the non-Vegan elements!

nBt8j4BrkS7VHNNprl683g.text: I visited here on a Tuesday for the half off alcohol. They had a great selection of wine. I wasn't in the mood for beer but looked at their cooler and they had lots of good craft beer. I also had the selection of four crostinis and they were delish. My favorite was the fig and goat cheese. The best thing about this restaurant was the ambiance. It was laid back with friendly staff and great music. Welcome to the hood Siggy's! I'll definitely be back!

mZpLo_kz3t5Cqi9PwC4e7Q.text: Been here twice for brunch/lunch and I can honestly say this place produces some of the most delicious sandwiches in CLT. I'm sure everything they make is amazing but I've only had the sandwiches. The pulled chicken and beef kebab sandwiches are to die for. Go here , support this place. Unlike a lot of the newer clt restaurants that don't deliver on food quality , this place is 100

jZ6g9DVcanx6PHQi35_Ygw.text: If you want feel good food that you don't feel guilty stuffing your face with, this is the place to go. Everything is organic and there are vegan options as well!  I ordered the beet and orange salad and also had a few bites of my friend's Live Earth Salad that he had ordered with chicken. Both were great. Mine was a refreshing, light salad, while his was a heartier salad with a greater variety of fresh ingredients. I enjoyed his dressing much more than mine!  After finishing my salad, I was in the mood for a burger and decided to split the Wild Salmon Burger with my friend. I was expecting the patty to just be a grilled salmon fillet, but it was an actual patty made out of (ONLY - and they make sure to emphasize this) salmon meat. It was juicy and delicious! The burger disappeared in just a few minutes. I wish they offered different sides for the burgers instead of just a side of greens - having just eaten a plate of veggies, I would have really enjoyed some air baked fries or something like that to go along with my burger. :P   Service is extremely attentive, and it was overall a very pleasant dining experience. However, I found this place really pricey - even for organic food - which will be the one thing that deters me from returning more frequently!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

__wOt1u8N8m-D1AfngEeeg.text: Cute Belmont neighborhood restaurant with local food served uniquely. Daily soup- lentil and celery was excellent. Also had chicken wrap with unique bbq sauce and mayo. Can't wait to go back to try other dishes. Recommend for vegan and vegetarians.

0ouCEYurIUy6vTRRYmmLDw.text: I have been looking forward to trying out this new Charlotte restaurant. The place looks great! I love the aesthetic which is welcoming with the wide open door and the warm wood trims, natural colors, glass pendants and simple decor. I like places where you order at the counter and then take a seat. Once you are seated you are well taken care of as they bring your food and beverages and check on your satisfaction. I went with my three adult daughters and grandson. We eat a plant based diet and were very happy with our sandwiches. I chose the Mediterranean which may have been wrong for me. I don't like olives and I missed that the bread was covered in an olive spread. But the tofu was delish! And the ciabatta bread was the best ever. I look forward to making this restaurant a frequent place to enjoy food with family and friends! Welcome to Charlotte Siggy's,!

dpmj2Td58sdKB2Q4mFz-5Q.text: Absolutely love this place! Healthy, organic options, fresh ingredients and delicious smoothies, all at reasonable prices. I've tried the live earth salad, salmon burger and almond butter/date smoothie - all superb!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Live Earth Salad with Grilled Chicken Strips

vS3Mw6xohhsiE2ypQqBOSg.text: Fresh, delicious food that feels healthy, at an everyday price... this place is a great find and new staple for me. The quinoa avocado salad is my favorite and keeps me coming back. Add the feta, enjoy the olives blending beautifully with this deliciously balanced mix with thinly sliced, fresh cukes and mixed greens, and share any other dish on the menu with your date... I'm sure you'll leave content and smiling. I've also tried their turkey burger, which was good, but lacked any punch flavor wise, and their gluten/dairy/meat free eggplant lasagna which was unique-- good texture, tasty red sauce and impressive body given the fact that it's free of most things I love!  Quick, courteous service, lovely ambiance, quaint location on Elizabeth Street. Great for lunch or dinner with a friend, or even a low key, unpretentious (first) dinner date.

nmnK2IELYAjr3kH9eXOeVQ.text: WOW!  Me and my boyfriend went here Last Saturday night and we're still talking about the Salmon Burgers!! They're perfectly seasoned and cooked, the bun is so delicious, and the vegan mayo is delightful-- amazing flavor combo!  My boyfriend isn't too crazy about all the organic places I usually have to drag him to... but Siggy definitely changed his mind! Even picky eaters will enjoy it!  Not to mention the ambiance is very cute, the service is attentive and helpful.  Only issue: it's pretty loud... but the food makes it well worth it!  BRAVO!

hnhbIe80bKaHtPbGea0_hA.text: Siggy's definitely does in fact serve *good food*, nothing to write home about or delicious enough to crave randomly, but certainly palatable. It's all GOOD but not particularly creative or unique. Also, vegans be warned: it is a vegan friendly place, but it's not the kind of place that makes a lot of non-vegan things vegan. There is no mac n "cheeze" or bbq "chickun" type stuff, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. Just real food being naturally vegan and not pretending to be something else like some weird imposter.   The best thing that Siggy's has to offer is that it has vegetarian, vegan, gluten free, and meat options, so it's good for any kind of group....in theory. The reason it isn't so group friendly in practice is that the music is always blaring. Like hardcore EDM type stuff. I couldn't tell if I was at a casual dinner or tryna rage (which I might've been down to do if I hadn't been trying to enjoy some vegan pasta and a nice glass of wine).   Even after asking the staff to turn it down, I still had to yell in order to hear my friends over the pumping tunes. I guess this is more of a place where you go with only one other person and sit on the same side of the booth next to each other (yuck) and whisper sweet nothings directly into your date/friend/acquaintance's ear. But if that's what you're looking for, head on over.  PS. If you order the chocolate chip cookie, you should know it is more accurately ginger cookie + chocolate chips. Good nonetheless.  PS to Siggy's: What is with your website? It makes me think that your restaurant is going to be a Chipotle-esque, uber-casual atmosphere with unflattering fluorescent lighting. I was pleasantly surprised to see some mood lighting and a cool atmosphere, but that website has got to go.

OPwYT0C1yxpg0TCNbI5xnQ.text: Nice ambience. The food was good and the waiter was kind. The food really tasty we tried the Salmon burger and the lasagna with eggplant and tofu (could have been a bigger portion). The end result was very pleasant

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice ambience.

ckEyN8xK76ld0zDAmS4vcQ.text: I think the food is decent and healthy. However I was not impressed with the service. It took 40 mins for a sandwich and soup. Kept being told its on it way and 20 minutes later same answer. Whats annoying is the place wasnt busy at all.

UhaaixpQP_fnaVna6Bm0lQ.text: I've lived in NYC for roughly 8 years now.  When it comes to nutrition, most restaurants fall short somewhere in the cooking process, whether it's the marinade, the amount of butter used, or the temperature / duration of the cooking.  Thus there are very few restaurants that any certified dietician or nutritional scientist could strictly endorse.  But this restaurant is different.  It employs the right ingredients, proportions, and cooking techniques that promote optimal health.  In addition, Siggy's has just such variety:  Everything from a fine fillet of meat to fresh juices and smoothies, this place has you covered.  You also have endless possibilities in customizing your dishes with added ingredients!  Finally, the atmosphere is intimate, and the service is top-notch.

vuN6rEvZ_KtzaD1f7ZAJXg.text: Delicious food for the gluten-free, paleo, or the health conscious.  I'm a fan of their sweet potato with herbs, and turkey burger over greens. Almond milk is available here so that's a plus!

u_OLpujK2rPletepNOancA.text: Home cooking in the Bowery. This is probably how I'd set my plate on my porch when folks come over for brunch. Basic, wholesome, not a conversational piece of a menu but allows one to focus on good conversations. It's an ode to the Latin word for dining: conviviam.  Live together.

cNppbWih89w9lHUKb7fmZA.text: The place is really cute. The SALMON BURGER was the best I've ever had! I need the recipe. The price was great and service was good. I wish it were closer It would be my go-to place.

YJl8tmAljldtg7KmHmoxDQ.text: Siggy's Good Food serves fresh, healthy food that is - as its name describes - good (but not great).  A friend and I came for dinner on a Friday night, and were seated quickly; service was attentive.  I ordered the black bean wrap ($12.50), and my friend ordered the salmon burger ($12.50).  The menu featured myriad salads, sandwiches, burgers, entrees, and a whole page of smoothies and juices.  Both of our dishes were alright: the salmon burger had nice seasoning, and the vegan mayo was flavorful.  However, the burger was a bit on the smaller side compared to the brioche bun.  My black bean wrap was also good, but nothing amazing; the patty was lost in the tortilla and greens, and a little dry.  Overall, although we were satisfied with our experience, the value just wasn't there.  Maybe it's worth another shot, but for now, Siggy's Good Food was just good.

9WpWjtacVvAA-5hXCnvgAA.text: I want this lasagna all day, every day. As a newly-converted vegan, I've been dying for a well-made lasagna, and I've been disappointed in all the vegan restaurants in the city. This was one of the first places I've found that offer a vegan lasagna that ISN'T raw. I couldn't even tell that it was made with eggplant instead of actual pasta. The dish was so flavorful that all of those "healthy vegan" swaps went undetected. I'm fairly certain celery was involved, which seemed unusual to me, but I liked it.  I can't wait to try brunch here.

7qGMgHVT_YK7OFHL6-noPA.text: I dont know where to begin! This place is just entirely awesome, tasty food and its very goood for you, ive never tasted a gluten free bread so tasty, most gluten free things taste like blahh, but not here. Organic grass feed beef, yummy.. Gluten free beer, yeahh, omg awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy!

McjaMoe0ArXQopFYu_7Rtw.text: Flavorful food, attentive and never pretentious service, relaxed vibe (mix of Louis Armstrong jazz and reggae). What's not to love about this place?  No real deserts, but they have decent organic wines  Oh and the gluten free artichoke pasta is delic

8QHOamaU2FJfk3pxRnqxsg.text: their black bean veggie burger is one of the best! friendly service. nice atmosphere

5eHOOpV7LMm4-VzFLphXEA.text: Absolutely loved this place! I had the eggplant lasagna, and my date had the chicken cutlet sandwich. We both ate every last bite of it. The lasagna was so good - it has tofu and veggies. No noodles! I love my carbs, but this was outstanding. Perfectly seasoned and so flavorful. The best veggie lasagna I've ever had. Although I didn't try it, my date very much enjoyed his meal as well. The atmosphere was nice, and the service was great! Definitely be back!

5n4ujNGQNsRA2Re4DfAkCw.text: The food here was delicious. My friends and I came on Halloween night and they were able to take all 10 of us (split between 2 tables). The waiters were really friendly and gave us juice shots. A bunch of us ordered off the vegan menu and everyone loved their food. The eggplant lasagna was DELICIOUS. And a bunch of us got vegan brownies (prepacked by the register) as we left. We were all saying it was the best tasting brownie we'd ever had!!

Heos-UqdDu9EhTgic0TrPg.text: Wow! What a find!  Chose this place because my friend is vegetarian. I'm usually a raging carnivore, but found plenty on the menu that looked great.  I got there a little early and sat at the bar, watching the food come out of the kitchen and everything looked absolutely delicious with generous, hearty serving sizes.  I ended up ordering the salmon burger (based on Yelper recommendations) with a side of sweet potatoes and my friend had the tofu lasagne. Both were outstanding and flavorful.  Service was efficient and friendly, prices were very reasonable and the cafe had a really cosy, casual vibe. Perfect for a catch up with friends.  Will definitely be back!

OZqvex0MjMxgXdkaCPoLtw.text: My review is probably a little bit biased as I am not this huge health food eater. As I have noticed with a lot of the other reviews, if that is your thing, you will love this place. If not, you will think it's OK but kinda overpriced for what you get.  A friend wanted to dine here so I figured I would give it a shot. I tried the Garden Veggie Sandwich which consists of Avocado, Cucumbers, Clover Sprouts, Carrots, Greens & Homemade Parsley Hummus. I also had them add some Tofu to make it a bit more filling.   The sandwich was decent but I kept feeling like I was missing something. Maybe a side of fries or a salad that consisted of more than a couple greens on the side of the plate. I found myself pulling the sandwich apart and trying to make it into a salad and half sandwich.   When the bill came (after tax and tip). I owed $17. For just a sandwich (no side, no drink, no lottery ticket haha).   So for me, I would much rather dine elsewhere. Nothing was wrong with the food and the wait staff was friendly, allowing me to give them 3 stars. But i would really advise only coming here if you believe it necessary to overspend on organic sandwiches and the like.

vmSWF2336yiZbMkrD02zrg.text: Love the Mediterranean touch of their beef hamburger with cumin and cilantro. Espectacular salads. Really good service. Don't miss the raspberry bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef hamburger and earth life salad.

h-VVFZaWof1dwwSvkZLEMQ.text: Cool spot, tucked away on a small quiet street. A little hard to find since their storefront is blocked with insulating curtains but once you step in, it's a pretty chill cafe/restaurant that serves organic foods and smoothies for the health-conscious. I ordered a custom smoothie and sandwich and enjoyed the freshness of it all. I didn't even have to ask for no mayo to be included as they automatically prepare the foods with minimal dressings. There were a few other groups having more intimate dinners with bottles of wine and such but I came because I wanted a quick healthy bite.

sI0Whpl262I6t0e2YfVKjw.text: Food is great, service and space great, but all ruined by worst soundtrack ever. Soul-crushing early 80s mistakes, BLARING. Get your food to go.

_AbnCGYrw_hKU6LvhIyuYw.text: All the good comfort foods, without the guilt.  You can tell they use great local ingredients and prepare their dishes honoring those ingredients.  Not overloading dishes with butter and salt.    Great burger and lasagna.  The best gluten free beer I have had in a long while.  I'll be back again soon.  Oh and the service was great too.

9JpSX5CviPht7FELBBcw1w.text: Service was great-- our server was very friendly, the black bean and sweet potato cake was crumbly but delicious, the bread was amazing, the garlic lentil soup was savory and had just the right amount of cumin, and the veggie sandwich was fresh, but a bit lacking in the amount of hummus. Iced chai latte was good, but a bit watered down. Definitely a treat!

6CzDyWOSpLoUEypjY_ScdQ.text: Good service good atmosphere good quality food and good portion sizes I cannot get enough of this restaurant and I really think that I would pick the beef stew as my last meal haha really my favorite joint in town healthy fresh organic local what else do you need

DfxRscpPgB_8rbA5ec3P2g.text: Good quality food , I had the wild salmon burger and the rosemary sweet potatoes on the side and boy it was amazingly delicious and the people were really nice!  Definitely will come back again and perhaps be a regular and also for the Brooklyn heights location ! Both awesome

NgiORqSuvNmg_yNm60fLgg.text: This is right next to my gallery and I always have exceptional service. I'm a big foodie but aside from the pricing, it's fantastic and tastes fresh. (You never know what's actually fresh and what's not so to be fair they are miles ahead)

se9W3bva2L78fmtzBC7b-g.text: Amazing salmon burger on a gluten-free bun. Eddie, presumably the owner, introduced himself. High-vibe food, high-vibe people.

ik6kfTw1ydy-YvgYZZn0aQ.text: I am really glad I found another place to accommodate my gluten free girlfriend and also uses all organic food. The beef burger was large and has a blend of herbs and spices that make it unique and delicious amongst serious burger competition in the area. I will definitely be going back to try the salmon burger and more of the fresh juices. The dining room has a great view of the alley behind the building and a fireplace, I can't wait to come back in the winter.

WsQbxKFMTYeJcS6QcsStyA.text: I am a bit of a health nut, and love wholesome meals that have good flavor. I love Siggy's.  If you are looking for a healthy meal, with lots of options, you need to try it.  If you are looking for pizza and buffalo wings and a beer, probably want to skip it until you are on your health kick. ;) They serve wine, no cocktails or beer. Lots of smoothies to choose from as well.  I had the lentil garlic soup and I want their recipe.  I will go back.

sWf0Y-wCTTq6g2mNOKJm6A.text: Everything we've had here has been great! The Beef Stew is awesome! Substitute sweet potatoes instead of the Quinoa and its so yummy! Great leftovers the next day too.  The Gluten Free burger buns are one of the better ones in town, not dry at all.  I just wish they were open on Sundays. :(

Qq3EaxHDH3RqdONHqNMsGw.text: Perfect everything - ambiance, flavors, aliens, veggies, cider. Exactly what I wanted. The guy across the table from me says four and a half, but I'll stick to five!

p3FwpNOGdHR2z7_Y_xYL0A.text: I really love this place. Not only is the food pretty outstanding, it's a mecca if you have food allergies as they are very knowledgable about their ingredients. I love the wild salmon burger and their soups. Their sweet potatoes are delish as well. I've been to both locations but particularly love this spot, as it's not too crowded yet cozy.

1h72bZ0TiS9yfXiw5SsuVg.text: The veggie burger was amazing. The service was a bit slow, but good vegetarian/vegan food.

uMeKFQ-apLtrVdP0yaNAxQ.text: Recently discovered this gem, had gone here once with a friend and I couldn't remember their exact location but I remembered the aliens on the wall lol and amazing salads. I googled some keywords like "alien decor vegatarian" and ta-da!! After a few quick looks found the address to this lovely place. I could eat everything on the menu, best part-they're all healthy!!!!

6J0INJptcaOfhGqas1kGGg.text: Delicious and healthy food, awesome service, great prices, and casual/quirky/fun ambiance... Doesn't get much better than that for a low-key dinner in Manhattan. We tried the Quinoa Spinach Cakes, the Wild Salmon Burger w/side salad, and the Eggplant Veggie & Tofu Lasagna - all were amazingly yummy and obviously made with fresh ingredients... Highly recommend!!!

Xl62D75FwWlVoXQk4_l0OQ.text: why I ended up here I really couldn't tell you. for a place that made me wait 15 minutes for a table, the food was confused as to what it was trying to be and mediocre at best. had to pour an entire container of salt into my recommended bean soup (something I never do) and the two salads at the table were lame. the place was decently priced, could've been worse, but by no means worth an evening of your time. reminded me of the restaurant in "Grandma's Boy," except my waiter's name wasn't Shiloh.

JXhUTMBZlXdWW0JPEldnIw.text: Healthy food, an abundance of vegetarian options, lots of leafy greens, great blended juices and smoothies. I had a hard time deciding what to order, but fortunately my lunch companions let me sample their choices too, so I got to experience a range of Siggy's offerings. Cozy restaurant and good service, with decent prices. Siggy's would be a standout in California, where high quality fresh vegetables are ubiquitous. In Manhattan, it is truly a gem, and worth the trek across town for lunch.

3uOJ_jnxyr0ntNAfrHft4w.text: Food great! Kitchen fast, juice awesome, salad delicious, takes a long while to get order in, call ahead and save yourself 15 minutes wait

TAPFBZJ-mORPsYWZHa1ZtA.text: This is a great lunch or dinner spot. I came with a group of 8 here my first time. I had the beef stew which was flavorful and delicious. My friend let me try some of her flank steak sandwich and I was amazed. I do not think of getting steak on a sandwich since I do not like bread. Even though the flank steak was well done rather than rare or medium rare which is how I prefer my steak, I really thought it was a great dish. I don't know if the steak was marinated or what gave it that flavor, but it worked with the greens, mushrooms and ciabatta bread. My other friends all enjoyed their foods as well. I ordered the flank steak sandwich the next time I came here with another friend and ate it with one side of the bread with a fork and knife. Again, I don't like too much bread so I didn't eat the other side of bread. This is not to say there wasn't enough meat; the portion size was good. This was the best steak sandwich I had.   They also have smoothies, juices, and hot soups. If I pass by and the restaurant isn't too crowded, I might get a smoothie or juice to go.   The food and drinks are organic. Well worth the price.

YQMrtFlyCcAmFD9csFzZ-Q.text: I'm really picky when it comes to salmon... I find most salmon to be overcooked. The salmon burger here was perfect... exactly what I was hoping for! An adorable, almost hidden spot-- surprisingly there was a wait at 9pm on a Tuesday evening! Well worth it.

PNSZTNp2UDwJCXQMJt9HeA.text: So good! I live for their Veggie burgers, they are absolutely the best! Everything I order there is super fresh. Wonderful place.

borfYPY4GBJsnsK3Dcv6ag.text: We stumbled upon this quaint little cafe while we were searching for a bathroom. We never intended on staying, simply asked for our toddler to use the potty. However, after being greeted with warm smiles and inviting atmosphere we decided to stay for brunch. What a delightful surprise! We absolutely loved everything from the buckwheat pancakes to the delicious omelets. The service was excellent! Will definitely be coming back! Thank you!

hOYrpx7fjQQdoxh0tKekvQ.text: Just one of those places that gets it - how to prepare and serve healthy food, one of those menus where you want to order six different things, a warm, friendly atmosphere with a fire place for winter nights, a great location on the tip-top of Elizabeth Street, just a block from Lafayette in one direction and the Bowery in the other. Siggy knows her stuff and has created one of the best little restaurants in town. Don't forget to browse the juice bar menu as well.

HvAb451C7SAIXCY7o14bUA.text: I came here my final night in NYC with my host who was sceptical. I'd been meaning to come sooner and I had high hopes which were totally met. We had a stunning salad and some of the spinach cakes which were bo! The dessert wasn't *as* amazing as the main but I was fully impressed even so. The green juice was fab. Staff were super attentive and helpful - going the extra step for sure :)

9IIiqLZ2-Z9ZdZpYTcjMEg.text: List of Greats! in Siggy's Good Food:  - Food - People - Interior Design - Music  Greatest of all is fairly priced. Does not matter if you're a vegan or vegetarian or pesceterian or none. There is something delicious and healthy for everyone. For everyone who cares to eat healthy and delicious in a soothing environment.

GHsT48773pkfXxYFlvRcAw.text: Nothing short of fantastic.  Comfortable, hip atmosphere, excellent service and some of the best food around. Flexible environment, great for food with friends but equally good for a romantic dinner date.  Top notch service that really cares about their customers - including Siggy herself.  I eat here at least once a month and no matter what I order, I leave filling full but without the lethargy associated with less healthy meals. In addition to great food, the smoothies rock.  Aliens eat free!

MvnfsuWiJKmPHCZu26KbdA.text: I love this place, and I come here A-L-O-T. I work in the neighborhood and I think we go to Siggy's at least once a week. The food is terrific. I'm not a vegetarian but I get the Veggie Burger almost every other time I am there, and it is one of the best VB's I've had. The smoothies are also very good and when Siggy is around, she is very sweet. The art revolves and that is good cause for a while there it was kinda weird, I am quite glad the Master of Puppets and sexy Ronald McDonald aren't staring at me while I eat anymore. The service is hit and miss, if I had only been there once regarding my most recent trip this rating would be lower but since I'm a regular, I know what to expect from who. They also have a place in BK Heights that I went to several times years ago and that was much smaller but equally good!

ukodY1r83iij40mw7Eqeww.text: I too had the salmon burger with a side of roasted sweet potato, and it was all very good.  It's a nice lunch spot---a cheery and comfortable space with very friendly service.  Looks like you want to get in early because a line for tables starts to build up by about 1pm.

lQq0sgF-oH1ts0JZUeTMmA.text: Siggy's puts me in my happy place.  Nice atmosphere, pleasant service, great healthy food.   Had a green juice, the beet salad, the vegan lasagne, and the raspberry bar a la mode....fantastic.  I will be back!

UkPXdSUUl-EW4o4NYSkKeA.text: Had a great meal here and it's nice to go to a vegetarian restaurant that caters to many different allergies but also serves a nice glass of wine! Can't wait to go again.

10rHUWzUIM4_f1gaoU-Rfw.text: Just discovered Siggy's last night on Elizabeth after work.  Tired, hungry, just wanted a simple inexpensive dinner before heading home.  Chef Siggy and her manager Michael instead gave me a great low key dining experience.   It's pretty fine to find a health conscious organic restaurant that serves beer and wine, organic beer and wine in fact.  So far I've only tried the spelt macaroni and cheese, which is to die for.  Perfectly cheesey gooey-ness and the organic spelt elbow noodle carry the dish.  Excellent comfort food style meets healthy foodie considerations.  I'll be back to try everything on the menu and I'll be bringing all my friends!

xq7DLmOj3n5Il7CNCYWQLA.text: As someone who suffers from so many different food allergies and intolerances, I often find eating out very stressful. However at Siggys I was able to enjoy a main and a dessert and even now, an hour later, there are no signs of my allergies flaring!  The gluten free wild salmon burger was to die for. I had a green salad as accompaniment and it was a proper salad, not just a whimsy lettuce leaf and it wasn't drenched in some calorific dressing.  For dessert I had coconut mylk icecream with a gluten free vegan choc chip cookie. It was so tasty! Definitely head here for a great Meal!

Qz_-02yycAfcMB8K8C8TjA.text: Wonderful menu from vegans to meat eaters! The atmosphere is peaceful, stylish, the food is SO fresh and delicious. My favorite is veggie tofu eggplant lasagna. There is no pasta in this meal. Then, I HAVE to get an order of tofu fingers to go, for another meal. OMG, its great!

k2UzBwNDkeQwmiwS8UfeOw.text: I like the location, convenient to Sheen Center and NYU.  Enjoyed the Salmon burger and roasted cauliflower soup!  Have a nice selection of beer, mostly from the Peak Organic brewery. Quiet atmosphere and yet somehow seemd family friendly.

NZ3b0_aaJKp0_unEAzbGrw.text: Great little neighborhood find.  You must try the burger - the flavor is out of this world!  Menu has a great variety from breakfast food, to fresh smoothies, salads and sandwiches.  The staff is very friendly and service is great.  You might even meet the  owner, as she circles the restaurant greeting guests and checking on their experience.

48455b5bBaDJWYmVZgKtjQ.text: This place is awesome! Very casual atmosphere and friendly staff. There are lots of vegan options but also many non-vegan options so it's a great place to eat with everyone! It's a plus that everything is organic and PLUS the prices are extremely reasonable considering the quality of ingredients (and compared to other manhattan restaurants). Will definitely come back if it stays this way!   The eggplant veggie lasagna was very fresh and delicious. The tomato sauce was fresh and sweet. You can taste the fresh tomatoes. The green sides were also very good (kale/broccoli/spinach with garlic).

HZyze8Kxd6UIZURjXtmAOg.text: Siggy's is free for Alien's because their food is out of this world.   Have Siggy's cater your next event, and your guests will be delighted. By far my favorite food experience was a buffet of Siggy's at the office. Try the Quinoa Cakes and Raw Slaw and prepare to be amazed.

t7IXhcJ91w0xGg1ZhHYLMg.text: When you're racking your brain for possible complaints about a restaurant and the only negative point you can muster is that your table had been wobbling irritatingly throughout your meal, you know the food must be good. My fiance and I arrived at Siggy's doorstep after a lengthy outing in the city that left us famished - hungry enough to ignore the strange and copious alien- and UFO-centric decor that might have been bizarre enough to cause us to pause on any other day. Even so, we ventured in bravely, led by our appetites and heartened by the enthusiastic reviews here on yelp. At around six-thirty on a Monday evening, many of the tables were already bustling and the friendly server had to lead us to a table toward the rear of the restaurant. While perusing the menu, we were given a plate of sandwich bread slices and olive oil to start, which seemed a little unconventional as they seemed like they were cold, untoasted, and seemed to have been pulled out of a bag of Arnold's bread. Still, each slice had generous flecks of sesame seeds, nuts, and oats throughout and we munched on them without complaint.   The menu is fairly short but even a perfunctory glance reveals Siggy's commitment to organic and sustainably sourced fare. For instance, all of the piscatorial dishes clearly make mention of wild caught fish, allowing my fiance to place a guilt-free order of a salmon burger. As an added plus, the patties are made without fillers, which meant that each bite guaranteed nothing but a mouthful of fresh, flaky fish. Burgers here can be ordered with the traditional bun, a gluten-free bun (for an added charge), or atop a generous bed of mixed greens, with a small cup of dressing on the side. My fiance went with the latter and his side of the table went completely silent after his entree arrived at the table, save the occasional sounds of pleasant masticating. As for my own order, I surprised both of us by choosing the noodle-less eggplant lasagna. Noodles are, in my well-vocalized opinion, the backbone of a good pasta dish, and my longstanding dislike of eggplant is equally well-known, so by all rhyme and reason, I should have hated this dish.   I not only liked it; I INHALED it.   In fact, my fiance had to forcibly wrench the dish away from me when I began to lick the plate clean. The steaming, tall tower of lasagna, comprised of many layers of eggplant and vegan ricotta, arrived in an ample pool of red sauce. Though without a hint of dairy cheese, the tofu was cleverly dressed to create a creamy mouth-tribute to the real deal. From start to finish, we enjoyed our meal here and would definitely return for more!
