5BA6YSUsX3-PQ0QLRB_MfQ.text: Went for brunch with my family.  My brother and sister-in-law are regulars there and thought I would like it...and they were right!  I'm a super picky vegetarian and there was plenty for me to choose from.  I had the veggie black bean burger, which was a bit spicy.  It definitely needed some avocado,  but that's about the only thing I could imagine making the burger better.    Everyone else had breakfast food, and everyone polished off their dishes.   The staff was extremely nice and accommodating.  Now I know why my brother and S-i-L are regulars!  I would be too if I lived closer!    Oh, and the raspberry bars, which I grabbed to go, was as fresh and delicious as the rest of the food.  BE BACK SOON!

0P4Dzw5zON5juegI2XdC1g.text: The staff were so nice. Loved the food. I ordered the Turkey and Cheese sandwich. Loved their selection of sandwiches and salads. Right near my apt, so I will definitely be coming back!

9rHlmF50_3CJwW0jd2rNaA.text: Cozy place,  tried the garlic herb olive oil pasta with kale and asparagus .  Very tasty. Would recommend.

JzIFeUKQnghks99BymyPsA.text: Thier dishes are always fun, delicious, and fresh; but a tad bit expensive. Easy to get a table and everyone is very friendly.

pyoYXw5N_dt1xFgxT_k2sg.text: their wild salmon burger with avocado is quite magical... its super juicy and seasoned to perfection. I get it on a wheat wrap with a side order of roasted sweet potatoes. I like it so much that I always order it every time I come here.  I also like their lentil garlic soup and my bf also enjoyed his wild king salmon entree with sauteed garlicky kale . the food here is very fresh, wholesome and reasonably priced.

VE502_zHLb7kGDY7BK90yg.text: AMAZING.  I'm allergic to gluten and dairy and this place is heavenly.   Had the juicy salmon burger on the buttery gluten free bun, with the avocado and vegan mayo. Fantastic. One of the better gluten free buns around, doesn't fall apart, great "normal" breadiness.  Had the side of garlic kale -- delicious. Perfectly salty and flavorful for my liking in sauteed greens.   And lastly -- shared the gluten free/vegan brownie a la mode with Coconut Bliss vegan ice cream on top.  Daamnnnn....  The menu offers a delightful plethora of almond milk smoothies and vegan salads and gluten free cookies and coffee and a tasty brunch on weekends.   Siggy's is not just "doable" as in merely allergen-friendly -- the food is excellent!

QlYpdxuB9iXKtDHJ3Ecnww.text: This is a fantastic place: food is delicious (love the bean wrap), the staff is friendly and courteous, and they are environmentally conscious.  The atmosphere is great and cheerful and feels very local.

KY9lBU3lz3I6erh9sSEMLQ.text: Wonderful food and service. A bit loud, but kinda comes with the territory. Fresh healthy veggie and vegan options, great juices and smoothies. Had an omelet last time I was here - very good.

4sPkhdbjSF5_hDMqE_u9hQ.text: Great spot for a healthy meal. Great salads and smoothies, veggies galore! Very spacious, staff is attentive and friendly!

EWU-va9P3ivRMcX7qiCVCA.text: As always,Yelp doesn't lie.  Siggy's didn't look that promising from the exterior, but once you walk in, it's a cheerful, comfortable space staffed by an incredibly friendly group of folks. The menu is mostly "health" food - there's a fair amount of veggie and vegan food, though Siggy's also serves (healthy) burgers, turkey burgers, chicken noodle soup, and the like.  If you're headed there for lunch, I'd recommend the 1/2 sandwich and soup - go with the lentil garlic soup (there's no salt on the table, perhaps my only critique of the place, and the soup could certainly use a dash) and the 1/2 veggie sandwich (which will show you all of the magnificent things one can do with a bunch of fresh veggies and some really good bread. And, if you're feeling sick (or tired, or vitamin deprived), check out the ample selection of smoothies, all of which can be enhanced with vitamins and herbs.

jzKLOVWyvu9f3Wx9KWK6og.text: Great warm and cozy environment, attentive wait staff and delicious vegetarian food! The portions are generous and varied. The lasagna was amazing!! Not to miss!  Only disappointment was the dessert selection, which included wrapped desserts that were served that way. It was my birthday lunch, so that was a little bit of a bummer.

wkRPNzdLoOPFsturpYxa0A.text: Oh Siggy's, how I love thee. Quality food, good prices, friendly staff, and really nice atmosphere.  Let's start with the food: I usually get the salmon burger w/ a side of roasted potatoes. This is my go-to dish whenever I come to siggy's because its delicious, and the ingredients are quality. For brunch, I love their breakfast burrito and buckwheat pancakes! They also have really good coffee and smoothies which was tasty and refreshing.  Prices: A bit pricey but totally worth it for the quality and freshness of their ingredients.  Staff: The guys and gals working here are really friendly, down-to-earth, and accommodating. Attentive but not overly so.  Atmosphere: I love the atmosphere. It's calm and relaxing-- a place where you can actually have a conversation.  Can't wait to come back and try their pastas, appetizers, and soups!

iDvZ2KsgAPihg7yZq5KU-A.text: A coworker brought me here for lunch one day and I have been hooked ever since. Even on the foulest days of this past winter, I braved the elements just to have a bite of the best food on the Lower East Side. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, the staff is great, and they do takeaway/delivery. Also amazing: the menu is perfect for those with dietary restrictions/preferences, with a solid number of dishes being vegan and/or gluten-free.   Things you should definitely try: the salmon burger (SO GOOD), roasted sweet potatoes (MUST-HAVE), and my personal favorite, the olive oil, garlic, and artichoke pasta (GLUTEN-FREE AND VEGAN)(ABSOLUTELY TO DIE FOR).   I brought my brother here a little while ago for lunch, and he was skeptical at first.   "This place looks really crunchy," he said as he browsed the menu. "It's all so...organic."   But that's what's so amazing about this place. You forget about how good the food is for you. You just relish how good the food is, period.   One bite into the artichoke pasta and his eyes started misting over. "I had no idea food could taste like this," he said. "It's beautiful."  Couldn't have said it better myself.

p1Crqk2h_OMe0DwLK2oItw.text: I love this place. I aggressively love this place. It was a hard bummer when the downtown Brooklyn location closed. The garlic herbs and olive oil and artichoke pasta is INSANE. It seems completely boring on the menu but it is ON POINT and does not leave you hungry. Also the salmon burger is life changing.

I-cGdiplPkytoIpbAkm1dg.text: X: are you fine with just a little dried up veggie sticks? Y: yeah, i dont care... just some vegetables... whats wrong if a little dry... How much do they cost btw? X: nothing much, 2$ with 8$ worth of fabulous hummus... Y: no no no... wait a min...those veggie sticks better be fresh cut if I am paying for it...  This sums up my experience at Siggys... in short: Food: delicious Ambiance: wonderful Am I satisfied? Just about...

ecv-GNUuM2oOSinrZYKYaQ.text: I love this place! It's very quaint and eclectic and it's organic! The food tastes great and prices are very reasonable. There's a wide selection of beverages like Lenny Boy Kombucha, organic coffee, tea, organic wine, beers, etc. I will be back often! 5Q3Un43WaqYn-SIZrwnYcw.text: Ever since I saw Siggy's was opening I'd been excited to try it out, considering Charlotte's healthy cafe scene is mediocre at best. After driving around a random area mislabeled "Plaza Midwood", I arrived at Siggy's. It was an unassuming storefront on a quiet, dark street corner that screamed gentrification.   Siggy's is the Bernie Sanders of Charlotte cafes. The menu is salads, smoothies/juices and sandwiches. Vegan, vegetarian, carnivore, omnivore... you are all safe here. However, I would mostly recommend Siggy's to those who ate that one extra slice of pizza last night and are seeking atonement. Siggy's will cleanse your mind, body and spirit with free love and quinoa.  I ordered the popular Greek avocado/quinoa salad with turkey ($15). It was massive and really quite tasty. Another bonus - they sell wine and beer, so go ahead and drink away your sorrows.  We all need you Siggy's. Thanks for being here, and making me feel a little less guilty about my Bojangles obsession.

7MJEcQIslJA4eFeTvfw2yA.text: This place was good, sorry to see it's now closed bizjournals.com/charlott...

joriBusYuFTPVFpmW_5m0Q.text: I've had Siggy's bookmarked for quite some time and today seemed like the day to give them a try. The ambiance was nice and the waiter and juice bar host were friendly, but the stars are lacking here for the food.   I ordered the black bean veggie burger and switched out the wrap for a GF bun. I wish I hadn't or had been swayed otherwise because the bun couldn't house the burger and it crumbled after the first bite. The bun also soaked up all of the mayo and pesto, so it was pretty dry. I ended up picking away at it with my fork and eating it as a salad.   I wanted to go the beer route, but at 7 bucks for a Samuel Smith (no HH prices) I decided to put that towards something healthy and the Coco Peanut Brain seemed like a good route. It wasn't my favourite and the cacao nibs make for a gritty smoothie.   Overall spent 24 bucks (GF bun costs an extra dollar on an already pricey $13.50 wrap) before tip on a pretty mediocre and unfulfilling meal. The hype seems to be over the salmon burger and beef stew. Not so much for the vegan options.

rUGetT2_eNGYyOmkGk_6Ww.text: My husband and I popped into Siggy's for a takeout sandwich and salad. We wanted to stay and dine but simply couldn't swing it this particular day.  We had peeked at the menu the previous day and it just looked really delicious.  We parked on a side street but there were a handful of spots in the back. There is also an outside patio where you can eat.  It's airy and bright in there with a cooler of a good selection of juices, natural sodas and kombucha. There is also a fresh juice menu with full cups of juice or juice shots. The 'Flu Shot' is a great pick me up; greens, lemon, echinacea, ginger and cayenne. Stir it or the pepper might settle! Super flavorful.  Note that they use organic ingredients. Also, they offer beer and wine.  Food wise we went with the Italian Smoked Turkey Sub on ciabatta. This has smoked deli turkey, red roasted peppers, Swiss, greens and olive tapenade. Again, wow flavor packed and so fresh! Then we paired this with the 'Raw Slaw'; shaved green cabbage, carrots and kale and loaded with sesame seeds accompanied with lots of lemony olive oil vinaigrette. We actually got such a generous portion we saved some to go with dinner.  You can add many customizations like boiled eggs and tofu and the list goes on.  I'm very thrilled to have Siggy's close by and look forward to dining in.

NLbVisHFSh0XtDqszIf9vQ.text: What you need to know:  - Healthy restaurant that offers vegan, vegetarian, gluten free, meat and fish options  - Accepts credit cards - Affordable prices given the location  What we ordered: - Black bean burger in wheat wrap price $13.50 - the warm black bean burger was rich and earthy. The basil pesto, vegan mayo and tomato cilantro salsa added so much flavor to the wrap. While I enjoyed it, I thought it was overpriced, $13.50 for a wrap?  - Veggies and tofu Mediterranean sub on ciabatta bread $13.50 - the kalamata olive paste and olive oil gave the sub a complex taste. While I thought it was just ok, my friend preferred this over the wrap.

I really hope this place flourishes.

rioyLLU19mSo6axwK3uoCA.text: Just read this place has closed which is a huge bummer bc it's my *favorite* lunch spot in Charlotte. Very sad to see u guys go Siggy!!

ck-x9v_Gnt0oMvrINnlwkQ.text: Wow--this place was so much better than I imagined it would be. It had some good write ups about it, but it way surpassed my expectations.  I went here for dinner on a Wednesday night with a friend and was able to be seated right away.  We started with an order of the hummus and split orders of the beef stew and salmon.  The hummus was delicious and was a good sized portion as well. If there's hummus on the menu, I order it--and this was one of the better ones I had. It's a bit of a bummer they don't have pita, but the ciabatta is pretty good as well.  The main meals were also very good. The salmon was cooked absolutely perfectly and was super flavorful. I also got it with sides of sweet potatoes and broccoli that was cooked simply, but had great flavor.  The beef stew was also a good sized portion and was very tasty. The meat was very tender and mixed well with the brown rice and kale.  Overall, this place serves up some excellent dishes that skew towards the healthy side and come out quickly. The service was friendly and attentive. The only major downside for me are that the dishes are a bit on the pricey side--around $25 each--and the seating arrangements aren't always the most comfortable, but that definitely shouldn't stop you from checking this place out.

h2gqABzurp-UO69s-nEWmg.text: I was excited to see this place open after reading their past location's menu and their mission. The interior is super cute and the staff is very friendly. I was hoping to see more plant based options like they offered in NY. Maybe they're waiting for the demand? I ordered a side cabbage kale salad and Mediterranean tofu sandwich. For the $5 side salad, it was just cabbage, kale and sesame seeds. Maybe some carrots or cucumbers or something would make the $5 easier to swallow. The sandwich had a great blend of flavors and I would recommend it.   I appreciate the cardboard to-go containers (yea, no styrofoam!) but I hope they can also switch to biodegradable utensils and/or not give me one unless I ask.   I look forward to the evolution of Siggy's and will try them again.

5siQo2_VchmLMaDcbHNDkA.text: Siggy's is a weirdo gem!! The menu is similar to a diner's and is very vegetarian friendly. The vibe is casual and chill and the decor is eclectic. I tried the vegan (until I sprinkled parm on top) (noodleless) lasagna. It was simple and delicious and made with a mix of eggplant, tofu, and other veggie goodness.

xi6NRi-IcgoVDUfTgEK9wA.text: SIGGYS BRUNCH IS NYC'S BEST KEPT SECRET.  When my GF and I are going out for weekend brunch, we are looking for the following:  -delicious, filling and satisfying without being too greasy or fatty (don't want to feel like crap and be useless for the rest of the day)  -doesn't break the bank  -not overly crowded, short wait time (when Im hungover on saturday at noon, the last thing I want to do is wait 2 hours to eat)  -a mind blowing breakfast burrito   -epic pancakes  Siggys checks all of these boxes and then some. Thankful for it's existence. You can find me here every Saturday, my only qualm is that they're closed on sundays. SIGGY, can you please open for Sunday brunch too?!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken crusted with almond. Delicious!!

wKw_VCSblVx5eZLvKgnAjg.text: Was craving something Vegan, as in more vegetables in my diet as this holiday season is a bit filling to say the least.  While not technically a vegetarian, I realize the need for a healthier diet versus one that isn't so good for the body, etc.  Plus I do like my veggies, but very much appreciate something more than a salad, a juice, or a sauteed mix. The hubby who was with me wasn't so keen for an all Vegan place to eat...  I saw the earlier reviews and am grateful to have stopped by.  Delicious, simply delicious.  I had the Eggplant, tofu ricotta lasagna.  My husband had the Chicken Mediterranean dish with brown rice and brocolli.  He inhaled his (not his style normally) and I was in good taste heaven. OMG...worth the commute, the walk, the time to go there and sit down to enjoy not just a healthier option meal, but a YUM YUM one!

Wxyx2qL7RWJo3kkAgfdhCQ.text: Let's start off with the fact that the place has a B rating. Not the end of the world but not great when most hole in the walls have A's. The owners try to hide the B on the door by keeping the door open. We only noticed the rating after we had sat down and ordered. They also try to justify the B rating by a few silly lines printed out below it which don't make any sense at all; something about sticking it to the man, when realistically they need to improve on their infraction received from the inspectors. Anyways the food is mediocre in taste, we came here for the gluten free options, had the burger with potatoes side (one for me and one for my guest) and a salad as an appetizer. Everything was just okay. Bill came out to $55, WAY overpriced for quality of food and taste. Shortly after, within an hour, both my guests and my stomach were very upset. Plain and simple this place is expensive, has a questionable food health rating, and causes stomach issues. 100% avoid and don't be deceived by their positive reviews.

nbmXjwt1G7UGcr32hvlW1g.text: There's something for everyone here, herbivores, carnivores and everything in between. Not many raw options besides the smoothies and juices that I've seen yet, but I could have overlooked. As a gluten-free vegan with only leanings towards raw at this point, I found many great options to eat for when I'm in the mood for a warm cooked meal, and I can rest assured that their guarantee is that they cook everything from scratch with whole, pure ingredients. Most of the staff seems very friendly and helpful (the two guys I dealt with when ordering out at the front counter were great) and the atmosphere is generally nice.   I've been there both on warm days, once mother's day and then again today, it was pretty warm and humid on both days and they didn't seem to have any sort of cooling systems to help allay the uncomfortable warmth which is a real nuisance to those who hate warm weather like I do. The bathroom the first time I had been in there had just been cleaned, and I get it, it's nyc, you want to slather that disinfectant on those surfaces, but it was so strong that being in the bathroom for less than 4 minutes, I got seriously lightheaded and my eyes started to tear. The smell of whatever they used in their cleaning products was intense.  But the food and the service is what matters to me most, and this place seems to meet the mark and know what it's doing.

QU6ej8gyUw1N9j_-GjwzNg.text: I'm obsessed with Siggy's salmon burger on gluten free bread with avocado, mushrooms, and sauteed onions. The restaurant has an amazing atmosphere and is truly dedicated to its "organic and healthy" lifestyle (even their toilet paper is "natural"!) The wall of "health care" food is adorable and fun to read. I respect them for being closed on Sunday's because it makes everyone healthier! The staff is fanstastic, so much fun and nice!!   Gluten free and dairy free people rejoice, because this place rocks!

eLsjP50Rec2aFQJGUoB-IQ.text: Delicious and guilt-free food. What's not to love? I got the eggplant veggie and tofu lasagna and found it both flavorful and filling. My friend and I also ordered smoothies with our food, and we appreciated the variety of nutritious beverages that were offered. I got the Source of Life smoothie which tasted great. It does get quite loud inside the restaurant around dinner time, but it was bearable, and the food was definitely worth it.

8jz5ci2hELuFdGdBxaZuwg.text: Siggy's has delicious, healthy, and fresh food. Their Kale Slaw salad is the best! My husband and I had our first date here and it has become one of our go to spots.

UQRD9WSJVvnQyudMFrNWQA.text: Although I am not GF, my girlfriend is... and this place made her dining experience quite difficult because she was overwhelmed by how many options there were.  We started off with some GF bread, which is a rarity at many places.  Eventually she settled on the live earth salad and added beets, which came to us with a great portion size and a good ratio of greens to toppings.  I ordered the Shaka-Shu-Ka, one of my first times ever having the dish and I would definitely get it again. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the portion size was big enough to fill me even after I entered the restaurant painfully hungry.  The eclectic vibe matches the options on the menu, and I will definitely be adding this to my list of places to go more often.

SOMh9S1uVTXytgfwWyc9BA.text: This location only a few months old and a well hidden secret. On a Friday night, it was full but not packed.   After a nice yoga workout, we were all hungry and consulted Yelp. Once again, Yelp came through and saved the day!  One of us is vegan and the other is gluten-free, so this place worked for all of us.   I tried the 3-bean, butternut squash soup. Very hearty and perfect for the cold Fall day!  I also had the SWEET POTATO CAKES and they were "ridiculous." That's what the waiter said when I asked if they were good and indeed, he was right.   I also had an organic IPA and it hit the spot...AAHHH.   For dessert, we shared a vegan, gluten-free walnut brownie a la mode with a scoop of coconut milk vanilla ice cream. Heavenly divine and a perfect way to end a beautiful day!   And if that weren't enough, I went to the bathroom after dinner and found this AMAZING QUOTE by Martha Graham:  "There is a vitality, a life force, an energy, a quickening that is translated through you into action, and because there is only one of you in all of time, this expression is unique. And if you block it, it will never exist through any other medium and it will be lost."  I'll definitely be back to try more yummy food and also to see live bands play here!

H0lAQy70GWUlzeUqSoNmWw.text: The service here is excellent! They also had a very decent gluten free bun (that didn't fall apart) that I ate with my burger. The food was pretty good, and I had the option to have a salad on the side. All in all a great experience

cZB8quu7TJ6uEsLOUxq06Q.text: Food was delightful. Only thing i didn't appreciate was the tomato and onion are an extra charge when on the menu it looks like they would be a free additive. Its very deceiving. I'm now one cup of coffee poorer than before.

wB0dMqefHn8xOr6i7QArXg.text: Healthy. Yummy. Chill.   So many healthy options to pick from. I went with the parsley hummus and slaw salad but every option on the menu was appealing.  Environment is artsy with fun and funky music. No shortage of tables for lunch crowds.

WlHhbu4Ghe9-UoTamL48bg.text: 1 star, because I've had several unaddressed issues there. The food is good, BUT it's too much $$$ for the poor way managers handle problems. Today long haired flannel guy (manager) walked away from my complaint instead of simply saying "sorry". A corporate place would treat one better, but someone actually personally owns this place. Another time a dark haired girl running the juice bar was cold and offered no solution to a simple problem. Simple problems handled poorly: - ground up pits in $9 smoothly (couldn't consume, girl could have offered a new one).  - kitchen employee cut my waiting in line for bathroom for his own use. Saw me and everything (Customer 1st..? Apology would have helped).  Take responsibility and communicate Siggy management!

VGvJUALrvYqpPY94FIs_jg.text: Honestly not my favorite vegan place. They acted too vegan if you know what I mean, everything was a little over done and protein packed. They clearly have a following but I will not be going back. Wasn't satisfied by anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kale and cabbage salad (it was mostly cabbage which was disappointing)

GrnFL8BYVZVwPfV4MzD5ag.text: Big fan of Siggy's in picturesque Brooklyn Heights.. THRILLED that they recently opened close to my office/abode on lovely Elizabeth Street off Houston. The food is super fresh, organic, delicious and there's plenty for omnivores including lots of vegetarian/vegan/gluten-free options (my favorite is the eggplant lasagna and the wild salmon burger is a popular choice).  The owner Siggy is a wonderful woman who cares about quality ingredients using organic & non-GMO food.  service is always friendly and efficient without being intrusive. So reasonably priced too.. entrees range from $10-$22.   Perfect for a date, business lunch or birthday dinner. Siggy's is cozy and unpretentious. What more could you want?   oh yeah... Aliens Eat Free!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

1aD44fHsJ_Sa2gU_fFY0Zg.text: Came here for dinner with my siblings and loved this place. We started with the Parsley Hummus. It was good but I guess my expectations were a little too high from reading previous reviews. For entree, I had the Live Earth Salad. It was gigantic and delicious! I felt really good about eating that one. The others had the Salmon Burger and the Eggplant & Tofu Lasagna and they were also delicious! Would definitely come back here again~

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Live Earth Salad
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Parsley Hummus

LFP2t04-uByl2s4-ynllXw.text: The name of this restaurant should come with a spoiler alert because guess what fam? Siggy's does have some good @ss food! I walked in with my arms folded like "Siggy's Good Food? I'll be the judge of that!"   I had some preconceived notions that organic food normally meant you had to sacrifice on tastes and pay way more money for your meal. So I was prepared to be let down like Giants fans any time Eli Manning is in the 2 minute drill.   I was immediately struck by the confidence of the man behind the register. He looked even more eager than we were for us to try his food. He was so excited it made me feel like it must've put his foot in these sandwiches!  The menu is really simple but has a lot of variety. I got the smoked turkey sub (as a gluten free wrap) and some roasted zucchini. They were both delicious! My wife had the local beef kabobs sandwich and it was also scrumptious. And I had a "Hint of Lime" water which was a new experience for me. It was also great.  The staff was friendly and attentive. The environment was clean with plenty of cozy seating.   It was all filling and yummy. I'll definitely return when I can. They're sort of on the other side of town from me and they're only open until 5pm so I'll definitely return when I have a day off.  I also saw a friend I play basketball with walking out of the restaurant as I was coming in. And him and his wife were like "Oh you're trying Siggy's! You're gonna love it!" It's like the universe wanted me to eat a Siggy's.   The friends name is Buddy and he had to stop playing basketball at lunch because he got a good job uptown. I almost didn't recognize him because his wife was beautiful and I said there's no way Buddy got game like that! But guess what? Buddy got game fam.  Anyways we don't play ball together any more but he was a cool guy. The lesson here is that people are put into your life for a reason and you don't always know what it is right away. I like the to think that the reason Buddy was put in my life was to solidify my choice to try Siggy's Good Food.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

17WeseBMcGgZ85uP9ENsFg.text: SO FREAKIN GOOD.   I absolutely love this spot. The food, vibes and service are all top notch. Everything is so fresh and you can tell they source high quality ingredients.   Highly recommend the beef kabob sandwich and crostini's- you will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best customer service!
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greek Style Quinoa Avocado Salad
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

MMGjg6oxuVAO1_IDDyvaiQ.text: TLDR: The food is organic, locally sourced, Mediterranean-inspired comfort food. The vibe is laid-back. The service is fast casual. I recommend both the steak sandwich and the beef kabob sandwich.  Before trying Siggy's, my favorite sandwiches were at NoDa Bodega. Now, my favorite sandwiches are at Siggy's.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

lYjuVzMfBOVPzQ8_OKFgJQ.text: With all of the great reviews, I can't believe it took me so long to try this place.   We came after a happy hour in the area. It's fast casual and there were tables available and no line to order.   We went with the steak sandwich and the beef kabob sandwich. Both were amazing. The bread and sauce really took the sandwich to the next level. I think I liked the beef kabob one a little more, but it's hard to pick. Definitely my favorite sandwiches in Charlotte.   We added a side of beets which were very good and all of the crostinis except the tuna one. The brie and fig was our favorite, but we liked them all. The only thing we probably wouldn't get again was the banana almond butter smoothie. It was ok, but not nearly as good as the rest.   I would highly recommend checking this place out for a quick, delicious meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crostinis
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak sandwich
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Almond butter banana smoothie

cXAkTgjvD48RBvr8GMY5iw.text: My husband and I have now been here twice. And we expect this may become one of our new regular spots. :)  The first time we came after having barbecue next door and just had a glass of wine (mine) and a beer (his). The atmosphere is cozy and semi romantic in the evening. It was a nice spot to extend our dinner experience with an after dinner drink and some bonus relaxation.  Yesterday morning we came back for their brunch. (Open at 10:30am on Sundays.) We both got the vegetable frittata, which was delicious and came with a side salad and a few toasted slices of their baguette. It was delicious and filling but not too heavy. The ingredients are all fresh and the meals are made in house (no microwave). The only thing I would have changed about my order is asked for the dressing on the side, but my husband was fine with his dressing amount. So it was definitely a personal preference, not a fault of the place.  I also picked up a "flu shot" juice on my way out. Totally medicinal in flavor, but I was told by the staff to expect that.  I definitely want to come back one day after a killer workout to try the cocoa peanut butter banana smoothie. It sounds delicious!  This is definitely a great contribution to the neighborhood. And we plan to support with our continued patronage. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside from back left booth
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable Frittata
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheers

RsoIl0hDoOUBqY6T1I5Ptw.text: Siggy's you did something amazing...you created a food memory for me. Sure it was late, sure I was hungry but you made me more than a sandwich. First the French Lentil Soup - I love Lentils and Lentil Soup - wow - total comfort food for me - great job! Then, that Kebab sandwich with the blistered peppers and habanero Mayo - probably the best thing I've eaten all month (and I eat a lot of good food). The girl at the register, so sweet and helpful - plus she brought me this sandwich...heavy sigh....  Siggy's - consider changing your name to Siggy's Great Food - I think you're being way too modest.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lentil soup

GNy7i16RwyGNqry9jEuzOQ.text: There's alot to love about Siggy's Good Food.  Tucked into the Belmont neighborhood, Siggy's has the feel of a local, hidden gem.  While small, it's intimate.  You can see food being prepared and often chat with Siggy who is working the kitchen, greeting customers and keeping an eye onthe dining room.    The food is incredibly fresh and tasty.  The service is good - you order at the counter and it's brought out to you when ready.  I'd love to see table service - at least for ordering additional drinks.    My only hesitation about Siggy's is the price.  My husband and I dropped in for brunch - we had a salad with protein, a fritatta and 2 mimosas -- total -- and spent about $60.  That was the second time we visited, and the 2nd time there was a bit of sticker shock. I'm happy to pay for good food - but the pricing here feels a bit high.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie frittata
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Live Earth Salad with Herb Chicken Strips

8ZRb4eAmBGU8KqEfCbMQwQ.text: This is a tucked away GEM. Came here for lunch today with one of my best friends, who is also a plant based eater like myself and we both loved it! Parking is behind the restaurant or on the street and when you come in, seat yourself and go up to the register when ready to order! The atmosphere is very chill and the staff are so sweet! Now, the food. I ordered the veggie sandwich, added tofu and the cabbage and kale slaw and how flavorful it all was! The ciabatta bread was so fresh.  I also had a brownie for dessert and the turmeric chips they have with other chips and snacks that you can buy.  I tried the strawberry coconut passionflower Kefir soda and that was refreshingly delicious as well! I think I found a new lunch spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garden Veggie Sandwich and Cabbage &amp; Kale Raw Slaw

0i--ShKRzvz1Wl-3Y64AxQ.text: I had NO idea this place opened nor did I expect it for its location. The inside is a perfect warm and welcoming cafe. I have to say, I was a bit surprised how high the prices were for how the food was being described, but after I got my meal, I was overwhelmed both by the size of my sandwich, the flavors, and the obvious clean and fresh way of preparation, all justifying the cost. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. They made you feel like a regular, even if your first time, and you have the feeling you can't wait to go back and see them.  There is a patio, but being winter we didn't get to sit outside. Inside was plenty comfortable.   Parking is a major issue! Their lot is crazy tiny, but there is some street parking available.

TvFHtWchnDipfRySxLNkrw.text: Got to come and try a light snack here after a work happy hour. I got to try to Crostinis Plate with 3 of their options: Ricotta with Za'atar, Brie with Fig Paste and Almonds, and the Ricotta with Nova Lox and Capers. All three were really good but my favorite would probably have to be Brie with Fig Paste. It just had the best combination of flavor to me. I also had the Quinoa Grain which was pretty good as a nice light side as well. I would love to come back and try some of their other options as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Kabobs and Beets
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crostinis Plate with Quinoa Grain
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Organic Flank Steak Sandwich

eegckgJ9680sTkBruk_ECg.text: What a fun, spirited little lunch spot.  The neighborhood and vibe of the space caused me to feel hip immediately.  The decor is interesting.  I usually don't like restaurants that make me order at the counter, but this one was fine. The engaging lady at the counter insisted that we take the menus to our table to study them prior to coming back up to place our orders.  I selected the Mediterranean vegetable salad on greens with tofu.  Okay, it was like the best tofu ever.  The vegetables and the salad dressing were divine.   Check out my photo of it.  I also had a crostini topped with brie and fig and drizzled with olive oil.  It also was a wow!   Although the menu is not a mile long, they do a superb job with the items that they DO offer. My only complaint is that they don't have brewed iced tea.  Yes, I took it up with the owner, who apparently came here from the north, and I tried to impress upon her that she is operating a restaurant in the SOUTH, and down here, we need tea running thru our veins just to make everything work properly.  She understands that there are no shortcuts to brewing good iced tea and promised me that she would consider making it.  The lack of tea, is the only reason I didn't give them a 5 rating. They are doing good stuff here and you should go soak in the entire experience!  Let me know what you think.

Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

mkDg1X6yrPkDQeeMyYJCCg.text: Nice addition to the community! I ordered a turkey sandwich and by request they were able to serve it as a hot sandwich. The customer service is superb and I appreciated the friendly approach by all staff and customers. The setting is small but spacious enough! A nice place to stop by if in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

DTlbNGlpNPHzHtg6n2VWMQ.text: This place is a little hidden gem for a healthy option! Love the feel and decor very authentic! The options seemed perfect we had the Beef Kabob sandwich that is in same shape as a burger but much healthier tasting. We also had the chicken wrap the 1st one on the menu. All ingredients were fresh and delicious!!! BUT THE THING THAT STUCK OUT THE MOST, was the AMAZING BEET SALAD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Yum!!!!!!! Can't wait to go back!!!!!!!

UxhmgZCkc5DAmfPBJlHGDQ.text: The food was really good and hot. It was also not heavy at all so a plus for being healthy as well!  The price is good for the large portion size. I would come back again. The steak was nice and lean and juicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak wrap

YvQPcbX2GXWssMATpDweWw.text: Quite possibly the best sandwich in Charlotte. You will wait a bit for this sandwich and it'll run you about $10 but boy was it good. I did the chicken and steak sandwiches and I was blown away. Owner and Chef Siggy does a great job of incorporating Latin flavors into his food.   Vibe: Think Roots Cafe meets Max and Lola's bodega. You can take food and drink to go or eat there. They also sell coffee and smoothies. It's also nestled in a booming part of Plaza near Catawba and Sweet Lous BBQ. A must try local spot in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

YdarwQKyMwcJb1L8kTaeFQ.text: This review is based on one visit.   A fun place with lots of natural light and a slight spanish/reggie vibe.  I ordered the Mediterranean tofu sandwich.  It was very good and a nice portion.  The only sightly odd thing about it, hence four stars, is the tofu was brined in what seemed to be soy sauce.  Not something I associate with the Mediterranean.  I think  balsamic vinegar with olive oil and some basil would be more on target.  I do plan to go back there and try some other items.  It should be noted that there is road construction on Belmont road in the area and you might have to drive around that to get there. At least I did on 12- 12-18.

iOTBV-lbkZJfimtkCCCQQg.text: I have mixed feelings about this place that just had its grand opening today (9/4/18). We decided to check it out after coming back from being out of town and needing some good food after a long flight home.   Pros: - The space has been nicely updated and had an overall inviting atmosphere with nice music playing  - The sandwich we split (Grass-fed Steak on Ciabatta Hero) was very tasty and a good size   Cons: - The service was a little underwhelming, especially since it was a grand opening. We were clearly a little lost looking at the menu and had to solicit guidance. It would've been nice to have an explanation of who they are and why they're there. Ordering the "hoagie", we were told that wasn't an option, they had ciabatta (which was listed as "ciabatta hoagie") - There is very limited parking (I.e. 3 spots + 1 handicap spot). I love walking everywhere, but this is a bit of a haul from home (Elizabeth) and it is tough to have very little on-street and lot parking  - Tiniest water cups ever. They maybe hold 4 oz. Maybe. When you order a sandwich, having a full-size non-expensive bottle option would be nice.   They clearly had a following in NYC (4.5-star on Yelp) before moving here, but this is a different market, so you might need to educate us locals as to why you earned such high praise.   With a lot of good places already nearby (though not in Belmont) both new and established, will probably wait a while before giving Siggy's another go.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak sandwich on Ciabatta Hoagie

g1l06oZBkcogncBH4VXqZA.text: I've put myself on a Southern food detox temporarily, so we ended up coming to Siggy's in an effort to have a meal not too crazy in calories.   I had never heard of the place before, and it's located in an odd neighborhood with very limited parking.   But I actually was pleasantly surprised. They've got loads of kombucha choices from Lenny Boy in a cooler, their own handmade juices, and a small (though tasty) menu. I had the grilled cheese with apples and fig jam and thought it was delicious. It's counter-style ordering, but everyone was really pleasant.   All in all, it's got a great local vibe and was a nice place to go for chill healthier lunch options.

Km3c7xmdZg0z2PxNvYRkwg.text: This is going to be a great addition to our neighborhood.  All organic. Wonderful food. Also coffee, smoothies, wine and beer. I will be hanging out here often

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Excellent kabobs
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Siggy&#39;s Good Food

9dU62BLPzkXwEx4o0K_y6w.text: You can tell the people who work here love what they do. Siggy, the owner, has carefully selected the menu items and wine from high quality and local sources where available.   The menu is friendly to vegans, vegetarians, and meat eaters. The steak sandwich on ciabbata is delicious and overflowing with juicy meat. The crostini plate is another favorite.

REbXMReIy2CoU2AJore46w.text: For some who is on the Candida Lifestyle, (allergic to yeast; therefore doesn't  eat sugar, wheat, soy, dairy either) this restaurant is amazing!   Everything on the menu sounded phenomenal, but I chose brown rice pasta with garlic, herbs, and olive oil along with a side of roasted sweet potatoes (which melted in your mouth)!  So good.  So filling.  People who were in my party eat anything (no allergies) and they said their meals were delicious, too.   Definitely a place to return too.  Very unassuming!  From the street front it doesn't seem like anything to talk about, but step in and it's a great little nook!   Love love love!

_hnA_quxiAC6upMAh3JkDw.text: bought a living social deal here cuz i'm on this new healthy thing.. haha. but i got a steak sandwich and it was really good though i dont really know how healthy it is. huge portions, fresh ingredients, and great prices (Except for the smoothies which were $6 each but theyre super good). service was great too

QfIkmuLl4VBD1iX6AndKhA.text: If I can, I pretty much eat at Siggys at least once a week. I was eating the quinoa avocado salad with salmon burger for quite a while and I recently changed to the live earth salad. But I love their beef stew for dinner or their salmon special is always what I'm craving! The sweet potato fries ain't to shabby either. I just wish they were open on Sundays! But people need their rest I know. My friend had the eggplant lasagna which had the perfect amount of sauce for anyone who is obsessed with tomato sauce. He certainly ate the whole thing. The pricing is pretty right on and I always leave feeling good and healthy. Huge fan.

tMz11ElOeDbxOJ-59L0PkA.text: Terrific food and service. I had heard good things about Siggy's Brooklyn and decided to try the new Manhatten location. Just off Houston on Elizabeth street. Nice location with a very pleasant decor. The food was great and good size portions.  My partner had the salmon burger and I had the steak sandwich. Both were excellent.  Lots of vegetarian items on the menu, but lots of options for all preferences.  Smoothies were delicious. Try one  Service was promt and waiter was very helpful in explaining some of the special dishes. All in all, very good food at a reasonable price, in a nice relaxed atmosphere.

_AglpV9HG4fpgmliqUnJvw.text: DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY.  After being told the food would take 20-30 minutes, over one hour later we are STILL waiting.  When I called, they had no answers nor any way of checking on the delivery guy.  rather than being apologetic, they seemed annoyed I was calling.  Horrible customer service.  Will let you know if I ever get my food but doubt it.  Don't order delivery unless you are prepared to wait an hour.

m-Hu1_sgmOex6P9ZfOCkQQ.text: Siggys is phenomenal ! They have a wide variety of delicious vegetarian options on the menu. My favorite is the quinoa salad and quinoa pancakes. The garden veggie sandwich is pretty amazing. I die over the Swiss chard! And veggie balls! ( I wish they had more soup options) service is great and friendly.  If you are a vegetarian you will go crazy over this spot!

jcP3wmqgC43l4oPcITCQLA.text: Fabulous menu -- rare combination of great options for vegans and carnivores.  Food is fresh and delicious.  Also, staff and atmosphere are top shelf.

x1z5REmho3O0gG9B4Bl8kQ.text: delicious - great staff - chill laid back vibe

2UIdfLZ1Kmv66vS86gXIlA.text: Very rude and inhospitable hosts. I arrived a few minutes early. There were empty tables and nobody else was waiting, so I asked to sit at a table and have a drink while I waited for my friend who was a few minutes away. They refused. There were no seats at the bar, so the only option was to stand. "You are welcome to have a drink," I was told, but you can't sit at the (empty) table. I said I'd order a $100 bottle of wine, but was told that this was "a matter of principle." So on principle they would have a customer stand awkwardly at the entrance with his drink, rather than let him sit at the empty table where he'd soon have dinner. I had been there several times before. The food is good but mass produced and certainly not worth standing for, next to an empty table, I left without ordering a drink or dinner. A few minutes later, my friend and I were enjoying a drink and dinner a few blocks away. This is not exactly a good strategy for making people feel welcome in a restaurant or developing a loyal following.

NC3_u9i82orCXiMc--wqJA.text: Was very pleased to have a low key healthy dinning option in the area. The quality is top notch and the service rocks! Can't wait to go back!

yHtLwEG9tBSkCg0mMcKTag.text: I've been there several times and they always have amazing food!  As a longtime vegan, I don't often love non-vegetarian restaurants, but this place gets my vote.  The vegiburger is exceptional (no soy nor gluten and a delicious, unique taste).  GF/brown rice pasta bowl was outstanding, too.  Juice bar is very good.  Great service - the staff are really friendly even if you're getting takeout or not spending a lot of money there.  The "alien" theme to the decor is cheesy but fun. But the main reason they get 5 stars is that nearly everything is organic!  It's pathetic how many vegetarian or "healthy" restaurants don't offer any organic food.  My only complaint is that many of the shakes come with soy protein...let's hope they upgrade to Sun Warrior or Vega One.   If you're a meat-lover and not sure where to take a vegetarian or vegan friend for lunch, or a vegan who wants to take a meat-eating friend to dinner, Siggy's could be a good option.

wvpIZFdbUTGVc46UnDcSYw.text: Great vegan option in Nolita.  My son and I stopped here after a long afternoon of shopping and revived ourselves with very fresh soups - lentil/garlic, and chicken vegetable.  The smoothies were also delicious.

kRMhrLCtO5UmXvLIrb1Qcg.text: Simply the best.  They use only super fresh and amazing ingredients.  Their salads are incredible.  The salmon burger is a unique item that is absolutely incredible.  This is our go to spot for delivery or eating out.  It also boasts the best breakfast burrito in town for weekend brunch.

cfqJHmQP7k6dWnDSG2_aGA.text: Loved it. I was scared to try the lasagne as I have had some bad vegan lasagne experiences, but this one was delicious! The salmon burger is also amazing. The food is great and healthy and affordable, but the atmosphere was pretty loud. I'm hoping that may have just been a one off experience based on the day we went- maybe the customers that day were particularly noisy. Overall I love this place and will return frequently.

tfouALn97aJJFE3ICeUnSg.text: Awesome and yummy as usual!  Too bad the Brooklyn location closed!

qSzYErTrdMwniCDYU-EKkg.text: Flavorful, healthy food at reasonable prices -- what's not to like? The steak sandwich was delicious, with a roasty rosemary flavor and a really creamy vegan pesto mayo (which I liked more than I expected to). Others liked the turkey sandwich and a basic salad. Make sure to ask for bread -- it's a nutty loaf with good olive oil. Super friendly service, too.

S1SwI75iaKwNELOKP_Hucw.text: Found Siggy's last year by searching for vegan restaurants in the city. Since then I've been a regular customer and stop by one or two times a week for their great smoothies. The Berry Antioxidant Elixier is pure deliciousness and I like how they prepare everything super fresh and fast right in front of you. The staff in both locations, Brooklyn and their bigger Manhattan location, is very friendly and laid back. Can not complain whatsoever and always recommend my friends, who visit the city, to put Siggy's on their to-do-list!

n3teHxiGFjRiv08GH88J9Q.text: the burgers here taste like a big meatball smashed into a burger patty. its so good. unbelieveable.

4hUhSG4VAo2NEHUW6hbzPQ.text: I was on my way to a museum when I stumbled upon Siggy's.  I was a bit worried about the restaurant from the outside, but when I had my first bite of food, I fell in love with Siggy's.  I had the mac'n'cheese and a berry smoothie.  Both were fantastic and very healthy.  The vibe inside is very laid back and the whole restaurant was very casual.  The service was impeccable and even though there was a little bit of a wait for the food, it was worth it.   I loved Siggy's and I plan on going back the next time I am in New York.

6nL1B_OqYSaapeeqvCllOg.text: Fresh, delicious and filling describes our dinning experience wile on vacation in NY. If you are looking for great tasting, healthy meals at a good price you can't go wrong here. I wish we had something like this restaurant back home. The staff is helpful and attentive to your needs. A great experience all the way around!

AQrlWQujyt-o0sIbFYLNDg.text: I really REALLY like Siggy's. I order one of 3 things everytime I order from them.  The Greek or Beet salads and their Greek omelets. Why not 5 stars? For some odd reason they will only serve omelets at Brunch and some other special days. I guess people don't eat eggs in the afternoon or night? It's sad as I would rather order from them but I end up ordering for another place during the week as Siggy's won't make their amazing omelets during the week. Please put it on your weekday menu.

8w9v_ddNfRyu1_NS3CJCLg.text: A friend, April, highly recommended this place and we tried it.  We were not disappointed.  Had the Kale salad with shredded cabbage and carrots in vinegar and oil dressing with sesame seeds...outstanding.  Then the wild Salmon entree with black rice and artichoke. Wow, it was also great.  Great service and friendly staff.  Can't wait to go back and try something else when we are back in town.

647dxyxXbPxqUuj4ZXjuUw.text: I've been to Siggy's twice already and let's just say that they do not disappoint! The food is just soooo good! The service is prompt and they're always pretty attentive. Drinks wise, I got the Sweet something juice both times. For apps, we got the hummus dip the first time and the quinoa patties or something of that nature a second time. I got the chicken sandwich and then I got the chicken cutlet platter the second time around. Definitely a must if you're in the area or just always eat organic. Their food is just great, very filling and I always leave happy!

pKMajBKiMXZgYp0pdNaUFg.text: Thanks fellow Yelpers for helping me find this gem of a place.  I literally walked all the way from 42nd St. to Siggy's on a Saturday afternoon to work up an appetite.  I was not disappointed, as the eggplant lasagna was just deliciously perfect and filling.  I will definitely come back and try out the other items in the menu.

tN2KkahRKmTXrrRRXXzNug.text: absolutely love their menu selection and the staff is fantastic.....DELISH!

UMrO7j1LG3wOtQ5V4NUCPg.text: After searching an hour for the perfect restaurant we found Siggys - terrific healthy organic foods, organic beer, organic smoothies (the beer was a chaser). Highly recommend.  Ask for Michelle for your server. Aliens eat free!!

LG4RipKvw46M0jeGNEMnwg.text: Big love for this place. Yummy and expansive menu... With so much to choose from, there is truly something for everyone, meat eaters and vegetarians alike... Organic and gluten free options; juices, and smoothies all offered here. Additionally (and quite importantly) the servers are friendly, the atmosphere is pleasant, and the restrooms are clean. My only complaint is the sign out front... I yelped to find this place, but when I walked up and saw the sign, I almost decided not to go in... It didn't really fit the nature of the restaurant, I don't think. I'm super glad I went in anyway! Sorry, guys! Just one person's opinion...

13dx5QiV_pAJGlbO_IsCEQ.text: I can get past this place being overpriced because its local and the staff is super friendly. On the rare occasion that I do take-out, I cannot stand by the juice bar and endure the manager? being overly aggressive and loudly scolding the workers. Not only should she have some tact in front of the customers, more importantly, she should have a less hostile approach when speaking to her staff.  If this woman is the manager, she needs to be fired, if she's an owner, I don't want to spend another dollar here.

0Tnmfv93SYWG9s9hqIaymg.text: Had the Thyme Sage Roasted Chicken Breast w/ beets -- supa good.

gTL0alDKfGg4f6cr8WcZ0g.text: First off, I have to give props to the awesome waiters and hostesses - the service here is truly top-notch.  It's also a really cute place to grab dinner on a date.   My main gripe was with the food - my boyfriend and I just got the organic burgers, and I know that's probably not what they specialize in.  However, it was the oddest spiced burger I've ever had.   It definitely tasted of curry and cumin and various other Indian spices.   The heavy spice was so off-putting, we could barely get through half of the burger.  Don't get me wrong, I love spicy food - I guess I just didn't like this weird tangy spicy combination in the burger. It was just completely unexpected.   However, the people next to me ordered some sort of pasta dish, and it looked absolutely fantastic.  We probably just ordered the wrong thing.

H0dONjOy9BKru2OL8_dt8w.text: The food and atmosphere were great! I had the salmon burger over greens and it was delicious, the salmon was so fresh! My friend and I split the potatoes with herb as a side and they were amazing. I would absolutely recommend coming here for good food for a good price!

etiE0cxICNrMN3cVFkt-VQ.text: I've been looking for a quality vegeterian/healthy food place in my area for a while now. This one is probably the best of the bunch.  We got there at about 8 PM on a Wednesday night and had to wait about 10 minutes for a table for 4. The front got really crowded, this is a popular spot for the after-gym crowd to swing by for a fruit shake.  I skipped on appetizers, but tried a fruit juice (orange,apple,beet and banana). It was very sweet and tasty, everyone with me concurred!   I ordered the King Salmon dinner special (medium) which came with black rice and a salad. The Salmon was well marinated, although a bit on the smaller side. The sides were quite delectable.   Minus one star because our waiter, while nice did not check on us that often and we had to flag down the host to get our check for us.  I would return to try some of the other samplings, Grilled Chicken i'm looking at you!

VTbl8BBjQfp6ELc-FpPqYg.text: I liked this place even before I ate my turkey burger because:  1. Their menu items use organic, locally-sourced ingredients and are catered to omnivores, vegetarians, vegans, and even gluten-free folks.  2. Large paintings hang on the interior walls, but there is also an alien theme here--the tip jar is decorated with a green alien face and the chalkboard sign outside reads "Aliens Eat For Free." That's pretty funny.   There's a juice bar and take-out "counter" up front and plenty of tables and seats. For a 1:30pm lunch, there were a good number of empty seats.   The turkey burger was something else. I've had my share of flavorful turkey burgers, but they've often been flavorful because of a sauce; this turkey burger actually had herbs and seasonings packed into the thick patty. It came with a side of ketchup, but it was unnecessary. The soft brioche buns soaked up the juices of the patty well.  My friends also enjoyed their salmon burgers and flank steak sandwiches.  Likelihood of another visit: I'm definitely coming back here again. I've actually heard good things about the gluten-free stuff here! Their No Noodle Lasagna with tofu ricotta and their Beef Ragu Pasta Bowl with gluten-free brown rice penne both sound great.

L40EjYRua_fO3lIFCmINWQ.text: Really enjoyed our time here! Looking for Vegan spots in the neighborhood, and it didnt disappoint! Super happy they have fish and meat options so we were all happy! Great service, cute spot, a street away from the hustle bustle, excellent staff, and the food was delicious. Loved the almond-date smoothie.

dCCvblfpkmeCXy9Us7XJPA.text: So delicious- everything is fresh and you don't feel weighed down after eating a good meal. I had the salmon burger.. It is all the rave. I like that the party doesn't have other fillings- just fresh salmon. It's light, fresh and juicy.  Sweet potato black bean cakes to start- tasted pretty unique. I'd order again.  Gluten free cookie: yes, it's $5. Potentially worth it if you like buttery chocolate chip cookies.   I like that they have meat, veggies, and can accommodate gluten free, etc. Nobody leaves unhappy.  Also the employees are incredibly friendly.

CmY7MPJdIyIO6WqZJNxgCQ.text: I was immediately blown away by the kindness and smiles of the people who work here. First impressions mean a lot!  The menu is extensive and offers lots of great-sounding dishes with a southern theme.   Hands down, I had the best veggie lasagna with homemade sauce at Siggy's. Absolutely delicious. I wouldn't change a thing about it - except maybe the price ($14). But I'd definitely eat it again!  Beer menu is also good, something for every taste.  I'd love to come back!

UOZWr11X6gaccAHelw7_eg.text: When I called around 7pm on a Saturday night, I was told they were empty, but unfortunately, by the time we got there around 8pm, we had to wait a few minutes. We ended up pulling up an extra chair to a two-person table, but the fit was fine. The servers were all very friendly and welcoming.  We opted for the steak sandwich, salmon burger, and beef burger. I didn't taste the beef burger, but I thought the steak sandwich was delicious. The meat was flavorful, tender, and juicy. Unfortunately, I wasn't a big fan of the salmon burger. It tasted more of chickpeas than salmon, but the texture was pleasantly compact, rather than flaky and crumbly. All the plates had a lot of arugula in and around the sandwiches, but they were a nice compliment to the burgers. For the price, location, and service, I would come back.  FOOD: 4/5 ENVIRONMENT: 3.5/5 SERVICE: 4.5/5 VALUE: 4/5 OVERALL: 4/5

1RiEdKYj_gaVh6WsaqBFbw.text: I picked this restaurant because I needed gluten free/healthy options for a friend. We were a group of 4.   First off the service is very accommodating. When I got there we were still waiting for 2 more people to arrive so they told us we can sit at the bar, and served us water. When 3 arrived they offered us a table until our last friend came. 2 of us ordered the black bean burger (with side of potatoes), one ordered quinoa burger and the other a pasta-less, vegan lasagna. Everyone agreed that the meals were hearty, healthy and yummy. The quinoa burger did break apart easily but it's the taste that matters no?  After finishing our meal we stayed talking for at least 45 more minutes and never felt pressured to leave, instead they brought out a new glass water bottle for us to drink! I really appreciate that they didn't keep harassing us to order more.   Note: There were other tables open during our stay.   Overall I would return and recommend it to others.

vdOzvFkr-H8EuqNWM-4MBA.text: Service very friendly and accommodating.  Food was Ok but kind of boring. The burger (beef) was well cooked, fresh etc but a bit tasteless. The beet salad likewise.   I would go back, but maybe try the soup or something simple.

WTF4ruc6DQjOLp9AVn43sw.text: Totally forgot I've been here years ago and returned for a quick dinner. Good food. Nice service.

CrEaczV8q2IvRyZoZB_Pyg.text: First, the gluten free, dairy free cookies. These are by FAR the best GF, DF cookies out there. They are just as good as regular cookies.   The food here is really good, too. Especially if you are GF. They have buns, etc. So, you can get a burger. The salads are also really good.   So, for a healthy meal, it is great.

qo2rFBi_cCWJASBscAUOZg.text: The ambiance and decor are perfect! Cool night by the opened window was simply amazing. The food was ok. It wasn't bad, but I wasn't blown away. I had the skirt steak sandwich, my husband a meat sauce pasta dish. Staff was very friendly!

iGV2brlmPm5p5owqI8QKOQ.text: Great food! A little slow on the service but totally worth it when the fresh food arrives.   We got a salmon burger with a mac and cheese side, and the chicken Milanese special and both were excellent!

rI244HGQcKCSdwUcMWHJAw.text: Great place to meet up with friends for a casual meal! Very friendly staff and healthy options that taste good. Had the vegan lasagna with ricotta tofu and it was perfect.

LXMXi0VMfmYxEJDfVIQTqQ.text: Best wild salmon in NYC. The service is great. SIggy is always out greeting customers. The staff is wonderful. I would highly recommend

I5MfFevVRhlbM6aMlMoL9Q.text: Siggy's is a cute spot in NoHo with tons of vegetarian and vegan options, but also many meaty things for the carnivores.  The menu is simple, mostly lunch-oriented stuff and they also offer smoothies and baked goods to go.   My hubby and I are vegan and brought a couple of meat-eater friends along for lunch this weekend and everyone was generally satisfied, but not necessarily blown away. Why, you ask?  Well, the service was okay, but a bit anemic. Everyone seemed to be waiting to wrap up their day and go home; no one was rude or anything drastic, but the servers seemed kind of...bored. Not a big deal though, especially if you go places for the food, like we do.  While I enjoyed my black bean burger, I was a bit confused by the strange lack of a vegan bun. This place has tons of vegan options, attracts many vegan folk and boasts awesome burgers--doesn't it only make sense to stock a vegan buns? I guess not! Even the gluten free option wasn't vegan. I ended up getting my burger on multigrain toast, which tasted great but fell apart very easily since toast is not meant to uphold a huge burger patty.  Everyone else was pretty satisfied with what they got and this is a nice, fast convenient place to grab a bite, but a few small details take away that extra star.

lUUNs1SL3qmO_Ur9zZoi9A.text: I am officially adding Siggy's to my list of fave food joints.  It's a nice, clean open space and when I entered I was hit with the smell of fresh juicing.  The staff was very kind. While I waited for my food, the juicer, Ahtmose, made me a couple samples of fresh squeezed orange juice and ginger lemonade (which I ended up ordering).  I ordered a cup of Lentil Garlic soup, which was also delicious. It went great with the fresh bread they serve.  I also tried their Quinoa Spinach Cakes topped with cilantro salsa which are bursting with flavor. Very creative dish.   I wish I were an alien because apparently they eat free at Siggy's.   Can't wait to revisit.
