wtDrj9HYnsDUp66fREbFwQ.text: I love this place! get the buckwheat pancakes. Yum

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great buckwheat pancakes with berries and bananas. Yum!

szns6I3dCaR0e5dwJqFRfQ.text: Siggy's isn't a restaurant I'd normally stumble upon on my own, but when a friend recommended we drop in on a weeknight I was happy to check it out. Its casual setting and quirky decor make it a comfortable place for catching up, although you may find yourself backing into the person behind you if you're seated along the wall. Service is very friendly, and nobody will hover or rush you out after you set down your fork.  I ordered from the daily specials menu and chose the wild king salmon crusted with artichokes and olives. It was cooked medium (I wouldn't recommend cooking any longer) and both moist and flavorful, and it came with a generous side of black rice. The kohlrabi tomato salad on the plate was a nice touch but a bit too vinegary.  Overall a pretty good dinner and the perfect option if you're eating with vegan friends.

jNoF19G-PnjPHxQ58F-bbg.text: Happened upon this Cafe right between Soho and Noho...what a find! We had seven people in our party, and a mix of vegans, vegetarians and meat eaters. Very accommodating with our larger party and great options on the menu for everyone. Atmosphere and music was superb, as was the service. Mac and cheese was delish. Can't wait to go back!

M2cn8vU0-0dnXqbiCLHOnQ.text: This salmon burger is the real deal! So tasty and perfectly seasoned!  I don't come here enough, honestly. The juices are great and I always add apple or something else to them. So yummy and healthy!

SCeZ8-68nLxOUpVnutStjQ.text: If you want great ingredients and nutritious food, Siggys is your place. Their beef burger is delicious as well as the turkey sandwich and grilled artichokes. There aren't too many places where healthy can also be delicious. They are always friendly. The prices are reasonable. They have gluten free options for bread options. I've never tried their juices or smoothies but they look good from afar and are reasonably priced. Give it a go if you have a workout later on in the day or just don't want to clog your system with all the unhealthy delicious options in the neighborhood.

6g2SSiSPmofV9Rou20hhpQ.text: Love the food, service is a bit slow. Hence the 3 stars. Be prepared to wait for awhile. I go there often and something usually goes wrong...LOL but i love the quality of the food and it's the only place I've had gluten free pasta and it is delicious!

LHJrCxyL9GkiPSEJtCCJ7Q.text: A couple of friends brought me here knowing I'm a picky eater. Apparently they know me pretty well. I was impressed with Siggy's menu. They offer, juices, smoothies, salads, and a variety of burgers! The staff was very friendly and patient (sometimes i have a difficult time deciding what I want to eat). Everything we ordered was fresh and delicious! I'll be coming back.

xSoiE97Y248qwyMiz5lmMw.text: If I was giving Siggy's a review just based on the food, it would have been 5 stars.  The service on the other hand was horrific and it ruined the meal.  To make a long story short, they messed up my friends burger twice and when it was finally brought out the third time, everyone else was already done with their meals.  We had to be somewhere else at a certain time, so my friend had to eat quickly and didn't even to get enjoy his burger or finish his meal.  After all of this, we thought Siggy's would have at least not put the burger on the bill or at the very least comped our drinks, but nope, nada.  To make matters worse, we had to be somewhere else by a certain time and we would have been fine on time had they gotten the order right but the multiple screwups made us late which ended up costing us an extra $30.

QM6NNS7sVbRuia9dZAnskg.text: Great service in a cozy atmosphere. We all enjoyed our meals. Everything was fresh!

hMa5ho3Vr-PQN0XDTqXSdg.text: LOVE this place. Great tasting, healthy, and everyone always has a smile on their face. My favorite spot in the neighborhood!

6GizmT63Dy02zSbuUAXLFw.text: Yummy! Just got off a week long bender on terrible greasy food and this place was delicious and healthy!

73qWAgDULjDN-aCUYwfVwg.text: Siggy's better than good food:) Perfect for the mismatched eating companions. Me - vegetarian and he- eats anything that moves. Or used to move. Both left feeling full and satisfied. Good selection for both of us. Started with a green juice and a fruit juice.  Berry one was yummy. Green one would have benefited from a few minutes in the fridge but were both a good value. Quinoa and spinach cakes were lovely with a nice cilantro kick. I will be coming back for sure.

RCkYmtDoeUJrCmfdbuZa9g.text: Every time I eat Siggy's it has been delicious and the veggies taste so fresh. Love the quinoa and spinach cakes, and the salads!

Ws8qe4zKDh8iAg0fR-BfnA.text: The food was moderately priced, but unremarkable in taste. Although the place was empty, my friend and I waited about 10 minutes to place our order (and that was after   we called in one of the waiters and told him we were ready to order). After our meal, my friend and I left a 12% tip to which a different waiter very rudely replied: "I hope everything was OK?" Siggy's Good Food might be vegetarian/vegan/gluten-free friendly, but with so many health food stores and restaurants in New York City, this is certainly not a place to visit again, especially since they seem to expect a 20% tip for  standard food and mediocre service.

HpnfunSJBCQ_h-HrwhWDjg.text: Really cozy & friendly place! Me and my friend both went with the eggplant lasagna. It's definitely filling and you'll even want to eat all the sauce around the plate. I only ate half of mine and took the rest to-go in a box to eat for tomorrow's dinner too. My friend ate all of hers so you could go either way really in terms of filling! Had a really nice fireplace for the winter. I would come back for sure!

JA4eBcjubZud_nIKr94mkQ.text: Shopping Saturday before Xmas, 4:20 pm and they won't seat us because the kitchen is closed.

ShqOreVQDMMD-5h4cWgc2Q.text: I haven't been here enough to really get to know the place but the food is really wonderful. I no longer eat meat but when I did it was great to find place that used organic meat. The vegetarian is very good and the Juice bar is amazing. What really tops it off for me is (who I believe to be) the owner. She is incredibly friendly, engaging, and hands on. She knows what you need before you need it! It's a really fun and quirky place. I love the alien motif!

n4jdMWO8ZkFynNLv0OY3Tw.text: Excellent food and good service. Everything was fresh. I had the farmers omelet and the carrot-coconut soup and my friend had a vegan lasagna and the soup as well. We will definitely go back!

bJhtKEzLYMs-jz5vkPxT7w.text: Folks, watch out. The "wild salmon" dishes are not really made from wild salmon. This restaurant appears to be one of many that unethically passes off farmed Atlantic salmon as "wild".   Walking in here with wild salmon on our minds, my wife and I decided to get the wild king salmon dinner, with a tomato sauce and a side of beans and black rice, rather than the wild salmon burger everyone raves out. We also ordered the raw slaw salad with kale and cabbage as a side. We asked our waiter (who reminded me of Jack Black) whether the salmon was wild Alaskan salmon or from elsewhere in the Pacific. He wasn't sure but promised to find out.   The food came and we ate it, but strangely enough, the salmon did not have the rich red color characteristic of a wild caught fish. Nor was it as rich and buttery as I had expected. It wasn't until after our meal that our server came back to us with "I don't know the location, but it's from the Atlantic."   Huge red flag! This was clearly not not wild caught salmon. Wild Atlantic salmon is virtually extinct to the point where it is illegal to catch it commercially, so all wild caught salmon comes from either the Pacific or Europe (highly unlikely given the price point). Maybe the restaurant was confused about the origins of a dish highlighted prominently on its menu? More likely this place was just passing off farmed Atlantic salmon as "wild" knowing the foodie craze for it. Unethical, misleading, and for $22, overpriced.  My quest for real wild caught salmon continues...

x70XUikIgN3ySKRvrUIBNw.text: The food was OK, maybe a bit bland.. I enjoyed the service and design of that place, I don't think I am coming back anytime soon though

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegan sandwich and garlic lentil soup - the lunch menu

4gT2tCxXIWptdUMZvB46cw.text: This was my first time eating at a vegan restaurant and the food was very delicious. The menu catered to everyone, even if u didn't want to eat vegan. I had a salmon burger on a wrap, my friend had a salmon burger on a bun and my other friend had a steak sandwich. The salmon was seasoned to perfection and the steak was juicy and chewable. The juices were great! I would recommend and I will go again to eat at this restaurant.

JkMg-8IAh3MvYma64q_NgA.text: For all its efforts on projecting a super crunchy (really, an alien theme?) theme, Siggy's Good Food not only has great food, but a really sweet decor and staff. The Eggplant Tofu lasagna was a planet sized non-pasta dish drowning in last-supper-worthy sauce. At first I didn't think I'd be able to finish my meal, but I happily obliged.

DXbQcx-1h-fFia9lLmvWtg.text: Siggy's is hands down my FAVORITE restaurant and one of the only restaurants I can eat out at. Having an autoimmune disease, many dietary restrictions, and tons of food allergies, it is extremely hard to find a place that can accommodate my needs. I never have to worry about hidden ingredients, preservatives, or GMO's when dining here. Their dishes, juices, smoothies (basically everything) is delicious. If I'm there for lunch, I usually order the salmon burger on top of greens instead of the bun (I'm gluten-free) or if I'm there for dinner, I'll order the salmon dinner with sweet potatoes and kale. I can't say enough good things about this place. The staff were very sweet and helpful and made sure they notified the manager and kitchen of my allergies and concerns. My boyfriend and friends who aren't as crazy as a health freak as me, also loved the place. Thank you Siggy's!

g9NYtbH_4wGf4sQkaxWK9w.text: If you are seeking a more health conscious spot, especially for lunch- this is your place. Grab a smoothie or juice to go or sit down and enjoy the cute little space and food. The quinoa avocado salad is my favorite, but the burger and turkey club is good, as well. Great for vegans and vegetarians. Siggy's is always busy, but never overly packed. Like I said, perfect lunch options! They offer a good special too for half soup/ salad and sandwich. Smoothies are amazing!! Love this place.

a9hEzGG5mYH_sus0r9xfLA.text: I have been wanting to come here for a while now and I am so glad that I did. The food was great. I had the salmon burger over greens and eggplant lasagna. I went with someone who is a big meat eater and doesn't feel satisfied unless meat is in the meal. Even he liked the lasagna and said that you couldn't even tell there was no meat and was vegan! Delicious and nutritious food is what I look for and this place is both.  The staff was friendly and it was a very comfortable atmosphere. I will definitely try to return in the future!

R5A5oltZemSCWyevAuCA7w.text: Two word review: Best. Salmon. Burger. Ever. Ok, so maybe I suck at math, but the place is a healthy heaven where no one is an alien, and if you are, your food is free. Good luck proving that though, haha. But seriously, if you're in the general area, stuff your face here, and you'll thank me for it.

U0eoJwGIvqsury5SVm7jyw.text: This place was not good. First of all, the prices are completely insane here. Second, the food is flavorless. I got the vegetarian lasagna and it tasted like I was eating mush. The other person got the black bean burger and it was equally mush with no flavor. We also got a lentil soup which did not have any flavors or spice. The sauces all say garlic but there was no garlic flavor on any of the meals. Stay away.

6CICISxh4ZYKeftDSbHW1w.text: Siggy's needs to rename itself from Siggy's Good Food to Siggy's Freaking AmaZING Food.  My diet requires strict Gluten Free dining and Siggy's provided that with their incredible fare.  My non-Gluten Free friends said their burgers were some of the best they've had in a long time and the salads and other options were just as wonderful.  I had the Herb Beef Stew, Gluten Free, and wow... I went back twice because it was so good!  Vegan options, fresh farm-to-table style food, and Gluten Free support... almost everything a sensitive foodie could want.  Unfortunately Siggy's hours of operation mean I can't often eat here but I always try and make it here once per trip to New York (from San Diego).  The fireplace in the back made for a great place to hide from the cold and snow during last year's Super Bowl week!

AEiOIIav78_zY5z3T2od2A.text: I love the vibe and wonderful and friendly staff at Siggy's. Everytime I come here I feel like I'ver left NYC, its just calmer, warmer, and homier than much of what you find in the city. The food is solid, satisfying, and there are a range of healthy options. Siggy's is a good place to go!

kKaOVPtxAq7w1b2ngBt3wg.text: The food, service, and atmosphere were great! The food came out right away and the servers were on top of it all. I ordered the Organic Flank Steak Sandwich, Grass Fed and it was amazing. The flavor of the meat with caramelized onions, mushrooms, and greens was delicious! The meat was cooked perfectly and tasted healthy (makes you feel good about what you are eating yet it is a juicy steak) and hearty. I was fully satisfied with my meal and would highly recommend it to anyone who loves meat!

8Q3mnYjkQkWQGpdLeyD33A.text: I love eating food that does a body good. This place offers a great selection of healthy food prepared with organic ingredients. I had the Chicken Almond Coconut Chicken Milanese and a Spa Skin Secret smoothie. Wow! how many people can say they had a spa skin treatment while dining?!  The chicken could've been more tender and juicy. I asked if they had some type of gravy that I could put over it because I like my food sitting in gravy baby. I actually ordered that dish in the first place because my super friendly waitress mentioned the great sauce that the dish came with served with brown rice and a veggie salad.    Okay, so now on to the Spa Skin Secret smoothie...this flavorful delight contains mango, pineapple, honey, yogurt, coconut milk and Vitamin C. Additionally, I added Echinacea to boost my immunity since we are entering the cold season. After dining, I just felt GOOD. No stomach bloating at all. After trying a Bikram Yoga class earlier that week it was great to treat my body and skin to something nourishing. I'm giving this place four stars because I believe that they have better tasting dishes on the menu that I look forward to trying next time. I will return to this place for sure.

s5ydFIlP1NDXkwy12GmEdg.text: Found this place on yelp and so happy it steered me in the right direction once again!   I was looking for a nice, chill spot to celebrate my sister's birthday that had to have good vegan options (she's a vegan). Found this place and called to see if the accept reservations (they do) and they were super friendly. They were incredibly accommodating when I asked if I could get some dessert brought out at the end of the meal- they brought together most of the staff out to sing happy birthday (really sweet! and the other diners were really cool too and joined in. Nice atmosphere).   The food was REALLY good (and Im not vegan). Had the Raw Almond shake (sweet enough and delicious), black bean sweet potato cakes were great as well, veggie burger was solid, and the lasagna was savory and perfectly balanced. Huge portions too (get what you pay for!) Vegan ice cream and brownie was delicious, too.   I HIGHLY recommend it!

a8xLF8lr_0OgOgDrsqRBLA.text: Delicious food - plenty of options for vegan/gluten free or lactose intolerant people like myself! Portions are hearty - I ate half the raw slaw salad and took the rest home! Loads of options to customise your meal. Great healthy food, lovely relaxed atmosphere!

dPYI8n0LtYghtWHK0GujXA.text: I really like this place. The food and the atmosphere is awesome.  They have a wood burning fireplace in the winter!  Perfect for groups that range from carnivore to gluten free vegan! Lots of healthy comfort food options as well as salad type stuff.  Service is friendly. Great option for the neighborhood that isn't super expensive.  The prices aren't cheap, but you definitely get a good portion for your buck.

CmVwlXurfLM4mu1jhVGJZA.text: So it turns out these guys have something other than their quinoa salad. I don't know why; once you've achieved perfection, why distract yourself?   While I savor my quinoa salad almost every Friday, my coworkers get other things from the menu which they love. But the quinoa salad really is something special.   And, though it's my favorite takeout, the dine-in experience is quite nice as well. It's one of those cool, relaxed, laid back places where you can have a mellow lunch and not feel like there's a minimum level of cool you need to achieve.   I love this place.

9ihvvKIG5yf-cLh1sO2Uag.text: It is with a heavy heart that I have to leave this review, and that I will never again return to Siggy's.   I have been a very frequent diner for 2 years, I love the food and I love the staff.  Last night, when asking to make a food substitution, I was told that the Owner, Siggy herself, was in the kitchen and would not allow it (a first in 2 years).  Willing to pay for the dietary substitution on the side, I simply wanted to speak with Siggy to understand if this was a new policy I should always expect in the future, or just when it was inordinately busy.   Siggy came out of the kitchen, guns blazing.  Without even allowing me to ask the question, she proceeded to yell, berate, and humiliate our table, claiming that we had no idea what running a restaurant out of a small kitchen was like and how inappropriate it was to expect special treatment at peak hours...   Very sad that I will no longer be able to support the staff, or recommend the restaurant... I just can't bring myself to give my money to a proprietor, so completely unprofessional, abusive, and unstable.

9o-5Uc8K764VubkmousFmw.text: The food is delicious and healthy, the environment is always warm and welcoming and the service is great. It truly is a gem of a restaurant

eyJ1bBbcgfO070U62weoCQ.text: Nice Soho spot which we chanced upon prior to seeing a comedy show on Bleeker Street.  Initially thought I had stumbled onto a vegetarian zone but menu has many options.  We had hummus - tasty but without a lot of kick, chicken soup - nice homemade and full of stuff, grilled artichokes - excellent and a chicken on the bone with a rich Morocco style recipe.   Service was excellent.  Food was fresh and generous.  Just a very pleasant meal.

TAQsuTCtColNQrOLg_28jA.text: If you want a healthy home cooked meal but are too lazy to do it yourself, Siggy's is the place for you. They have interesting twists on classics, such as vegan lasagna without the actual pasta, and salmon burgers. The quinoa spinach cakes were too crumbly for my liking, but the grilled artichokes were really tasty. My lasagna was smothered in tomato sauce and it was full of vegetable goodness. They have beer, wine, juices, and smoothies as well. The location is a few steps away from the Broadway-Lafayette stop, and a few blocks from the F-2nd Ave. There is plenty of seating inside, although you may have to wait a short while during the more busy times. My waiter was really nice and made good recommendations. Waters were constantly refilled, and he came to check up on our table pretty often.

J5y9jIdYlTKSpjkSO-Mwow.text: five stars for the ambiance, three stars for the price level. my eggplant lasagna was bomb, my husbands sandwich was average (they spare with meat and no side included), same for our friends burger. the salad  of my friend looked delicious too. nice experience and ambience and it was warm inside, exactly what we needed!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. eggplant lasagna was very delicious and a healthy portion (took half of it back home)
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

0mtvauHVi2up0jzcHLJUng.text: Not the best experience on the taste.  The service, good.  Place, charming.  Food, OKish.  More details and photos on my blog.

HxyWo94L-pVqo_AuruYKMQ.text: I was a bit skeptical at first based on the appearance of the restaurant.  Never judge a book by it's cover!  The food is delicious!  I did not try any of the drinks.    We started with Spinach/ Quinoa Cakes - Good starter, not oily - very healthy and the Tofu Fingers.  You can do without the Tofu Fingers (tofu grlled with soy sauce -- 4 skinny pieces).    For our entrees, my friends had the Salmon Burger and Steak Sandwich, both raved that it was good.  I ordered the Pasta and Artichokes with Kale.  I liked it a lot, but definitely can do away with less oil.  We also ordered sides of sauteed Kale and sauteed Broccoli.  I cleaned out both dishes!!!    Dessert - Apple Pie (OK - maybe will try the brownie next time instead) with a side of Coconut Ice Cream (Delicious!).

xeSW2AyonH93Gc9i7W8Azg.text: Had a sampling of their star dishes. The roasted cauliflower soup had an excellent Indian flair, wild salmon with celery root salad was a perfect compliment to each other, and the salmon was cooked perfectly. The GF pasta with beef ragu was flavorful and not too overpowering. Last, the GF brownie was fudgy and moist. Highly recommend!!!!

454xzZ1g_vNVB-u_GVz9pw.text: Lived in the area for quite some time and recently ran across this place, very glad I did.  I generally eat very healthy and there are not a ton of options in the area.  Everything I've ordered has been incredibly fresh and delicious.  The garden veggie sandwich is great and loved the parsley hummus used as spread.  Spinach/quinoa cakes were also very good.  Vegetarian burger, made with vegetables and black beans was awesome and so was the Acai smoothie.  I plan to order more off the menu as I add this one into my regular repertoire, but so far would say you can't go wrong.

cx8sR9_x26l6RnkRVoo8aA.text: Friend said "If I were a Yelper, I'd give it 4 stars." I agree. Love that everything is organic, and that they have gluten free and vegan options.   _ 3 BEAN & SQUASH SOUP +QUINOA                    ($4 cup/$6 bowl, +$1.50 to add quinoa/brown rice)  _ BROCCOLI SAUTEED w/garlic ($6)                           Needs more garlic.  _ BLACK BEAN & SWEET POTATO CAKE ($8)                    Topped with salsa which is fresh and delicious                    but overpowered the cake flavor.                    Next time, I'd ask them to put the salsa on the side.   _ WALNUT BROWNIE a la mode:                       Vegan & Gluten free.                       Topped with a scoop of vegan vanilla coconut milk ice cream                        (choice of vanilla or chocolate ice cream) and chocolate sauce on top.   Interior: Cool paintings, gr8 mix of music (funk, r&b, salsa), gr8 service, friendly staff. We were greeted, served and seen off warmly.  Affordable organic food w/gf + vegan options!   Will gladly return!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Simply Greens salad ($6)
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Organic Sage Chicken sandwich (on a gluten-free bun) with a side of salad.

ghPCpdZwHGhuXPB_eBBcYw.text: I met a friend for lunch at Siggy's.They allowed me to get seated, even though my friend was running a little late. I ordered the coconut water. DELISH! We both ordered egg dished and everything came out tasty and fresh. Would definitely come here again.

zzSEqYZuJu-nRmsgPX3_XQ.text: Surprisingly good food. I am no health food eating kind of person. I usually prefer extra grease, some preservatives, and a of side of sugar. I came in here with a group of co-workers so I had to fight through the hipster ridden building and strange words on the menu. I mean event he decor was slightly out of the ordinary, some depicting NYC being gardened by aliens. Needless to say I did fight my every instinct to run fro here and I ordered what turned out to be perhaps the best sandwich I have ever eaten. I ordered some sort of steak sandwich with all sorts of greens as a topping. The sandwich was full of good flavor. So yes SIggy's does have good food; even if you are not a health nut. Give it a try you may be surprised. Everyone in my party enjoyed their dishes very much. This is SOHO so seating my be full at times.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

yUW8vncuD2Iv70EiizP5hw.text: I will always have a place in my heart for Siggy's! Since moving out of the area, I still try and make it back there for the meatless lasagne, the amazing salmon burger, the quinoa cakes.   Casual vibe - I've been there on a quiet date night, as well as post-workout in my sweaty gym gear. What's not to love about that?!

sCxsh-m193asmyPGoYDTlw.text: Love love love Siggy's! You have to get their breakfast burrito. I'm a very health-conscious person and let me just tell you how great the burrito tastes and sits in your stomach! I couldn't finish the entire burrito in one sitting, but took the other half to go and enjoyed it at home. I'm excited to go back and try more dishes on their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

WnvopMOigqSaWqQ9asRyow.text: Enormous and filling delicious salads smoothies and amazing salmon burger. I hope they open a new location since they closed Brooklyn's. Also, spotted Jamie Lannister enjoying a dish-- hand had regrown.

PKI0pbbByNJiGciiV-2r1w.text: Cute place! Great for a date or chill night out with friends.   I came here with my GF because we are on a mission to try a new restaurant every week that won't break the bank.   I had the NO NOODLES Lasagna and it was soo good. I'm glad they serve it with all the sauce because I definitely ate it all up.   TIP: We sat at the bar - which I would NOT recommend because the seats are super uncomfortable. If you are dining, get a table. However, we got to see all the dishes as they came out and the salmon and wild rice dish looked amazing.   I'm definitely coming back to try their other dishes and will update this review.  Healthy and delicious meals. Prices were reasonable too.

UJRRY7O5Zp06u3Wh-niS5w.text: Love the many options in the menu and the effort to be organic.  Calm ambiance and friendly staff.  Interesting options in the daily offer, like fresh salmon and soup of the day.  Happy to have them in the hood.

XPCk_C-w5Yw8xPUoAbhiKQ.text: Great fresh juices and a wholesome organic meal - we loved the Salmon burger as well as the eggplant Lasagna

XLY445zCqQXlAwoUorHq2w.text: Yeehaw, this place hits all the high notes, friendly service, nice cozy ambiance, great selection of vegan, veggie & meat/fish dishes. We had the green juice while waiting and then settled into a table by the fireplace. The lasagna lives up to the hype & whoa i loved my splendid kale with quinoa and avocado added. So filling and I have leftovers for two meals. Cool tunes & chill vibe too. Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Splendid kale with quinoa and avo added. Sooo good.
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mega juice

EJm6sBfJmpWDSpjNpNKcFQ.text: The salmon burger is amazing!! Lovely space good lighting great music absolutely recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Awesome lighting

gc0s9T6RtYJNy-lXmxsLtA.text: Quite disappointing. I came two times, one to the other place in Brooklyn which closed. Both times the food was kind of tasteless. I don't know if I made bad choices or simply the food was not that good.  Usual dishes with usual tastes. Nothing fancy nothing out of the box. They have vegan and vegetarian options but it feels to me when restaurants think vegan/vegetarian they run out of ideas and creativity and many times even they forget about seasoning.  Anyway I don't think this would be an option to eat in a regular setting. Good for a lunch break in the area but not to go specially to have a meal here.

Ir9aVQM2TRGMheuQ48dYQg.text: Like so many people have reviewed, Siggy's is truly as good as it gets. I've come here with vegan friends and non-vegan coworkers, and Siggy's has options for everyone. I also value that their food is 100% organic and sustainable, which rationalizes a slightly higher price point. My favs are the No Noodles lasagna and the black bean burger wrap with added avocado, and the herb roasted potatoes. My coworkers like the flank steak sandwich. I have been concerned about their B health grade rating, which is why I give them 4 stars and not 5, but I've relaxed about it after reading the inspection results that the two violations were not critical.

2-wdocyiB1_t7f7KS_bOww.text: Siggys was just what I wanted, something healthy, fast and hearty. They have a lunch box special for $13 with 1/2 sandwich + soup/salad. The tuna sandwich was generously portioned. Much larger than i imagined and the lentil soup was a nice cup size. I would go back to this hidden gem.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch box: tuna sandwich and lentil soup with watermelon juice!

DDcQTDDBryGsJ6iRQxZCGw.text: Excellent food and service.  Health food lovers must go. Easy to miss in its location but you will be glad you found it.        Spinach Quinoa cake was excellent!      Salmon Special was great...  I'll put it to you this way I'm pretty much sure everything in this place is great.

1xCrjuMK8R-I8Sfpn3ihyg.text: Love this NYC gem!!  NOTE - THIS ISN'T ALL VEGAN!   I had a delicious beef stew here.    My girlfriend and I are on this new health kick and found this place via yelp stalking on the LIRR.    Random side note - Don't all vegan places/health markets smell exactly the same?  WHY IS THAT?  Is it all the kale?  The coconut milk?   Any who - this place was cute, not crazy crowded for a weekend, service was super friendly, prices were affordable & lastly the food was great.  My GF had the Salmon burger which was not fishy at all and very satisfying, and I had the beef stew which was a special that night.

ZbU25K6THzpUJZu2vI35OA.text: To know Siggy's is to know great food.  I usually take business meetings and lunches here because there's usually room and the food and service is always great!  Great set of food options to satisfy food sensitive types and the burgers and fries type too. Vegetarian selections pack a punch of seasonings and flavor, so everyone can eat happy here.  It always has a casual and friendly vibe with service leaning toward the more relaxed end of the spectrum.

5dYuV583nIf8bV-w7Q7RCQ.text: Lovely spot, excellent service and really delicious and nutritious food. I had the black bean burger wrap with the side of tofu fingers. The wrap was great, I would like to see a substantial side come with the dish however, not just a few leaves of greens. And the tofu fingers, however odd and bland that may sound,  were super tasty, subtle soy sauce flavor really nice texture, highly recommended. Maureen, my server, was attentive and really sweet. And I left with a bomb smoothie (mango, blueberry, banana, oj, coconut water, and almond butter), holy cow, though it's heft is a meal in itself. This is a super option for lunch, I expect to be back soon, and I look forward to checking it out for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

ciTIkcfQIdvayimKL2fniQ.text: After several hours of hardcore shopping and taking notice of the gradually increasing droplets of rain, we ducked into Siggy's for a quick lunch/midday refueling.  It's a rather cute cafe, ever-so-slightly "Siggy"-themed.  Siggy is an alien I believe, presumably one into health foods?   Our server was prompt, cheerful, and just plain delightful.  Feeling guilty about not consuming the food pyramid's recommended daily intake of veggies in the last couple of days (and more so feeling it with each lethargic step), I shared a Splendid raw slaw with sesame kale & cabbage with my friend and I ordered the Sambazone acai (to go, so I could slowly sip it, but the server forgot) for my drinkable fruit fix.  Now I love me some acai berries in that I more or less gulped then down daily during a couple of weeks of study abroad in Brazil.  The Sambazone acai smoothie didn't quite evoke pleasant memories of being a student, on the beach, without a care in the world, but it was pretty tootin' good and refreshing.  The salad daunted us with its ample volume, but it wasn't terribly filling, in spite of its intensely fibrous components.  The citrusy vinaigrette nicely pared with the dense bursts of sesame seeds and we polished off the plate, temporarily feeling better about our dietary choices at least with regards to this meal.   As you can probably gather, I rather enjoyed my Siggy's lunch.  Great spot for vegetarians and their omnivore friends - there's chicken and fish options.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sambazone acai
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Splendid raw slaw with sesame kale &amp; cabbage

6SgJH84o_gcjAefUCE-pog.text: I really loved this place! The salmon salad was so good and fresh--and inside was cozy and very comfortable. Caught up with an old friend there and didn't feel rushed at all and the courtyard area is so nice. Need to make it back again soon

c0dp8SgF-w12NpO2Q57WrQ.text: This place has a very great ambiance and very good, clean, non fat or greasy food. The salmon burger was spectacular! Must try! The Milanese chicken  and kale was tasty as well! You don't leave with a heavy feeling. You're body feels right after eating Siggy's Good Food.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon Wild Salmon Burger and Roasted Herb Potatoes
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Almond Coconut Organic Chicken Milanese

aUNW79bHquFLBLXoLhVpiw.text: Really really really good food. The place is great, people are super nice. Would recommend in a heartbeat   It's the only place where it feels like home and it's so cosy. I went there at least once a week it never disappoints.

nQv5V3vx1qrCUaC1HnmMjg.text: Was yelping for a new lunch spot close to chelsea/flatiron when Siggy's came up on my search result. Yeah, it was rainy and gross out but I hopped on the subway and committed to trying this place out -- the reviews and pics won me over! And the rest is history..  Went with the eggplant & tofu lasagna (vegan) and a side of roasted herb sweet potatoes. It was the PERFECT comfort food combo on that dreary NYC day. The non-noodle lasagna was sooo good with layers of eggplant, tofu ricotta, veggies... all smothered in garlic tomato sauce. YES. This paired with the roasted sweet potatoes (pretty big portion might I add!) was excellent. Wish I could have finished everything.   It was a lot for 1 person but everything tasted clean! Loved the service and the atmosphere overall. I'll be back Siggy's .. so happy to have found you!

l_ZDT-UE69ogeDw0Ue1seg.text: Very good place for vegetarians. Friendly staff. Good music. And they have a real wood fireplace inside! Awesome for a cold winter:)

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. They have real fireplace!

3QCDSpQ_mVb_MSOW_-xPwg.text: Yum. I'm a vegetarian but I usually go with someone who isn't and we all end up loving the menu! I love this place. Delish

6E321decRDWzuejjy6Yp8A.text: We decided to come here during lunch hours on a random weekday and found Siggys to be great! First of all we ordered the Coco peanut brain milkshake was tasty, but nothing out of the ordinary. For our meals, we ordered one lunch special with the half garden veggie sandwich and half slaw salad as well as the black bean burger wrap. The food was tasty and nutritious. I definitely would recommend the sandwich and salad.  The ambience was quite nice but it would be nice to have been able to sit outdoors in the back there area. The service was overall good. They also have this amazing hot sauce that you need to ask for. Adds so much delicious flavor to the food. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants a good quick, fairly cheap nutritious lunch! I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half salad half garden sandwich (lunch special)
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black bean wrap
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coco peanut brain

768GweP7EPnXyd2QmRaEXQ.text: Juices, smoothies, wheatgrass shots, delicious large salads, healthy dinners and desserts organic AND reasonably priced. The food is very delicious. I like that they have the option to add a burger patty (salmon or turkey) to the top of your salad if you want a more filling meal. I also really like that they have Wild Salmon, which I have a difficult time finding in NYC restaurants and its not overpriced. Why can't more places in NYC be like this?   They have options for Vegetarians, vegans and gluten free eaters. Great for a casual lunch or dinner, take out or to go in a grab a quick juice or smoothie. The only negative about Siggys (from a customers point of view) is its closed on Sundays.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roasted artichokes side dish
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Live Hearth Salad with avocados tomatoes cucumber carrot roastedpepper cloversprouts onions balsamic
Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wild salmon

epkAAAZh9DzDfWktyHD6oQ.text: Expensive, but I ate the whole thing! Pretty tasty salads and would come back! Plus I got to see Zosia Mamet so that added some excitement to the whole experience.

kTw5xah02fGhjlbQJ21kPw.text: Beautiful weather. Pizza. Long weekends. Friday. Ice cream. Finding $20 on the ground. Siggy's food. How are these all related? Because if you want to call Siggy's food "good", then you have to do that for everything else on the list. Is pizza just "good," or is it better than thay? You get the idea.   I made the trek to Siggy's GREAT food last winter, and didn't have the highest hopes. Good = average, right? But one bite of the world's best salmon burger changed my mind. I've never had something like that and don't expect to again any time soon. But what really made my Siggy's AWESOME Food experience was the flank steak sandwich. Was it one of the best sandwiches I've ever had? Yes. Was it good? No. Was it AMAZING? Yes.   Definitely worth a visit if you like good (see above) food.

8ti_l46a6YMi9r1wfkrMyw.text: Wonderful vegan food options!! Highly recommend: parsley hummus with gluten free bread-- super smooth and yummy hummus and the bread they use is the best gluten-free bread I've had. I also tried the veggie burger wrap-- all the flavors just mesh together beautifully.   This is a great place for vegans + non-vegans to dine together. They also have vegan lasagna, salads, soups. Lots of healthy food options.  I loved the service. Waiters/waitresses were attentive and friendly. Atmosphere was casual and chill. They have some vegan baked goods too (brownie, cookie?).  I would definitely come back for a nice light, healthy, casual meal when I am in the area.

C0a482j1iMKnB6-sgoq3Uw.text: I heard about Siggy's for a while now because it always pops up in my searches for Vegan restaurants. Siggy's is not a strictly vegan or vegetarian, it offers options for both carnivores & herbivores alike. The inside is super nice, nicer than what I expected, and I suggest to go sit in the back of the restaurant which has booths and overlooks a garden.   I was very impressed by the great variety of the menu and almost everything looked good. My friend and I decided to get the Spring Garden wrap packed with veggies "glued" together with hummus and avocado. It was good, nothing too special and priced right.   Our server was very kind and we were in and out very quickly. Honestly, Siggy's didn't really kick it out of the ballpark for me but if I'm in the neighborhood, I would definitely come back and give it a second chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie on whole wheat wrap

f8NJTwFuckgEHganQGU2Rg.text: Quirky, healthy, delicious, friendly. That sums up Siggy's Good Food. The menu has a bounty of vegetarian options but also wholesome meaty dishes. The main tie between them all is that they are high-quality ingredients.  The waitstaff was very warm and welcoming and brought an authenticity to the experience. Siggy herself even paid us a visit! What a friendly crew.  Next time I go back I hope to see aliens.

Sfn_RSRgE7GHoFKQJcxOQw.text: Missing this place. Everything was amazing, the food, the owner, the waitresses, the personal, the people...it was easy, light and delightful. Thank you

1eqSsjnTtRKmdeMXCRp-HA.text: Yum! Went here for the first time the other night after attending an event in the area and craving some good vegetarian food.   The interior atmosphere is really warm & welcoming and well-designed (I notice these things).   Our waitress was really attentive and sweet.   But really what blew me over was the food itself. My bf got a beef burger which he says was delicious, and I had the Moroccan chickpea & spinach bowl with tofu added. We also got the quinoa cake as an appetizer, and I had a cup of mint tea.   Everything was sooo well seasoned and flavorful. The quinoa cake was fantastic and one of the best appetizers I've had. It was very simple, but full of flavor.   I am excited to go back and try out more on their menu. Highly recommend!

MDFFpLW7hDffbIKoFy4ezA.text: My favorite here is the Wild King Salmon. It is SO good. They always have a variation of it served with a topping either of olives or sun dried tomatoes. It is personal trainer approved, but sublimely delicious and made with top level ingredients, so any foodie would approve.   And overall, Siggy's is special. It's a neighborhood gem. Not for tourists and an unusual place where it is clear that the establishment cares about it's customers -from the service they provide to the healthy, tasty food they serve. In addition to the Wild Salmon, I love the chicken dinner, the quinoa spinach cake and the parsley hummus appetizer.   And Siggy's has a casual atmosphere, a fireplace and staff who are amazing. They remember my name and face and are just cool, sweet people.   And I would literally recommend this spot to everyone from a model counting calories; a bodybuilder counting calories & wanting to eat meat; to vegans and everyone else.

l5EKr91UaJVpT5vlzxr_ig.text: Siggy's really named themselves appropriately because their food is pretty darn good taste-wise and health-wise! I came by here for lunch with a friend and we were seated quickly. It's a quaint spot with cool decor and fire escapes in the back that definitely remind you that you're in New York City.   Their options are generally local, grass-fed, or organic, which we appreciated. We ordered a salmon burger, flank steak sandwich, and berry buzz smoothie to share. They were also very kind as to help us split the smoothie into two separate glasses rather than just give us two straws for one cup. Everything was delicious! They pride their salmon burger for being free of fillers, and you could definitely notice how much better it tastes than other salmon patties, especially because it wasn't "dough-y." The flank steak sandwich was a bit difficult to eat because the ciabatta roll was loaded with meat and veggies, but the flavor was great. The breads used in the burger and sandwich were also chewy on the inside and crunchy on the outside. Each dish came with greens on the side, too. I also loved that the smoothie was tangy and sweet from only the natural fruit sugars. I do wish that it was a bigger portion overall for the $7.50 price tag.  It felt really great knowing that we were eating well without breaking our wallets and the best part was that everything was delicious too. One complaint I do have, though, is that we weren't offered bread and olive oil to start like all the other parties were. Since everyone else had it, I'm assuming it's complimentary so I don't know why we didn't get any. If you go, I would suggest mentioning it to your server if you aren't offered it. Other than the slight hiccup, I would recommend Siggy's, especially if you're an alien because aliens eat free here!

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon burger &amp; flank steak sandwich

zRsraK2n1NYXQ9C7Zc7KJA.text: Summary:   Siggy's is a terrific spot for comfort food with gourmet flare, smoothies and juices, and a menu that offers something for everyone but that'll make vegans and vegetarians especially happy.  If you've been to Siggy's original Brooklyn location, the menu here mostly overlaps with the one there, but the space here is maybe two or three times bigger and more stylish.  Though the original location is cozy and a swell space to eat in, the new Siggy's feels more refined, somehow more like a restaurant.  You could come here with friends or family, but it'd work for casual dates too.   All the produce used is organic and, maybe more importantly, all the meat is sourced well (e.g. the beef is pastured).  Infinite plus points.  Misc details:  * The macaroni n' cheese is excellent.  The whole wheat pasta has more body and feels more substantial than plain pasta, and the cream & cheese sauce turns your mouth into a gooey wonderland.  My friends and I split this four ways and had it as an appetizer.  * The soup--black-eyed peas, tomatoes, and celery--was equally great.  It's a daily special, but if you like hearty vegetable soups and this is available, you'll like this.  * Salmon burger w/ feta on brioche--solid.  They were two sizeable patties side by side, and they paired well with the feta, smeared onto the toasted bun.  I liked this but I hear the turkey burger here is phenomenal, and the beef burger is all pastured-beef (as is all the beef served here), and I was left wishing I'd maybe tried one of those.  * The raspberry tart!  As with the BK location, this is the best dessert.  It's crispy, tart, sweet, and leaves you impressed that it's vegan.  It's not huge, but big enough to split two ways easy, or even three or four ways, if you want more of an amuse-bouche-y dessert.  * Siggy's has a small selection of organic beers--the Pinkus wheat lager is sweeter than most beers, but if you're okay with that it's a very good hefeweizen.  * It's also the sort of place that has theme-appropriate political flyers up in the bathrooms.  Did you know that Monsanto is suing Vermont because Vermont passed a law mandating all G.M.O. foods be labeled as such?  I did not know this but I do now.  Now, you might not worry about genetics and crops, reasoning that it's silly to worry about any such thing when we're all doomed anyway, what with the seas rising and the advent of the AI overlords nearly upon us!  So you might just go to Siggy's to enjoy wholesome food before that happens.  And that's okay.  The politics don't get in the way of the eating.

0q5WoHSZHNxZKZWOKXrthg.text: I have enjoyed anything and everything I order here, but I love the vegetable "lasagna" so much that there's almost no reason to order differently. I appreciate the attentive service from friendly waiters, and it's so nice to have a healthy option that satisfies my environmental conscience.   This is my favorite late dinner spot to meet my boyfriend for a low key glass of wine and to catch up on the day.  Lots of attractive downtown gypset types to admire too ;-)

B6wSeJ1zmrMAOM4Gs3RSHg.text: In terms of aesthetics alone, this place makes for a most pleasant brunch outing.  And I enjoy their alien motif throughout.  But finicky eaters be forewarned, every dish here seems to have a "catch" and you're not gonna get get your typical comfort brunch fare.  And you definitely pay for the eccentricities of their menu.  I always have to scratch my head a bit about a $13+ cheeseburger that doesn't ever offer any kind of side.  But maybe I'm just not "getting" the essence of this place.  Ordered the chicken soup in order to avail myself of the most reasonably priced meal on the menu and was a little unsettled to find multiple whole chicken bones floating in it.  Maybe just a stomach churning touch for Halloween diners?  Whatever the rationale, not my particular cup of tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Siggy's Good Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

O9Paok4f8JLb9e8NYGSylQ.text: My friend and I came here because it was tagged as "Vegan" on Yelp.  My friend is Vegan and I can't eat eggs, so we thought this would be a great place that would be able to accommodate us both.  Our waiter seemed annoyed with us from the get-go, since we weren't ready to order immediately upon being seated.  Then he was annoyed that we were disappointed there were no french fries (only roasted potatoes - apparently this place only has healthy food) to go with the burgers.    We asked about our food restrictions, and the waiter assured my friend that the hamburger bun was vegan.  He then began to needle my friend about being vegan and lecture her about how she wasn't a very good vegan if she wanted french fries, which was totally inappropriate for him to comment on.  When it was my turn to order, I asked what kind of bread the hamburger bun was, and he said brioche.  I expressed shock that they had an eggless brioche, and he said yes, it was True.  Then he eventually agreed to double check... well lo and behold, he comes back to the table and admits that he was wrong, the brioche had egg in it, and therefore was not vegan at all.  So our only option for a burger at this place was to get it in a wrap with roasted potatoes.  Since this was no longer the burger meal we had envisioned, we decided to leave and go elsewhere.    The waiter followed us to the exit, still heckling my friend about how being vegan was not a valid dietary choice, how it wasn't as good as just eating healthy foods, how the oil that fried foods are cooked in was not vegan, etc etc etc until my friend was in tears and having an anxiety attack.  It was a very unpleasant experience, plus we still had to go elsewhere to eat.  The other employee at the front of the restaurant witnessed this part of the interaction and half-heartedly apologized for the waiter's behavior, but it did not seem like anyone took it all that seriously or was concerned about telling the waiter that kind of hassling of customers over their dietary choices was incredibly inappropriate, particularly at a restaurant that advertises itself as vegan.  Especially where the waiter's ignorance of the ingredients in the food nearly led the customers to eat non-vegan food.      I called the restaurant and left a message a week ago for management to convey our experiences, but I never received a return call, so I am posting here instead.

EenQl-8JqTyoAiXiMijR_A.text: Came here with some friends, and got to admit that their ambiance is great.  Their wait staff is also really accommodating so overall non-food rating is 5 stars.    Drinks are $6-$8 for an organic smoothie, which is too expensive for me to swallow, even if they make it with organic and locally sourced fruits and vegetables.  If it was perhaps $4-$6 I would consider it.  To be fair, the price of the high quality goods is quite high, but there just isn't much reason for me to buy a drink so expensive.    Now on to food.  I got the salmon burger ($11) with a side of roasted potatoes (+$4).  The salmon burger was alright, 3.5 stars for the food but by itself I'm not too comfortable with what they offer for that price.  It was under-seasoned and the mayo dressing was slightly too heavy.  Roasted potatoes were actually roasted sweet potatoes, which I didn't order but I ate anyways.  They were seasoned all right, but very mushy, as if they boiled it and then gave it a light roast afterwards.  Just overall not what I was looking for when I ordered roasted potatoes.  2 stars there.    Oh and an organic cider goes for $6.    Overall I think this will be a great place to go if you were dining with a health conscious or vegan friend, but since most of my friends don't care all that much about organic or locally sourced and all that, I'll probably pass on this place for now.  Food is good, price is somewhat steep.

bUfbNiSeeGAryAqeJdpIeA.text: A cute eclectic little restaurant in Noho that's great for vegetarians and meat eaters alike. I've been several times, everything is deliciously made with fresh / organic ingredients, and a few things really stand out.  The parsley hummus is like none other. It's a contender for possibly the best hummus I've had in my life - no joke. The bread that comes with it is chewy and fluffy and really addicting. And the olive oil on the side has a bit of a kick to it   Like everyone else has said, the salmon burger is super tasty and moist. It has just enough seasoning and dressing to make it delicious, while still keeping it simple. There aren't a zillion condiments and fixings like some other burgers I've had.   On the smoothies side: the green alien quencher is refreshing and makes me feel like I've done a good deed for my body because it's green and has vegetables in it. The spa skin secret (pineapple, mango, coconut milk, yogurt, honey) is also satisfyingly thick and creamy

mfCKhkSHtwbMnfMNxIPExg.text: Great place overall. The vibe is really easy going and friendly. The food is absolutely amazing. The seating is better than your normal NYC sardine can seating. The decor is well done and I love the whole aliens thing happening inside. Location is perfect too as it doesn't get overly crowded on Elizabeth. I highly recommend this place to anyone in the area. If you are a vegan or vegetarian and are looking for good places you can go out to eat this should definitely be on your list. Servers are really nice and attentive. The place is clean and so is the immediate outer area. I like the fact that it is on a nice clean block. Go eat here! If you work in the NoHo SoHo area this should be a lunch regular!!!

R-HmY7mq_lW7vv3r-FLx3w.text: Oh Siggy's, how I love you.     Siggy's has so many options for the gluten-sensitive diner, even gluten-free beer! When I visited, the staff was attentive and super friendly and the atmosphere was warm, inviting, and upbeat. Fun place to grab a bite.  I had a turkey burger with a gluten-free bun. It came with onions and salad greens. The burger was seasoned with a (non-spicy) curry flavor, which I wasn't so sure I'd like at first but it was just perfect; the burger was really well-seasoned and delicious.  I inhaled the burger and then my server Eddie (who was awesome) helped me choose from the dessert options. I picked the gluten-free vegan chocolate chunk cookie.  It was so good, I swear I tasted butter! Crunchy on the edges, soft and chewy in the center, with many BIG chunks of chocolate - this was the real deal. Eddie told me after that I could have had it heated up with coconut milk ice cream.  I will be back for sure! :)

a_KR4v1zG60hcMtwHd0Gfg.text: The music is too loud! It makes everyone talk unnecessarily louder.  It's not a a club yeah?  So easy with the volume please! (Minus one star) but the atmosphere is really cute and cozy. Makes a good date night!  I like the food! The salmon burger is great! Chocolate chip cookie is really good too!!  I wasn't too crazy about the salad but apparently you can put a patty on top of the salad so maybe next time I'll try a salad with the salmon patty :)  I like their smoothies especially the one with the goji berries.  The chocolate chip cookie is a must.

j1OaFajwe3A-ztFOXt0U0A.text: My 1st 5 stars! It was that good!  My friend took me here yesterday [Thursday night] The service was great. Waiter was very kind & friendly. Made sure we were content without being too intrusive. Even as we left, we had 2 "good byes & thank you" from workers/cashier/boss maybe?  Now the FOOD. Granted I was hungry, but still. I ordered a Salmon burger because yelpers recommended it. Wow!! I inhaled it & finished it quickly. I couldn't stop eating it. I finished my plate clean. No crumbs anything remaining haha. The salmon was soft w/ a unique fried texture. The salad w/ it was fresh. The bun was soft but not soggy. The avocado & mayo made the dish fabulous & tasteful. Especially the mayo.  I was really contemplating on taking one home to eat again, but I stopped myself =) Never knew healthy / organic food could taste so good. I was shocked.  We also ordered kale w/ garlic, also good. My friends ordered the chicken soup & chicken cutlet hero, which they enjoyed also.  The dessert was not that great though, so skip that.

xq6eAWDfKKZDL9ykrZKj7A.text: Good food indeed. There are many kinds of foods that I'm sure would satisfy all kinds of human beings (and aliens from outer space) here at Siggy's. The best thing is the price. Now it's not McDonald's cheap, but it's cheap for food that is organic, prepared well, tastes good, and won't give you the dreaded bathroom visit an hour after eating.   It's a very discreet place, dark and awesome. I ordered pickup since I like to eat at home (it's awesome, try it) and I got the quinoa & spinach cakes that everyone seems to rave about and the salmon burger.   The quinoa & spinach cakes come with 2 patties topped with their tomato/cilantro salsa. Damn is the salsa good but the cake leaves something to be desired. I wish it had texture y'know? Maybe crispy on the outside and soft and "quinoa-ey" on the inside. A crab cake texture is what I was imagining but it was all soft and sort of mushed together in your mouth. Tasted okay, but the salsa saved it.   The salmon burger was damn good. Best salmon burger I've had ever. Good big piece of salmon, avocado, lettuce and their mayo on a brioche bun (but can be substituted for 7 grain, gluten free bun, wrap or naked on top of lettuce). Damn damn damn was it good. I definitely recommend getting that.   I look forward to my next run where I end up at Siggy's and try the other items on their menu.

3qHsSFZR3OfkobdP7zSRig.text: Bravo for making Gluten Free taste so good.    Hubs has a dietary restriction, so going out is tough at times, but man oh man did Siggy's ever come through for us.  We both thoroughly enjoyed our dinner, and hubs practically inhaled the GF beer they had.  He doesn't care for most GF beers (poor guy, he was a former craft brew fanatic and now he's reduced to this) so it was exciting for him to try a new one and to actually enjoy it.  Mac n' cheese (Non-GF) was ok.  The lentil garlic soup was amaziballs.  Hubs had the burger (on a GF bun, of course) and was thoroughly engrossed in his food, so I'm pretty sure it was a hit with him.    Oh, and Siggy herself was in the kitchen and bouncing around the restaurant.  Thanks for offering healthy, quality food with GF options, Siggy!

Kw5agp2SHSxjNPTsYPmiMw.text: Siggy's has tasty, nicely-priced food.  A big plus are organic, locally grown ingredients.  There's a vegan selection too. They serve wine and organic beer. We tried the Turkey burger (only small complaint is tasteless side of sweet potatoes), Beef stew, Quinoa avocado salad and a Salmon dinner. It was accompanied by Zinfandel and white bread with olive oil. I have to admit, the turkey burger was super-delicious! Service was good.  The decor is inviting. I will be back!

7EtwZbc8UbUY0d_1UthvmQ.text: I wish I were an alien, so that I could eat for free at Siggy's (as their sign claims), though come to think of it, I don't actually mind paying for such healthy, tasty food. This place is great for groups too - bottles of wine are extremely reasonable, and there's enough variety in the menu that it'll satisfy vegans and carnivores alike. You can also call ahead for reservations.

-sYquQ4ob9el0GhYoaaDVw.text: What's not to love about a place that makes delicious, fresh food that's great for you. Definitely try something as simple as the lentil soup or turkey sandwich or something as complex as the salmon burger and sweet something juice. Be prepared to go on a health food kick for the next month if you continue to order from here.

f_UwNlulBQYCMppphOhfXg.text: Came here last week during lunch after searching for a "healthy" spot to eat.  found this place on Yelp and so glad I did.  I had the Splendid Raw Slaw with Sesame Kale & Cabbage and my +1 had the Eggplant Veggie & Tofu Lasagna .  We shared the Black Bean Sweet Potato Cakes.  Everything was so freakin' delish!  I couldn't even tell that there was no meat in the lasagna.  The salad was a big mound of veggies and goodness.  I'm totally going to back here to try something else sometime this week. Who knew eating raw would taste this good?!?

mun70xYVHbOIU9ubur5pxw.text: I LOVE YOU SIGGY'S!  Not quite sure where to begin.. the food, the organic beer/wine, the staff, the atmosphere, the amazing vegan/gluten free chocolate brownie sundae. Phew.. this place is fantastic.  My friend and I were in need of a tasty meal where we could soak up each other's company having not seen each other in ages. Siggy's went from a restaurant we had never heard of to what felt like our makeshift living room in a matter of 10 minutes.   We both shared the Greek avocado salad and parsley hummus. The hummus was exceptional, which says a lot from me because I am not always a huge fan of hummus j(ust one of those things). Avocado salad was the perfect amount of fluffy greens, quinoa, avoc, and a light lemon dressing. We also split the garlic herbs & artichoke pasta. I would hold this dish to one of the top pasta dishes I have ever had - comparing to authentic Italian pastas. It was that good! Highly recommend Siggy's for a guilt free indulgence on dinner!

0onkV7_ym1PjmzY3cGNl6A.text: Siggy's Good Food is such a neat little place that it's almost too good to be True. If you care about eating prepared organic food without paying exorbitant prices, this is it!   Yes, many eateries and formal restaurants have organic options these days but it seems more of a marketing trick as you never know quite what goes into your meal - the greens may be organic, but what kind of oil did they use to cook the burger, or the chicken? Did they use organic cold-pressed olive or vegetable oil or did they use cheap, non-organic, genetically modified Canola type oil in order to save on the cost of your meal? Did they use sea salt or cheap bleached table salt? It isn't enough that the greens are organic, or that one component of the meal is organic. Every ingredient has to be the healthiest available. I am not 100% sure of what goes into Siggy's food, but from what I've seen at the restaurant, from tasting my food, and the information on the menu.. it seems pretty certain that they use excellent ingredients.  One thing about prices... they are really cheap considering the cost of organic food. I buy organic food at the supermarket and it would cost me MORE to buy the ingredients at Whole Foods so considering the quality of the food, the prices are very, very good!   As for taste, everything we have had here is delicious. Not just health-food delicious (meaning the taste is acceptable as a trade-off for healthy ingredients - some people seem to think healthy food must be bland). It's plain delicious. We've had the salmon burger, chicken in garlic sauce (a daily special), turkey burger, sweet potatoes as a side, eggplant lasagna, kale salad. I recommend them all. Not to mention.. they gave us take out in a PAPER container rather than one of those ghastly plastic things that finds its way into a landfill to slowly degrade and leach chemicals for hundreds of years (if we won't destroy the planet before).  Whenever I am in the area, I will make my way to this place. If you care about good, clean food, about supporting organic farmers that don't poison the soil/water/air (and us), then support this place with your money. Thank you!

dNxgs_DdhNAwO8Y1a3dQyA.text: Love love LOVE Siggy's. They's especially great for anyone eating gluten free or vegan/vegetarian, but my friends without dietary restrictions also love going with me to Siggy's because there's such great selection.  I've had Siggy's eggplant lasagna (noodleless and vegan!) as well as their garlic artichoke/kale pasta, and both are FANTASTIC. However, what has brought me to yelp to give these kudos was their Salmon burger. Oh. My. God.  Best salmon burger I've ever had, by far -- and definitely one of the top 5 salmon dishes I've ever tasted!!  The other reviewers who promoted the salmon burger were not lying. It was so good that I've been craving another one and it's only been a few hours since dinner! If you're going to Siggy's for the first time, get the salmon burger, you WILL be hooked!  The only thing that would make me give Siggy's 5 stars is if they had a better policy on accommodating gluten free patrons. After explaining that I have celiac, the waiter explained that they can't guarantee any of their dishes to be 100% safe from cross contamination. I understand that they need to have this disclaimer, but they're such a gluten free friendly place with menu items labeled and special gluten free bread/beer, I feel like they should go the extra step and take 100% precaution against cross contamination. Now, I've never had a problem eating there in terms of getting glutened, but every time they explain they can't guarantee my meal safe, it still makes me feel nervous!  Other than that, everything else about Siggy's is perfect. Wholesome food, great flavor, reasonable price, and friendly staff. Highly recommend it if you're a conscientious eater!

aEwnKLh9kInNiLbi2ANcsg.text: I got the spinach quinoa wrap and it was great. There are lots of vegan options as well as options for meat eaters, so it's perfect for anyone. My only complaints are that the music was much too loud and annoying. Also our table rocked back and forth with every bite. The atmosphere besides that is really cute. Overall great place for a quick, healthy bite that will satisfy everyone in your party. Just don't expect to be able to hear your friends or your server.

dGl6keZm2KkI6I9mOECkMw.text: I had the salmon burger and it was great ! The environment was cosy and the staff was nice :)

5SZdSfLurigRh66brL3GbQ.text: The food is excellent, and the service is great, but something happened tonight that makes me never want to return. We had a great waiter - he was answering our questions, taking good care of us. All of a sudden the woman who we came to find out was the owner, came rushing on to the floor, we witnessed her grab one female server by the arm aggressively, and then pulled our waiter over, and in front of a restaurant full of people, reprimanded him and fired him. It was completely inappropriate and unprofessional. Unless your employee is causing bodily harm, there is no reason you can't wait until the end of a shift, or at very least pull him into the kitchen or your office. This woman seems like a tyrant, and I do not want to support an establishment where the employees are treated with such disrespect. Given her lack of management skills I don't know how she managed to hire such great people in the first place, but she's not treating them the way they deserve to be treated.

HVxp6cZs3sqNUbge52ZoRg.text: Absolutely a great place for vegetarians! I had the live earth salad (with parmesan cheese). It was fresh, delicious and filling. The atmosphere was fun -- relaxed, hip, and totally unpretentious -- similar to the Brooklyn Heights Siggy's but in a larger, brighter space.  Though I didn't get a smoothie or a juice the offerings were impressive and included a make your own option!

sHRPAxNv49WDEFcP_fovkw.text: Great food. I had the chicken soup and the burger which were great! The place itself is very nice and has this classic restaurant look.  One this was a little bit disturbing, one of the waiters was really mad / sad and the service from was like asking him for a favor or something.  Except of that, I really recommend this place!

FNFXLfOTQQ4dUMrXTue2Pg.text: Siggy's is a wonderful find. The food is fast, affordable, reasonably healthy and delicious. To make the experience even better, when my party of three arrived at prime brunch time on a Saturday, there was no wait. I had the breakfast burrito and a mimosa-- the mimosa was a bit overpriced but both it and the burrito were truly delicious. The pico de gallo and avocado were especially fresh and the mushrooms were hearty, almost like meat. I highly recommend this place and I'll definitely be coming back.

jKsaNXTQGfoms0huTjdiIQ.text: Good food and great atmosphere. If you don't want to go full vegan for the night you definitely have many options from chicken to beef and all of them were delicious and fresh.

tTUl_ISJULqJSAFmYfQixg.text: Went here with a dairy free, but not vegan, friend from out of town. She had the salmon dish of the day, which was a pesto salmon with a small salad and rice and I had the turkey burger. Both meals were incredibly seasoned, flavorful, and delicious. The organic cider was great as well. Service was very fast at first, but did slow down when the place filled up for dinner. Would definitely recommend this to vegans, vegetarians, and meat eaters!

eMHPRRtfKToQclMTfL-SGA.text: Solo brunch and the first meal after my detox. I ordered the chili soup and the Quinoa Spinach Cakes. The soup was ok, but really really loved the cakes.   portions are on the smaller side, unless you just came off on a juice detox in which case it's the most food you've had in days.

buhnj3v4jtJVyCsYM2EJCg.text: I came here with my sister for dinner and we were amazed at how delicious the food tasted. For starters we had the hummus (DELICIOUS). I had the Red Beets, Orange & Almond Salad (DELICIOUS) and my sister had the Eggplant Veggie & Tofu Lasagna (DELICIOUS). Notice a pattern? Our waitress was very nice and came over every once in a while to make sure things were good. They were! :) We are big on eating food that does a body good and after having a co-worker recommend this place to me, we were definitely left wanting more. We will be back.  SOON!

u57C_rxf0FvOhoZwLJn0Fw.text: Siggy's is always a safe bet. Lots of options, even for vegetarians, vegans and the gluten free crowd. I've never been disappointed by a dish. I'd been to the Brooklyn location which is a little too cozy for comfort, so I appreciated that the NoHo spot had a little more breathing room.

fpWgAqucAMOwsdBGi-09XQ.text: Came here with a group of friends on a recommendation and we were told to leave because we hadn't ordered enough. We were happy to change our orders so we could stay but we were practically kicked out before we had the chance. Pretty negative treatment for a place that supposedly preaches positivity. I understand that some establishments need to enforce a minimum spend, but if that is the case, politely explaining this to customers should be the first step - not accusing them of purposely taking up a good table and wasting everyone's time, which is not at all what we had intended! In the end we changed our orders, spent about $5 more per person, but were left with a bad taste in our mouths. Worth it? The food was fine but we won't be back after that treatment.

utiBZuKV29NS9XBh5CqpYQ.text: Just fantastic. Try the baby artichokes! You can't get a restaurant this awesome outside of a major city and I cherish being able to eat delicious food that happens to be meatless.

XaVzI5hExRF54eAq77cbRg.text: The lasagna was tasty. The mint iced tea also had a lovely flavor.   Gigantic portions

bwR3DJIbKWX0YigksALfmA.text: This place surprised me.  I went in to chill and just drink, but decided to have a burger...Best choice of my food life.  I have been going there since.  So good, so fresh, so organic.  My mind and my body loves this place!  Thanks Siggy!!!

JPjrTkCWGWiBkwf7QFU5Bg.text: This place is pretty mediocre.  The failed attempts at being alternative and unique with the mild alien decor is confusing and does not at all match up with the staff (which is unfriendly at best).  The food is pretty basic, no better than any other health conscious eatery in the city.  The menu is bland and unexciting, definitely on the pricier side.  Not impressed.

Q3rfYxVrDOsi72nN-IAJ7g.text: Noisy and very crowded, which usually means "popular" and the food is the reason. Good food, whether you're looking for vegan, vegetarian or neither. Friendly staff. Very reasonable prices for NYC. Great neighborhood.

oJSjBiZKLlceZ-xGMT5nDg.text: Just made my first foray to Siggy's for brunch. The food was clean, well balanced, simple and well defined. The atmosphere was airy and comfortable and the prices were modest. Especially considering the all organic/local ingredients and the locale. I work in the neighborhood, so I am thrilled that there will be healthy fare and organic juices available at lunch time. Good, good food!

jgbSr6NY9XulGDfm1c8CJQ.text: Amazing food, really fresh and healthy. Great selection of vegetarian stuff like black bean & sweet potato burger-like-things. And delicious veggies! Plus, great service. This place wins.

0gdvH4n_BzLWZD1sQ6GSmw.text: Hands down this is our FAVORITE restaurant in New York. Breakfast lunch and dinner you are promised to have quality food served. Siggy is the best she cares about the quality of the food #1 and you can taste it. If you are gluten free but love good food that doesn't taste like plastic I highly suggest this restaurant!

_PMq7T0B2BUX5QzkEeb7ZA.text: I ordered some kind of super salad and requested they add a salmon fillet to it and guess what... It was great. Not fancy,  just fresh and good. Had a decent glass of organic wine to boot. I will return!

Lk_HEt8adkbH35Fovmrp8A.text: I cannot rave enough about Siggys! I wish there were more menus like this around the country. Healthy, fresh options. The service was just okay but I'm willing to overlook it because if the delicious food. Can't wait to eat here again!

Fsm8KW_Zz4i35OmsXP2YAw.text: I am a big fan of siggys.  I come here once a month to get my healthy food fix.  I used to always eat at the bk heights location when I used to live around there.  I am so happy they opened up a Manhattan location.  Everything on the menu is very good.  The juices are good as well!  There usually isnt a wait here and its good for groups.

QrrN-cYfX3YxsqzujFsmVQ.text: Excellent quality and price. The wait staff is very good. It is easy to order vegan and gluten-free that actually tastes good. Gluten-free is cross-contaminated but I have not had an issue yet and the staff has been very attentive. Non-alcoholic beverage selection could be improved- it would be nice to order some regular sodas.  I only wish they had more locations!

oJuwmQA7XGIWSweLiQDgDw.text: Was recommended this restaurant by a random girl I met at a bar - we talked about healthy eating and vegetarian options around the city.  She recommended this place, which I had never heard of.    I tried this out with a friend the week after.  It's conveniently and discreetly located close to Houston street, near wholefoods.   I passed the street the first time.  The server was friendly and helpful with recommendations,    I had the garden veggie sandwich, with hot tofu strips.  It was good, one of the better veggie sandwiches in NYC.    However, since it's so close to whole foods (my go to spot), i have yet to be back here.
